loans.name: Atugonza Farmers Group

texts.en: Simon is a 42 year old, hard-working man living in Kagadi-Uganda. A father of four, he trades liquor and does farming to generate income. He hopes to grow his business, though challenged by bad weather making roads impassable. Simon is asking for a loan to buy liquor for selling. He is a member of Atugonza Farmers where members guarantee each other to access a loan. No securities are pledged.

loans.use: to buy liquor for selling.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el de dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) sus dos hijos mayores le ayudan en las siembras, tiene 22 años de  experiencia en el rubro, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y para pagar el alquiler de parcela  y así seguir con sus siembras para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 48 years old. He lives in his own house with his three children. He grows basic grains (corn and beans). His two older children helps him with the planting. He has 22 years of experience in this field. He sells his products in the surrounding towns. What he earns from his sales, he can take care of some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc and to pay the rent for the land. He will be able to continue with his crops, so he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to pay the rent for the land

loans.name: Emerliza

texts.en:
Emerliza sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy farm supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional fertilizer and supplies she needs in maintaining her farm. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Emerliza wants to always have prosperous and fruitful harvests throughout the year. She hopes that her family is safe and healthy everyday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Floresa

texts.en:
Floresa is a 25-year-old woman with a five-year-old dependent. She hails from Talibon, Bohol. Floresa raises and sells hogs to make a living. She has been in this business for four years now. Aside from that, she also does farming. She is in need of capital to continue financing her hog-raising livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to purchase feeds for the pig and fertilizer. The feed enables Floresa to raise quality and healthy hogs. In a few months, she will be able to sell it to her customers. Thus, her income will become stable and she will be able to do some business expansion to become more sustainable.

Floresa is very grateful for the loan that is available to her, and she is determined to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pig and fertilizer

loans.name: Julian Jr.

texts.en:
This is Julian. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and pay their expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Julian hopes to buy another unit of tricycle which he could also use for transportation services. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Habil's Group

texts.en:
Habil is 70 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Habil has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. And, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Habil also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Habil's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Agnes is representing her group of 13 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Agnes has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also two solar lights, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Agnes is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 5.75 acres will be planted by Agnes's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights

loans.name: Roda's Group

texts.en:
Roda is 53 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is said to be a very reliable person. Even though Roda is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Roda started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Roda’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Abahinzi Group

texts.en: Liberee is a group leader who is 33 years old. The group name is ABAHINZI which means means “GROWERS” in English. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 8. She owns a shop and she has been doing this business for the past eight years. The group members sell different items and they have the same ideas for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more books, pens, Colgate, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens, Colgate, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Las Vieloentas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario las violentas está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, quienes trabajan día a día para superarse. Solicitan por cuarto ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM para incrementar el capital de trabajo de sus negocios. La coordinadora es Fátima  de 35 años, casada, madre de dos niños de 9 y 12 años de edad, quienes han sido su mayor motivación para seguir superándose, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 10 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de calzones, brasieres, lencería lovable, calcetines y trastes de plástico. La segunda socia es Leyken de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, la tercer socia es María de 28 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: This group, called “Las Violetas,” is made up of three striving ladies who work every day to improve themselves.  They are asking for a loan, through ADIM, to increase their working capital for their businesses.  Fatima is the group’s coordinator.  She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children ages 9 and 12 who have been her main motivation to continue to improve herself.  She has been selling undergarments for 10 years and is asking for a loan to buy underpants, bras, lingerie, socks, and plastic plates.  The second member is 24 year old Leyken who sells fruits and vegetables.  The third member is Maria, who sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en:
Japeth is a native from Getafe, Bohol. He earns a livelihood by selling fish. He is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish to the locals in his place. He is a 24-year-old man with a one-year-old dependent.

He has been engaged in fishing for three years now.

He has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets. This tool is very essential in augmenting his day-to-day fishing activity. It could improve his ongoing catch and sell of high quantity of fish. In the long run, he could now handle his finances and ability to pay his obligation, thus, providing his family with nutritious meals.

Japeth is hopeful that he could expand his fishing business to be able to own a small fishing boat in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing material like fishing nets

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. She is thankful for the loan assistance that was granted to her. She has used the loan to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marites wants for her business to continue to thrive and she also desires to give her children a better future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, thread, and other materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.en:
Urumuri is a group led by Josiane, who is 31 years old. The group name means “right” in English. The group members all have the same idea for how to change their lives, and they sell different items.

Josiane is married with seven children aged between seven months and nine years. She has a shop and has been in business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Daysi Mirian

texts.es:
Miriam, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Miriam, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposo para realizar sus actividades diarias.

Miriam, se dedica a comercializar mariscos, este negocio se lo enseño su madre, mientras su esposo trabaja en la parcela que alquila junto a sus hijos.- En el transcurso de la tarde, se dedica a comprar mariscos para salir a venderlos el siguiente día, en los alrededores de su comunidad. 

Miriam, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, semilla y veneno para poder sembrar en esta temporada e incrementar sus ingresos.

Miriam, sueña con continuar con su venta de mariscos y comprar vacas para producir leche para vender.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old. She completed sixth grade. She is married and her husband is involved in farming. Miriam wakes up at 4:30 a.m. with her husband to perform their daily tasks. 

Miriam sells seafood. She learned this business from her mother. Her husband works on the land rented next to their children. During the afternoon, she buys seafood to sell the next day in areas surrounding her community. 

Miriam needs the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming this season in order to increase her earnings. 

Miriam dreams about continuing with her seafood sales and purchasing dairy cows so that she can sell their milk.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds for farming this season

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Josephine, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children. She is known by her community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Josephine joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Josephine plans to buy a cow.

Between the 16 farmers in Josephine's Group, a total of 9.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
RUQIYA is the age of 50; she is married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchases goats, billy goats, bull calves, heifers etc. from rural areas, raises them, and then sells them into the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock which is very tough for him in old age. He is engaging in efforts and generating money for the survival of both of them. 

He wants to buy billy goats to sell on the Eid-ul-Azha because many people like to buy billy goats to immolate on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable but he does not have enough savings to buy billy goats.

Therefore, RUQIYA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy billygoats to sell after raising them and can earn maximum profit for living with peace and calm.

RUQIYA is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to help RUQIYA's husband in purchasing goats, billy goats, bull calves, and heifers

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermín de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo tiene 15 años de experiencia el cual inicio con capital propio, adicional a eso también posee un molino de nixtamal, con las ganancias que obtiene  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fermín is 58 years old. He lives in his own home with his son. He grows corn and sorghum. He has 15 years of experience. He started with his own capital. He also has a corn mill. From these earnings, he is able to take care of some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pest controls to improve the land seen in the photograph. He will be able to continue with his work in order have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control and herbicides

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman and they have been relying on fishing and seaweed farming for a living. For more than two decades, this has been their source of income.

Josephine is asking for a loan to buy plastic rope, seaweed seedlings and to pay for labor. She hopes that she can expand her business with the loan and make better profits.

Her income will be used for her two-year-old son's needs like milk and diapers, food for the family and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope, seaweed seedlings and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Redemption

texts.en:
Redemption is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a 43-year-old mother to four children ages two to twelve.

Redemption manages a sari-sari (variety) store, selling items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. In addition to this, she has been in the fishing business for 13 years. At present, she needs to buy fishing tools but lacks the capital to do so. A loan of 12,000 PHP would help Redemption to buy a new engine and fishing nets.

In the future, Redemption would like to expand her business to support her family and to save, so she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years now and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Edna would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Edna hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and that she will always be able to help her family. She dreams of expanding her business and giving her family a life of good strength and health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Twiyubakiricyizere Group

texts.en:
Grace is a group leader and is aged 34. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 13 years, and three of them go to school.

The group is called Twiyubakiricyizere, which means “Build Yourselves” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their future for the better.

Grace sells food stuffs and has been doing a business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans for selling

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 47 years old. He is married with five children aged between 13 and 23. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past seven years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Grace has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Grace also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Grace's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Agaciro Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Agaciro, which means means “value” in English. The group members all have the same idea for how to change their lives, and they sell different items.

Edith is the group leader, and she is 48 years old. She is married with two children aged seven and 22 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans, and green bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, and green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is aged 56 years. She is married with five children aged 7 and 21 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 9 years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children, and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for growing maize.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran lives with his wife in the village Shishkert of Syunik region. They have a school-age daughter. Seyran has had higher education; he graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Institute and he has a specialty of veterinary. 

Never managing to work in his specialty, Seyran worked for several years as an accountant, but now his only occupation is farming. On his farm he has 20 beehives and 20 chickens. 

He says that both for him and his wife it is a great pleasure taking care of their bees. Their farm’s honey is very tasty, healing, and in great demand. In the spring and autumn period they sell a lot of honey to villagers, their neighbors, and also to their regular customers from the city. They also sell eggs and poultry from their farm. Seyran also cultivates potatoes, beans, and greens on his land. 

Thanks to the sale of all these farm products, Seyran provides for his family and also takes care of his farm. Now he needs this loan, as he wants to buy several beehives as well as potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and fertilizer for his sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy several beehives, and also to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and fertilizer for his sowing activities

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan is 43 years old and the father of three, ranging in age from 6 to 10. They live in a village in southeastern Albania where Artan works in a quarry and his wife is a seamstress. They both receive a pay of $380/month. Rural activities are not possible for them because they own no land and since this is the case they cannot have animals. Usually villagers plant the fodder and other types of food for their animals on their land. Otherwise, it becomes very expensive to feed animals.

The reason for this loan is that Artan wants to make some necessary repairs to the home where his three young children live with a lack of sanitation and hygiene. "My young kids have been living under conditions that are not healthy at all. I am responsible for improving their living and I must do some repairs to the home," said Artan.

loans.use: to repair his home where his three kids live with a lack of sanitation and hygiene.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: José cuenta con 39 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace varios años. Él siempre se ha caracterizado por ser trabajador y responsable, por lo que desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra, sembrando granos básicos y hortalizas de las cuales vende una parte y deja otra para el consumo de su familia. José sueña con tener una vivienda más grande que le permita brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 39 years old. He has lived with his partner and their young four-year-old daughter in their own home for several years. He has always been known for being hard-working and responsible. For many years, he has been a farmer growing basic grains and vegetables. He sells some of them and his family consumes a portion of them. José dreams about having a larger home which will allow him to give his family greater comfort. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to expand his home.

loans.use: invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to expand his home.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda toils the land and engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. Luzviminda is a married woman with four grown children.  She has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years and is in need of capital to finance the yield of her farm. She resides in Talibon, Bohol.

Luzviminda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.  These will improve the yield of her farm so she could harvest high quality rice. With these, her income will be augmented and she will be able to handle her finances. She could now set aside some savings for emergency use. 

In the future, Luzviminda is strong enough to handle her farming livelihood to become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia owns and operates a furniture manufacturing business. She accepts orders for items like drawers, cabinets, chairs and many others. She is a 38-year-old married woman with six dependents. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is nine months old. She decided to take a loan to continue operating her small source of income.

Letecia has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase plywood, wood, and other materials for making furniture. With this loan, she will be able to fulfill the orders of her customers and able to deliver orders on time. Her income will slowly increase, and she will be able to provide her children with a proper diet.

She hopes that, with the capital she obtains, she will be able to expand her furniture shop to become sustainable in the coming years and also to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, wood, and other materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Muharakani Group

texts.en:
Gertrude, who is in her early 40s, is a widow and has three grown-up children. She has been buying and selling pigs since 2001. She works from 6am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the pig stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to take care of herself, the loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy pigs to resell and to start selling chicken. She dreams of owning a poultry farm.

Gertrude will share this loan with her loan group Muharakani which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs to  resell and to start selling chicken.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Delia wants to save for the renovation of their house. She also dreams that her business will continue to operate in the coming years. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan had enhanced his business. He was able to buy groceries and other supplies he needed to increase his product inventory. The loan also helped him provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He also operates a transportation business and he is very positive that he can improve his business more if you will let him borrow again an amount of 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of his jeepney. He will also use the loan to pay for the maintenance cost of the unit. Simultaneously, he can sustain the needs of his family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Servando wants to buy another jeepney unit for his transportation business. He only dreams that his children will be able to complete their studies. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance costs of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya lives with his parents in the village of Shishkert in Syunik region. This young man is 30 years old, and he is already a very skilled and prosperous farmer, having a large farm with 15 cows, 20 sheep and 10 beehives. 

On his plot of land he cultivates a great quantity of potatoes, and for this he has his regular customers, re-sellers who buy directly from his farm. With the help of his father, Hrachya also sells mutton and beef to city butchers, as well as some honey to his neighbors. This young man is fantastically active and hardworking, and he says that working all day long he does not notice how the afternoon changes to evening; at night he plans what he will do the next early morning. 

Hrachya requests a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel in order to start large land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel in order to start large land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her husband to have his auto rickshaw fixed, so that he can continue his transportation services.

loans.name: Illiminee

texts.en:
Illumine is 41 years old. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 19 years old. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 30 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to raise.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nkunzurwanda Group

texts.en:
Epiphanie is the group leader, and she is 37 years old. She is married with three children who are between 6 and 13 years old; they all go to school. 

The group is called Nkunzurwanda, which means “I'm proud of Rwanda” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

Epiphanie is a carpenter and she has been doing this business for the past 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wood for making more doors and windows to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more wood for making more doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: Tonin

texts.en:
Tonin is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian lek from you to buy Freze agricultural equipment.

Tonin is a 48-year-old married father of two children in their mid-teens and his family consists of 6 members including his elderly parents.  They live in northern Albania where he’s been practicing livestock farming for the past two years, since prior to this he was living and working in Greece.

Tonin has dairy cows and sells raw milk to nearby dairy farms and also baby calves. He also has some pigs and sells piglets in the local market and has rented some agricultural land from other villagers where he plants only corn, wheat and lucerne (alfalfa) for the animals.

loans.use: to buy Freze agricultural equipment

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 38-year-old man from the town of Bien Unido in Bohol. He is married with nine children, ages 1 to 18. Reynaldo has been engaged fishing for 20 years now. He works hard because of his children's needs. It is quite a challenge for him to have a big family. 

Reynaldo is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a new engine.

Once his need for this is taken cared of, Reynaldo will be able to concentrate on his efforts on managing it well for a better return on his investments. 

Reynaldo plans to expand his business someday. His main dream in life is to be successful in giving his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy an engine

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en:
Welyneth, 28, has a six-year-old daughter. For the past four years, she has owned a sari-sari store in the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. A sari-sari store is a small home-based grocery store that sell basic commodities in a local community. Welyneth sells detergent, insect repellent, biscuits, cooking oil, candies, seasoning, shampoo and salt.  

Welyneth is asking a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, liquor, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, condiments and hog feed to sell in her store.  The loan will allow Welyneth to expand her business, which will improve its sustainability. Welyneth's income will go towards providing a healthy diet for herself and her family, savings, and reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, condiments, and hog feed

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en:
Voskehat is 50 years old and she lives in the frontier village of Aygehovit of Tavush region. Voskehat is divorced now and she brings up her three children alone. She has two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is at the army, passing his military service, and her smaller son and daughter are still school-aged. 

Voskehat for a long time has worked as a milkman. Now she works as a cleaner at the school, and also runs farming and agriculture. On her farm she has pigs and chickens. Her land is rather big, and greatly rich with harvests of potato, beans, carrot and greens, also fruits such as persimmon, fig and grapes. All these harvest and her farm products, such as meat and eggs, she sells at the city wholesale market during the week. 

As she says, she looks for any new occupation and source of income that will lighten her hardships and reduce her family’s needs. 

With this loan amount, she wants to develop her swine breeding and she wants to buy several piglets and also to get prepared for spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also to get prepared for spring sowing activities

loans.name: Hayq

texts.en:
Hayq is 24 years old and he lives in Dilijan city with his parents. Hayq liked farming from a very young age, and now little by little he became very skilled both in cattle care and land cultivation. Now on his farm he has cows, heifers and calves. His farm products, such as milk, macun (a national dairy product) and meat, Hayq sells to his regular customers from his farm. Hayq’s father gives taxi services on his car and he also manages to help his son around the farm. This young man just dreams of making his farm bigger and richer with cattle. 

So he asks  for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, as he wants to buy a calf and also hay for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf and also hay for his farm cattle

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren has already has an one experience of partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon, and he hopes that he will manage to have nice deal for the second time. 

Suren lives in the Achajur frontier village of Tavush region. Here he lives happily with his wife, son, and mother, who is a pensioner. Suren never worked and he has been a farmer for 20 years on the farm that his father established; Suren inherited  it from him. 

On the farm Suren has cows, pigs, a donkey and chickens. From this farm Suren sells meat, eggs and also his land’s beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, and fruits such as apple, persimmon and fig. He sells these products with his wife at the city wholesale market. 

Suren hopes that he will be supported by the Kiva lenders again; this time he wants to buy calves, piglets and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves, piglets and fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group of 16 farmers in Teso District. He is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Stephen has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Stephen is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Stephen's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ervin

texts.en:
Ervin is 31 and a member of the Egyptian Albanian community; he is married and a father of three ranging in age from 2 to 12 years old, with one of the children being diagnosed with some illness.  Their family of seven includes elderly parents, and they live in a little one-room space in the city of Elbasan where the majority of their community has been living in the suburbia for generations or in the basements of apartment buildings under the Communist era. 

Like some other members of this community, he has been re-selling used items to earn a living for all these past ten years. 

Ervin is seeking your financial help to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand inventory clothing to resell

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 39 years old. He lives in the Kutaisi district with his wife, 6-year-old son and pensioner mother. The family owns a cow; they milk the cow every day and produce dairy products to sell. 

Koba wants to open an auto repair workshop. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit he will open a workshop and will repair cars to generate income. 

With the increased income, he will expand the business gradually in future.

loans.use: to open an auto repair workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. for her husband

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. 

Therefore, Nabila has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and drive the rickshaw smoothly. Nabila hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. 

Nabila is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Nabila's husband with the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en:
Ma. Niña, 28, is married and has three young children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband makes a living as a van driver.

Ma. Niña runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells commodities such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, condiments, and toiletries. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, liquor, and assorted chips, to sell in her store. As she will be able to offer more items for sale, Ma. Niña's income will increase. This increase in income will allow her to balance her earnings and repay the loan. 

Ma. Niña hopes that she can provide for her children through her sari-sari business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, and assorted chips to sell in her store

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
Olegario tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de café, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Olegario is 26 years old.  He lives in his own rustic house in the district of Pomahuaca, located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú.  The citizens of this district make a living farming, trading, and raising animals.

He makes a living farming, specifically growing coffee of the Catimore variety.  He has 10 years of experience in this field and has good references in his district.  The loan that he is requesting will be used in agriculture labor, application and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers and labor for weeding his coffee crop.  This will help both physiological, morphological and productive improvement of cultivation, and thus also have a good crop and have better production, a better quality product.  Then he will not have any problems selling his product that will make him better income and allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Pay for labor, application and incorporation of plant protection products, and labor to weed his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
NASEEM is a 43-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband had been driving a wagon in the Lahore city for many years, but now his wagon's engine has been fully depreciated and needs to replace some internal important parts. He has to replace a ring and piston; the maker will open and assemble the engine, which is very costly. He wants to fix the engine as soon as possible, cannot due to lack of fund availability. He is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without driving the wagon. 

Therefore, NASEEM has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; through the addition of this amount her husband can easily fix his wagon. 

NASEEM thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help NASEEM's husband for the maintenance of his wagon.

loans.name: Vangjush

texts.en:
Vangjush, a 31-year-old villager, is a married father of two, 9 and 5 years old; they live in a village in southeastern Albania. In his early 20's he got married and started the agricultural activity. This has been the only source of income for his family. He has a dairy cow from which he sells raw milk to some nearby dairy farm; he also plants in the land he has rented from others, onions, potatoes, beans, red beets, Lucerne and wheat.  To do the transportation of his products, he’s got a horse. His two elderly parents live with him, thus, the father receives a retirement pension of $142/month. 

The loan he is applying for will be used to buy fertilizer for the plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plantations.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 33-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five daughters and two sons. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. 

In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. 

Mumtaz is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband to manufacture iron accessories

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 44 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 9 children, with 5 of them currently in school. 

For the past 17 years Moses has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells drugs. To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and increase stock.

Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to have a sufficient supply of drugs.

loans.use: to buy more drugs

loans.name: Santos Samuel

texts.es:
Santos Samuel tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Huamachuco, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Santos Samuel se dedica al Cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Santos Samuel necesita del crédito para invertir en su cultivo de maíz, realizando el pago de peones y compra de abonos, con la realización de las buenas prácticas agrícolas en su cultivo le permitirá obtener buenos rendimientos. Santos Samuel posee conocimientos en el negocio por lo que se espera será una buena cosecha lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Samuel is 42 years old.  He lives together with his wife and children in the village of Huamachuco, a rural area of the Cañaris district.  The population works in agriculture, commerce, and raising cattle. This district is located in the province of Ferreñafe, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Santos Samuel has grown corn for 15 years.  He has experience in this business, with good personal references and workers in the area.  Santos Samuel needs the loan to invest in his corn crop, make payments to the workers, and buy fertilizers.  By following good farming practices in his crop, it will allow him to get good returns.  Santos Samuel is knowledgeable in the business and hopes that it will be a good harvest that will make him better income that will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Invest in his corn crop, pay workers, and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a prime example of a strong and giving woman who lives with and cares for her husband in a modest manufactured home that is aging and requires several major upgrades. Rosemary’s husband has been recovering from a severe injury that left him unable to work for a period of a few years. This caused great financial hardship to the couple as they fell behind on monthly living expenses, and medical bills began to pile up. During her husband’s recovery, Rosemary’s income has become the primary source of support for the household.

Recently, their daughter suffered the loss of her husband, leaving her with three children to support as a single mother. Rosemary refused to stand by and watch her daughter struggle without assistance, so she and her husband offered everything they could spare to help their daughter through these difficult times. The family has since recovered, and has made significant progress with meeting their financial obligations, but the damage to their credit has hindered their ability to obtain financing for the necessary repairs to their home. 

Rosemary will use her Kiva loan to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help her and her husband cut their energy bills and live comfortably in their home during Florida’s upcoming summer months and years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help her and her husband cut their energy bills and live comfortably in their home.

loans.name: Juan Dionicio

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre que ama el trabajo de campo, a diario vela por que sus siembras estén bien y ninguna plaga se meta en ellas. Es un emprendedor en la agricultura, que actualmente siembra frijol y maíz, para luego venderlos a los distribuidores de granos básicos. Él ya había  sido beneficiado con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, está muy agradecido ya que por este, pudo comprar más semillas y trabajar más parcelas de tierra. 
En estos momentos Juan vuelve a recurrir a Kiva y MiCrédito para que se le brinde un financiamiento que le permita comprar semillas de frijoles, pesticidas, abono, además para contratar mano de obrar y así labrar la tierra. Este es un hombre muy trabajador que en un futuro desea ser un gran agricultor de su región. En sus planes esta comprar un par de vacas y comenzar a producir leche y sus productos derivados.
texts.en:
Juan is a man that loves fieldwork.  Daily he ensures that his seeds are doing well and that no plague has gotten into them.  He is an agricultural entrepreneur, who currently plants beans and corn that he later sells to the distributors of basic grains.  He has already been a beneficiary of a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito.  He is very grateful since with this, he could buy more seeds and work more plots of land.

At this time, Juan returns to Kiva and MiCrédito for funding that will allow him to buy bean seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, and additionally to contract manual labor and thus work the land.  This is a very hardworking man who in the future wants to be a great farmer in his region.  In his plans are to buy a few cows and begin to produce milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase grains.

loans.name: Teonila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Teonila Elizabeth tiene 48 años, es soltera, vive en casa propia con su madre y sus 03 hijos en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, una comunidad con clima caluroso, habitada por gente amable que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería principalmente.

Teonila Elizabeth se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, la cual la ofrece en su casa, pues en su sala tiene mesas y sillas donde atiende a su público, también ofrece el servicio delivery y los fines de semana prepara anticuchos, polladas, entre otras comidas típicas de su región. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de utensilios, platos, vasos y mesas para su negocio, con lo cual seguirá brindando dicho servicio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teonila Elizabeth is 48 years old, is single, and lives in her own house with her mother and her 3 children in a community located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayque region, on the north coast of Perú.  It is a community with a hot climate, inhabited by friendly people who mainly work in agriculture, commerce, and live stock.

Teonila Elizabeth works making and selling food, which she sells in her home.  In her living room, she has tables and chairs where the customers can sit.  She also offers delivery service, and on weekends, she makes kebabs, grilled chicken, among other typical food of her region.  She needs the loan to invest in buying utensils, plates, cups, and tables, for her business.  With this, she will continue to provide this service, which in a short term will allow her to increase her revenue, improve her profits, and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To invest in buying utensils, plates, cups, and tables for her business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. They make enough to meet the expenses of their four children. Currently, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to more customers in order to increase her income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea

loans.name: Meeran

texts.en: Meeran is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been selling fruit for many years. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, healthcare, and clothing; she is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. To improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes, and guavas to meet market demand consistently. This will ultimately enable her to pay her utility bills in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes, and guavas

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, 44, is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 9 years old. She engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. In addition to that, she also engages in raising hogs. She decided to take a loan to finance her existing business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing net and nylon, and to purchase an additional pig and feed. These tools are essential for augmenting both her livelihoods. She could now be able to handle her finances and provide her family with a nutritious diet.

Merlita hopes that she can finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net and nylon, and to purchase an additional pig and feed.

loans.name: Saat

texts.en:
Saat  is a 30-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Saat  makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Saat wishes to use part of her revenues to provide good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour for her store

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en: Shahmeem has successfully built her business of animal sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is on her fourth loan applying for 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to more cities and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to more cities and gain more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José de 44 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace muchos años habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos de 17, 14, 12, 5 y 3 años de edad. Él siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que desde hace 15 años decidió instalar un taller de estructuras metálicas, en el cual elabora piezas como; portones, puertas y balcones de hierro entre otros. José sueña con brindar una mayor protección a sus hijos, es por ello que ha decidido construir un muro que le permita brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José, who is 44 years old, is an entrepreneurial man who for many years has lived in his own house along with his life companion and their five children, ages 17, 14, 12, 5, and 3. He has always looked for a way to raise his family, and for this reason he decided 15 years ago to set up a metal structures workshop, in which he makes pieces such as gates, doors, and balconies of iron, among other items. 

José dreams of offering better protection to his children. It is for this reason that he has decided to build a wall that will allow him to offer better living conditions to his family, and to do this he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a wall at his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a wall at his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wire, and nails to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Fukria

texts.en: Fukria is 49 years old, married with four children and runs a business selling milk with the help of her son who is also shown in the photo. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken out many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good income for improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales.

loans.name: Muskan

texts.en: Muskan is 32 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Muskan ’s husband who is a driver who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. Now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Muskan has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with a new auto body for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Muskan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new auto body for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Drastamat

texts.en:
Drastamat and his lovely wife live in Kadjaran city in Syunik region. Drastamat has a higher education and a specialty in economics. He has run his business for 18 years. In his shop he sells food, vegetables, fruits and great assortment of household goods. He daily receives fresh and tasty warm bread, and also good cakes and sweets from the distributors. His market’s vegetables and fruits (potato, cabbage, onion, greens, apple, orange, lemon, kiwi, persimmon, etc.) he buys from the villagers of his region.  The household goods he also takes from local distributors and in this way he always keeps his market full with assortments and his customers never give up visiting his market daily as here they find the entire products for the first use. 

Drastamat is married and he has two pretty daughters who are married and live with their families. Drastamat needs this loan as he plans to add to his shop's assortments a division for food & drinks, and also more vegetables and household goods as well.

loans.use: add inventory to his store

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is at the age of 40 and is living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her son has been running a mobile phone shop for one year and earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots mobile problems and sells mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable, etc. and provides recharge facilities of different networks. 

Nowadays a lot of demand has increased for accessories and for recharge, and sometimes Hajira's son has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he has already spent all his savings for household expenses. Therefore, Hajira requested a loan for her son so that he can buy additional accessories and more credit for recharge facility. Hajira thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: buy cellphone  accessories and recharge credit

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been running a business making and selling samosa, a fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, lentils or chicken.  She is expert in making good tasting samosa and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family's income. To boost sales, she needs to purchase flour, oil, salt and spices so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 50,000 PKR. She is on her sixth loan with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her increased income to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. 

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, Nasreen began the business of selling milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is known in her town for providing good, quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

Nasreen has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 45-year-old married woman. 

Hanifa is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Hanifa’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Hanifa has requested 45,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers thus providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers thus providing a better standard of living for her family members

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase iron rod coil for making chain.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 35, married and lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Naila purchases clothes at cheap prices with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for four years. Now, she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take out a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to changes in weather and increasing demand she immediately needs to buy clothing.

This is the reason Naila showed interest in taking a out a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She hopes that she will use this loan wisely and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing stock for reselling.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: In the village Kavart in the Syunik region lives Artur with his wife (she works as a saleswoman). Their two daughters are already married and they live with their families.  After many years of working as a driver, Kavart decided to give it up and become engaged in beekeeping. Now on his farm Artur has a lot of beehives and during spring and autumn periods he sells a great amount of honey, mainly to his regular customers, who has been buying his farm’s honey for many years.  Artur asks for this loan amount because with the coming of spring he must buy new frames, wax papers and several important equipment for his bee keeping activities.

loans.use: buy beekeeping equipment

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is engaged in farming. She grows and sells rice.  She is a 26-year-old married woman with three young children. She has been engaged in rice farming for 3 years now. Her husband works as a private employee. She lives in Getafe, Bohol.

Raquel is asking for a loan to purchase  fertilizer to improve the yield of her farm. She could now sells quality rice and augment her income. With that, she can expand her farming livelihood and able to search for any possible business ventures.

Raquel hopes that she would be able to properly manage her business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul is 25 years old and lives with his parents and brother in Kapan city in the Syunik region. This young man has no higher education but he managed to find some proper job for him, through which he helps his family in the solution of many financial problems. 

Tatul used to work at a restaurant as a manager, now he works at the bar as a barman. His mother works as a waitress.  Tatul has a great request and also great hope that Kiva lenders will help him.  He asks for this loan as he has some health problems and with the loan amount he can solve that problem quickly and correctly.

loans.use: pay for healtcare

loans.name: Munazira

texts.ru: Муназзира женщина в возрасте 52 лет. Он замужем и имеет троих детей. По профессии она швея. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Она живет в сельской местности, у нее также есть несколько соток земли, где они вместе с семьёй  выращивает кормовые культуры для скота и другие сельхоз культуры. Муназзира обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Она хочет купить минеральные удобрения. Так как  сейчас время посева. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку .
texts.en: Munazira is 52 years old.  She is married and she has three children.  She is a professional seamstress and a very hardworking woman.  She loves her family and strives to provide the best for them.  She lives in a rural area.  She owns a small plot of land on which, together with her family, she grows forage crops for her livestock as well as other crops.  She has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan.  She wants to buy mineral fertilizers, as it is now the planting season.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Luli

texts.en:
Luli is 68 years old. She lives with her son and his family in Zugdidi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow 150 nut trees. In addition, they have hens.  

Luli wants to start up a business for stable income and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a refrigerated coffin and will rent it out for funerals. This will give her a stable income.

loans.use: buy a funeral coffin

loans.name: Brenda Vanessa

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer honesta y trabajadora, además de ser ejemplo de que con esfuerzo y dedicación se puede superar los temores hacía los nuevos retos. Ella desde hace más de 8 años comenzó –con ayuda de su esposo- su primer negocio en venta de  verduras en el mercado, el que con el tiempo  se volvió  próspero y rentable
Por lo tanto, solicita un crédito para la compra de tomates, chayotes, cebollas, repollo, sandia, papas, etc. Que le ayudará a ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad, en consiguiente sus ingresos aumentaran. Entre los planes de Brenda esta ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Brenda is an honest and hard-working woman, in addition to being an example of how fears of new challenges can be overcome with effort and dedication. More than eight years ago, with the help of her husband, she began her first business, selling vegetables in the market, which with time became prosperous and profitable.

Thus she is applying for a loan for the purchase of tomatoes, squash (chayote), onions, cabbage, watermelons, potatoes, etc., which will help her to offer fresh, quality products, and as a result her income will increase. Among Brenda's plans is expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, squash, onions, cabbage, watermelons, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is 30 years old and  living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to manage her household expenses. She newly setup a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is doing a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products stock is going to be finished and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon business.
 
Hina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.  She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, and combs, for her salon. She hopes that through this loan amount she will be able to enhance her business. She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Hina in purchasing cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, , seizure and comb, for her salon.

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en: Bardhok is a father of two and lives in the northern part of the country. For the past fifteen years, he’s been acting as an ambulant trader of ice creams in his region. “The activity proved to be profitable from the very beginning, so I continued doing it and have been enjoying it so far. Since our country is blessed with warm weather, my activity goes well from April till end of Dec,” said Bardhok to his loan officer. He makes about 10% of the gross profit. “However, the money I make from it is only enough for me. My wife and the oldest son work in Italy because there are no jobs here,” continued Bardhok. The reason for this loan is that he must pay in advance for the ice cream inventory.

loans.use: buy ice cream

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a loving mother of three children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

Sumaira has been doing a business of selling vegetables for many years. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. 

For the improvement of her business, Sumaira contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger to meet market demands consistently, which will ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger to meet market demands consistently, which will ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills in a timely manner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is a 39-years old woman living with her one daughter and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small canteen in a school.  He offers chips, spicy food items, stationery, etc. to the students. He wants to buy burgers and sandwiches as well but he does not have enough money to buy the raw materials. Fozia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva, so that her husband can buy spicy ingredients for making burgers. Fozia is very glad and thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy burger ingredients

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is 40 years old and a hardworking woman who has six children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Her work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Hajira has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces to consistently meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of garments to fulfill the demand.

loans.name: Khilola

texts.ru: Хилола честная трудолюбивая жительница района Шахристон. Она замужем и мать 5 детей. У нее 4 дочери и 1 сын. Хилола 37 лет. Дочкам 12,10, 6 и 2 лет. Сыну 4 лет.
