Ее Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Хилола в районе у себя во дворе занимается животноводством. Она выращивает крупнорогатого скота уже более 5 лет. Хилола обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести крупнорогатого скота и увеличить их численность. С помощью увеличение их численность увеличиться доход. Хилола верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khilola is an honest and hardworking woman who lives in the Shahriston district.  She is married and the mother of five children (four daughters and one son).  Khilola is 37 years old.  Her daughters are 12, 10, 6 and 2.  Her son is 4 years old.  Her husband is a farmer.  Khilola herself raises cattle at home.  She has been involved in this activity for more than five years already.  She is taking a loan to buy additional cattle and increase the size of her herd, as more cattle will bring a higher income.  Khilola relies on you and your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малике 45 лет. Она замужняя женщина из малого района Яван. Ее муж работает механиком. Малика имеет шестерых детей. Двое его сыновей работают разнорабочим, в основном они работают на стройках рабочими. Четверо дочерей учатся в средней школе. Малика понимает, как мужу и сыновьям тяжело обеспечить семью. Она, понимая их, дома занимается животноводством. Она покупает мелких скотин, откармливает их в течение нескольких месяцев и продает с наценкой. Малика хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скотин, с такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. Она верит, что ее поддержат, и она сможет реализовать свой план. Спасибо!
texts.en: Malika is 45 years old.  She is married and lives in the small district of Yavan.  Her husband works as a mechanic.  Malika has six children.  Her two sons work odd jobs but mostly work as laborers on construction sites.  Her four daughters are in secondary school.  Malika knows how hard her husband and sons work in order to support the family.  Eager to help, Malika is involved in animal husbandry.  She buys small livestock, feeds her animals for a few months, then resells them at a higher price.  Malika wants to expand her activity and increase the size of her herd.  With this goal in mind, she has applied for a loan.  She is confident that she will receive some support and that she'll be able to achieve her goals.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy small livestock and to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Varazdat

texts.en:
Varazdat is 21 years old and lives with his parents in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Varazdat’s mother is unhealthy and she is not able to work. His father is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Varazdat does a car repairing service in a rented garage. He is a master in engine repairing. He has a number of regular customers who visit his garage regularly and trust him with their cars. 

Varazdat does his best to provide his mother with good living conditions, and he works all day long without holidays in order not to lose any of his customers and earn more money. He asks for this loan of 400,000 AMD, as he wants to construct a garage near his house, which will save a lot of money because there will be no need to pay for rent. He will also be close to his mother, who needs so much care.

loans.use: to construct a garage near his house, which will save a lot of money.

loans.name: God's Group

texts.en:
Ellis is in his early forties and lives in Teshie with his wife and one dependent child. Ellis prepares and sells electronics appliances to earn his living. He has been engaged in this work for the past 10 years, and he works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every working day. In this way, he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Ellis is requesting his eighth loan from ID-Ghana. He will share this loan with his colleague, Lawrence, and they will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With his previous loans, all of which he has repaid successfully, Ellis was able to improve his business and increase his income. He invested his profits back into his enterprise and also placed a substantial amount into savings with ID-Ghana to save toward household and food expenses. 

Ellis will use his new loan funds to replenish his inventory with new stock. Specifically, he will buy a laptop and TV sets to sell. He dreams of continuing to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and TV sets to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 59, is a married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, 46 years old, supports her family by operating a business selling milk with her husband. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas, while  Farzana ’s job is to look after their buffalo and cows and collect the milk from them. 

In need of more income for their everyday expenditures, Farzana  has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new one. He has been feeding his children, but he belongs to an ultra poor family. Now his children are growing older, and their needs as well. Shaheen has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing is some money short. Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. 

Shaheen is a 46-year-old woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to purchase a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 34 years old, married and he has a son. Armen’s wife works at the musical college as teacher of singing. 

For many years in his native city of Kapan in the Syunik region, Armen has run his own business. In a small space of his own, he sells CDs and does recordings. The place of his market is rather comfortable for his business, and he has no lack of customers. 

With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) Armen is thinking of buying a special coffee-making machine, which he will settle near his market. It may bring more income and also maybe his business will be visited more often.

loans.use: to buy a special coffee-making machine

loans.name: Kerecent's Group

texts.en:
Kerecent is a 45-year-old married father of three and a very experienced farmer. As a group leader, Kerecent is representing 10 farmers in Teso District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Kerecent's desire to make more farming friends in his community. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Kerecent and his group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Yalgash

texts.ru:
Ялгаш жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 24 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Ялгаш живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Ялгаша также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием ребенка.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Ялгаш занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Сейчас Ялгаш хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Ялгаш очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Yalgash, age 24, is a hardworking man with a positive attitude in life. He is married and has one child.  As soon as he heard about the possibility of receiving financial support through MDO Arvand, he immediately contacted them.  Yalgash and his family live in a rural area.  Yalgash doesn't have a higher education because his parents' difficult financial situation never allowed him to go to university.  His wife is in the same situation; she didn't get an education either and she works as a homemaker, taking care of the household and bringing up their child.

Yalgash makes a living running his own business, fattening and selling cattle.  He now wants to increase his number of animals in order to increase his business.  For this reason, he has turned to MDO Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy additional cattle.  Yalgash is looking forward to a positive outcome, and he thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: Fidencio de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de jocote y granos básicos, posee 18 años de experiencia en ese rubro, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener mejores ingresos y así una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidencio, age 58, lives in his own house with his mother, his wife, and his daughter.  He grows ‘jocote’ [tropical fruit] and basic grains.  He has 18 years of experience in this field.

He sells his products in surrounding villages.  With what he gets from his sales he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will also use the loan to improve the land that is shown in the photo.  He will do this in order to be able to have better earnings and, therefore, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru:
Рачабали жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 46 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-их детей. Он обратился в МДО “Арванд” когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку для развития своего бизнеса.  Сам Рачабали живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не учился Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Рачабали также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Рачабали занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Рачабали в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Рачабали хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в МДО “Арванд” и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Рачабали очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rajabali, age 46, is a hardworking man with a positive attitude in life.  He is married and he has four children. As soon as he heard about the possibility of receiving financial support from MDO Arvand in order to grow his business, he immediately contacted them. Rajabali and his family live in a rural area. He doesn't have a higher education because his parents' difficult financial situation never allowed him to go to university. His wife is in the same situation; she didn't get an education either and she works as a homemaker, taking care of the household and bringing up the children.

Rajabali makes a living running his own business, fattening and selling cattle. He makes a good income from this activity.  His wife also helps him; she sells the milk that they get from their cows.  Rajabali now wants to increase his number of animals in order to increase his business. For this reason, he has turned to MDO Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy additional cattle.  He is looking forward to a positive outcome, and he thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to meet customers' milk supply needs and to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 2  del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo.
La Sra. Marina es una de las integrantes, ella es vendedora de frutas y verduras, y comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Marina es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere ser mejor cada día y es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder crecer. 
Solicita de este prestamo para la compra de sus frutas y verduras. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones
texts.en: The group called "Sagrada Familia" (Sacred Family) is in its second cycle of the program of the women's committee. It is from the city of Concepción, an area which is a little far from the center of town and which is still growing. It is an area that is difficult to reach, and because of this the members of this group want to work hard to keep on growing. Marina is one of the members. She sells fruits and vegetables, and she states that it is through her work that she has the means to help her family. Marina is a very hardworking and tenacious person who wants to be better every day, and this is why she puts all her effort to prosper. She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables, and in this way to keep on growing with her business and to give her family all they need for a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica al cultivo de tomates desde hace 12 años comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y gracias a ello es que ha logrado salir adelante con sus gastos, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para seguir con la producción de tomates  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Flor, age 34, lives in her own house with her husband and her two daughters. She has been cultivating tomatoes for more than 12 years.  She sells her produce around the area where she lives, which has enabled her to get ahead of her expenses.  She is requesting a loan again, for the purchase of compost, pest control, herbicide, etc. in order to continue producing tomatoes. In this way,  she can have better income.

loans.use: to purchase compost, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena  is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession; he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

Sakeena has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. Sakeena is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en: Sugran, 50 years old, is married and a mother of 5 children. She has been running an animal sales and purchase business for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Through her work, Sugran is able to run her household activities. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. It will allow her to increase her sales and profits. Sugran desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, 31 years old, lives with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides services for changing the seat covers of vehicles.  He purchases ready-made seat covers and also stitches seat covers. His shop is situated in the vehicle workshop market. He finds customers and convinces them to change the seat covers of their vehicle. He does not take much of the customers' time and quickly changes the seat covers. He was originally providing services only for motorbike seats but now also wants to provide seats for various cars. To do so, he wants to buy various colors and types of rexine (artificial leather fabric) so that he can show his arts for sewing car seats.

Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of rexine. Rani thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase various colors and types of rexine for sewing seat covers.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has been selling women's clothes at the market for nine years. Due to her previous Kiva loan, Svetlana was able to increase her assortment of winter clothes. Svetlana  is a young, intelligent and active person. She wants to develop her business further. 

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to buy women's clothes for the spring season. The loan will help to buy good quality clothes from Turkey and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the spring season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar sus cultivos que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman has her face blurred out, because she is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has worked growing corn and beans for 10 years. With what she earns with her sales, she is able to pay for some household expenses. She lives in her own house, with her family. Once again, he is requesting a loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague control, herbicides, and to improve the plot of land where she cultivates, which is shown on the photograph, and in this way to be able to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague control, herbicides and to improve her plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sopas, refrescos, azúcar, café, granos básicos, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir teniendo buenos ingresos para una mejo calidad de vida con sus padres.
texts.en:
The borrower with the blurred face is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She has had a small store located in her home for nine years.  With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to meet some of her household expenses.  She lives in a home she owns with her parents.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soup, drinks, sugar, coffee, basic grains, and other items at wholesale to continue having good profits and to improve her parents' lives.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, drinks, sugar, coffee, basic grains, and other items at wholesale.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
These three members, led by Janet as the representative, form the group called "In God We Trust". The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling groceries, African fabric (kente, fufu), children's and adults' shoes and ladies' top and skirts. They will need a total amount of GHS 2,200 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesspeople, who will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.


Janet, 41 years old, joined ID-Ghana 1 1/2 years ago and this is her third loan request with them. She currently has a business selling African fabric. Janet will use her part of this loan, GHS 1,200, to increase her capital. She will buy African fabric (kente and fufu) to sell to customers. This work allows her to earn an income for her family. 

Janet is single and has three dependent children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Janet replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

loans.use: To buy African fabric (kente and fufu) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mandel Group

texts.en:
These members form a group called Mandel. They are on their sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has two members. They sell tomatoes and cassava dough. The featured borrower is Rita. She is 35 years old and married with three children. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Rita is a member. She says that she join ID Ghana four years ago. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. 

Currently, Rita has a business selling cassava dough. She buys the cassava and prepares the dough herself to sell to her customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had and that it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow the business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 1,900 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy the cassava and prepare the dough herself to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abesamihigo Group

texts.en:
Speciose, aged 48, is a group leader. She is married with two children aged between 21 and 16 years; all of them go to school. The group is called ABESAMIHIGO, which means “Target Maker” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for making their future better. 

She owns a shop and has been doing a business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Colgate, soap and sugar to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more Colgate, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jenifer grew up in Huruma, Nairobi. She is a mother of eight children. She owns a residential plot where she plans to put up a Fresh Life Toilet. She first learned of Fresh Life through a family friend who also resides in the informal settlements within the city. The Fresh Life Toilet will improve sanitation in her plot and further improve her income, as the tenants will not be moving out every other month in search of a better place to live.

She intends to increase rent once the toilet is constructed, so that she can get the money to pay back for the loan. She is also planning to increase the franchise in the future, to ensure cleanliness within the entire community.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Evelin Beatriz

texts.es: Evelin de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz,frijol, maicillo y hortalizas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder continuar con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Evelin, 33, lives in her own house with her family. She grows corn, beans, sorghum, and vegetables. She has been doing this work for several years, which has enabled her to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc.  In this way, she can continue farming in order to have better income and better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Sushella

texts.en:
Sushella is 29 years old and lives in Chamarajanagar, Karnataka, India. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. She is a B.A. graduate and is interested in organic agriculture and started exploring the same. She is also providing training to the farmers about organic agriculture.

She previously used to cultivate ragi and sell it to wholesalers. Later, she realized that more ragi is cultivated in her place, so she had an idea of buying ragi at wholesale from farmers and selling it to retailers.

She is now planning to make ragi flour and sell some more value-added products made of ragi, for which she is requesting a loan of INR 50,000 from Kiva. With the loan, she will buy a ragi cleaning machine and milling machine.

Help Sushella to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a ragi cleaning machine and milling machine.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is 33 years old and married. He was born and brought up in Kalkunda village near Mysore. After completing twelfth grade, he could not attend his higher studies because of his family’s situation, and he started to work as a garden supervisor in Mysore.

He started to explore the demand for the traditional food items, and he opened a shop in 2013 to sell traditional rice, paddy arts, seeds of traditional paddy varieties, jaggery, and also a few books related to organic agriculture. Now he is planning to sell minor millet in his shop, for which he needs a loan so that he can buy millet in bulk. He wishes to make a good business in this sector.

He hopes to save enough for his children’s education and change his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Dutambutsanye Group

texts.fr:
Marc fait partie du groupe  Dutambutsanye et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 44 ans et est marié à Appoline, une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2mois à 17 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de haricot, riz, ...cuits  dans son restaurant  depuis  13 ans. 

Il est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité de riz et haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marc is part of the group Dutambutsanye and lives in  Bujumbura. He is 44 years old and married to Appoline, a merchant. Together they have five children, aged 2 months to 17 years old. of whom three are students. He supports two members of his extended family who are students.

Marc has been doing commerce in cooked beans and rice in his restaurant for 13 years. 

He is on his 3rd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more.

In the years to come, he would like to buy a parcel of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas en la madrugada se ve al señor Luis realizando trabajos agrícolas, tales como riegos, abonados de campo, crear canales de cultivo y recoger los frutos que ya están maduros, es un hombre muy aplicado que desde pequeño ha estado involucrado en el mundo de la agricultura puesto que su padre es campesino cosecha hortalizas y le enseño a Luis todo lo que sabe. 

Luis siempre trabajo para otras personas fue hace poco que en el año 2013 decidió crear su propio negocio y trabajar su campo, su padre le presto unos terrenos para que iniciara y su idea es comprárselo, construir una finca e iniciar a expandirse transformado todo su terreno en una finca que se ala principal abastecedora de hortalizas en el mercado.

Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos, gallinaza para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos, este préstamo le permitirá obtener una cosecha más abundante por ende podrá tener más clientes y mejor utilidad.
texts.en:
From early hours in the morning Señor Luis goes about doing this farm work, such as irrigating, fertilizing the field, making channels of crops, and picking the fruits that are ripe.  He is a very dedicated man who, since he was young, has been involved in the world of agriculture since his father is a farmer harvesting vegetables; and he taught Luis all that he knows.

Luis always worked for other people.  It was a little while ago in the year 2013 that he decided to create his own business and to work his field.  His father lent him some land to begin and his idea is to buy it, build a farm, and begin to expand it.  He transformed all his land into a farm that mainly supplies vegetables in the market.

Luis wants to request a loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation, and manure to sustain his crops.  This loan will allow him to obtain a more abundant crop and thus he will be able to have more customers and better goods.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, irrigation, and manure, to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and plant care products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Willian Manuel

texts.es:
Él es William es un hombre muy serio, respetuoso, centrado mucho en sus actividades, vive junto con su esposa, genera sus recursos gracias a la venta de chorizos que tiene, (el chorizo es el producto que se ve en la foto) este trabajo lo aprendió empíricamente y surgió de una necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Este negocio algo improvisado pero poco a poco fue tomando fuerza, con poco ha logrado mucho, tiene su plancha, una pipeta de gas y sale todos los días a vender chorizos. 

De momento William tiene un inconveniente y es que no puede salir a vender muchos chorizos puesto que estos se dañan necesita refrigerarlos y si tuviera una nevera desplazaría mayor cantidad de chorizos y pudiera vender mucho más.

Pensando en esta necesidad que puede significar un avance importante en su negocio William quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar un enfriador de segunda mano y surtido de carnes y embutidos (chorizos).
texts.en:
William is a serious, and respectful man that is very focused on his activities. He lives with his wife, and earns a living selling sausages (as seen in the picture). He learned this job through observation, and it arose from a need to earn an income to cover the home expenses.

This business was somewhat improvised, but little by little it grew stronger. With little, he has achieved a lot. He has a griddle and a propane tank, and he goes out every day to sell sausages. Currently, William has the inconvenience that he cannot sell many sausages because they go bad and need to be refrigerated. If he had a refrigerator, he would be able to move a greater quantity of sausages and he could sell a lot more.

Thinking about this necessity which would signify an important advance in his business, William is requesting a loan to buy a second-hand refrigerator and a supply of sausages.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand refrigerator and a supply of sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and some condiments

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo es un hombre soltero de 48 años de edad, vive solo, se desempeñaba como empleado en fincas, su salario era muy básico y solo le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades más básicas, a su largo de su vida logro juntar capital y compro el terreno que podemos ver en la foto, cansado de ser un empleado y con sus deseos muy centrados Jhon quiere solicitar un préstamo para darle un giro radical a su vida, y lo hará para comprar 4 terneros y de esta manera será el nacimiento de un nuevo empresario ganadero. 
La decisión la tomo porque quería mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ser más productivo y vivir cómodamente, no había hecho antes porque tenía miedo de lo que pudiera pasar pero ahora está muy seguro y decidido y en el momento solicita tu apoyo para cumplir este cometido, está actividad será en todo lo que se centre y la que le dará de vivir de ahora en adelante.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo is a single man, age 48. He lives alone. He was working as a farm employee, and his salary was very basic; he was only able to cover his most basic necessities. He managed to put together some capital during his life, and he bought the land that we can see in the photo. He’s tired of being an employee, and with his aspirations very much in focus, he wants to request a loan in order to make a radical change in his life. He will do this by purchasing four calves, and in this way, a new ranching entrepreneur will come into being.

He made the decision because he wanted to improve his living conditions, be more productive, and live comfortably. He didn’t do it before because he was afraid of what might happen, but now he is very certain and determined, and he asks for your support in order to fulfill this mission. He will focus entirely on this occupation, which will provide him with a livelihood from now on.

loans.use: to purchase four calves in order to start his own business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 26 years old and she lives with her parents and brother in the village Agarak of the Lori region. Anna's family, her parents and brother, like hundreds in this region, earn their living through farming and agricultural activities. 

Anna graduated from the Polytechnic Institute and now she works at the school as an operator and secretary. She also gives computer skills lessons at the school, and she has small group of pupils. In this way, she tries to support her family with finances since their farm is small and the income from it as well. 

Anna asks for this loan as she wants to buy a computer. This will allow her to have more pupils for her lessons right at home, which will bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik is a pedagogue with a higher education and 25 years of work experience. Thanks to her patience and great mind, she has not lost her love of her specialty and towards the children with whom she has worked so properly through the years. 

Shushik works in her native village school as a teacher of physics. Shushik lives with her husband and two sons in the village of Yaghdan in the Lori region. 

Besides her lessons at the school, Shushik also gives paid private courses of physics in her house. She has 15 pupils whom she prepares for the entrance exams. 

Shushik will be greatly pleased and happy if she manages to receive this loan as she wants to buy a computer and some professional literature. This will be so great and helpful for teaching her courses at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature

loans.name: Erika

texts.en: Erika is single and she lives at her father's house. Erika works at a book editorial  and in her free time she sells onions. She does that every Saturday and Sunday. Erika is also an experienced farmer. She needs a loan to buy a second cow (her father is the owner of the one you see in the picture) that will be very useful to her because she plans to sell milk and to make cheese. Her father will be helping her. Erika wants to have her own house in the future. She hopes you can help her because she supports her father.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old and she sells cleaning and hygiene products (toothbrushes, shoe polish cream, aftershave cream and other stuff). Juana goes to the famous 16 de julio fair every Thursday and Sunday. Juana is the mother of two children. Juana is living at her parents' house. 

Juana is also an experienced seamstress. She needs a loan to buy fabrics to make flags. That will be very helpful to her because of the many schools that need Bolivian flags and flags with their logo to go to parades. Juana hopes you can help her. She is the only one that makes money at her home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make flags

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a married woman. She has four children, and with a lot of effort she and her husband acquired their own house. Debora is member of a transport union and she has two minibuses. Many times Debora has driven one of them to make money. Debora's husband is in the army so he has to travel a lot so Debora takes care of her children alone most of the time. Debora needs a loan to pay the maintenance of his minibuses.  This is important for her, otherwise she won't be able to pay the school tuition, food and other expenses of the family. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance of his minibuses

loans.name: Margaritas De Xejuyu Group

texts.en:
Seven industrious women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Margaritas de Xejuyu” and received their first loan funded by Kiva investors last year. They have successfully finished this loan cycle, paying back the loan fully and on time. With the funds, the ladies were able to maintain or expand their small businesses. They are hopeful that Kiva investors will fund their second loan.

Sonia, a 39-year-old member of the Trust Bank, is a motivated business woman who is married with four children. Her goals are to earn additional income to support the family, send each of her children to school and realize her dreams. Sonia is very busy with her family and three businesses. She sells traditional clothing, sandals for children and women and has a convenience store. With her new loan, Sonia plans to purchase not only traditional clothing to resell but also various styles and sizes of sandals. She is especially sensitive to the wants and desires of her clientele and wants to attract new customers as well. 

Sonia and her friends in the Trust Bank are very aware of the value of education, as many of them were unable to attend school. Sonia is pleased that her oldest child was able to finish high school.  

Kiva investors play an important role with the ladies of “Margaritas de Xejuyu” in providing capital for the loans. The women face a more successful and happier future. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase not only traditional clothing to resell but also various styles and sizes of sandals.

loans.name: Dukomezimbaraga Group

texts.en: Fatina is a group leader, and she is 40 years old. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 20 years old, and they all go to school. The group is called Dukomezimbaraga, which means powerful team in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to improve their future. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this in a business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 51-year-old widow who has six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a hardware shop and cosmetic shop for 15 years. She managed to start a ladies salon using the profits realized from the business in addition to setting up a bar and motorcycle transport business. She has a dream of expanding her business into a wholesale business. However, price fluctuations and high license fees hinder her business. Mary is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza es una mujer de 44 años de edad, ella se dedica a la confección de línea propia en  un negocio ubicado en su casa, y  que inicio en el año 2003 por necesidad económica, buscando una mejor calidad de vida, vivir mejor, comer mejor, tener a sus 4 hijos estudiando y felices, su mayor orgullo son ellos y trabaja muy duro para generarles oportunidades que le permitan formarse en busca de una profesionalización.

Ella tiene un objetivo muy claro aparte de sus sueños y metas que auto adquirió con sus hijos, su compromiso es hacer crecer su negocio de tal manera que este le genera la utilidad para comprar una casa propia o sea lo suficiente para pagar un crédito de casa.

Teniendo su propósito muy definido María quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar insumos los cuales son telas e hilos, comprara en grandes cantidades, con ellos confeccionara blusas, camisetas y camisas que espera vender muy bien con sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is a 44-year-old woman. She's in dressmaking of her own line in a business located at her house. She started it in the year 2003 due to financial need, looking for a better quality of life, to live better, to eat better, and to have her 4 children studying and happy. Her greatest pride is them and  works very hard to generate them opportunities that allow them to educate themselves in search of becoming professionals.

She has a very clear objective apart from her dreams and goals that she self-acquired with her children: her commitment is to make her business grow in such a way that it generates the profit to buy a house of her own, that is, enough to pay a house loan.             

Having her purpose well defined, María wants to request a loan to buy supplies, which are fabrics and threads; she will buy in large quantities. With them, she will make blouses, t-shirts, and shirts that hopes to sell very well with her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads to make blouses, t-shirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Joni

texts.en:
Joni is 63 years old. He lives in the Khoni district with his wife. 

Joni is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land, where he grows vegetables. 

Joni decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,700 GEL. 

With the received credit, Joni will purchase pigs and feed for them. He will raise the pigs in order to sell them at a higher price. This will increase Joni's income, and he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana will finish paying her first loan on time and is asking for a second loan to continue investing in inventory. She sells shoes through a catalog and door to door. She has proven to be creditworthy and hopes to increase her sales and diversify into other products to retain her clients.

loans.use: To buy shoes for the end-of-year season

loans.name: Amilkar

texts.es:
Amilkar es un hombre de 32 años de edad que a pesar de ser humilde, de carecer de recursos nunca se rinde y trabaja todos los días para mejorar su situación económica, salir de pobre, luchar por un mejor futuro para sus dos hijos y su señora, sus pequeños que tan solo tienen 10 y 3 años de edad ven a su padre todos los días trabajar y de verdad es muy recursivo porque logro construir una maquina con objetos cotidianos y gracias a esto puede realizar productos embutidos como lo son chorizos y salchichas.

Este laborioso hombre trabaja la extenuante jornada de 12 horas diarias la razón es que con este tiempo alcanza a producir para cubrir sus necesidades y debe trabajar mucho debido al bajo costo de venta de sus productos que no lo puede variar porque va dirigido a personas humildes como él.

Amilkar tiene dos objetivos uno de ellos poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y la segunda es que en un futuro poder consolidar toda una empresa de producción de embutidos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de carne que es el principal insumos de sus productos y algunas verduras, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su ventas, aumentar sus clientes, sostenibilidad de su negocio y tratar de ser más competitivo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Amilkar is 32 year old. Despite being humble, lack of resources never made him gives up and he works every day to improve his financial situation. He is working to exit poverty and fight for a better future for his two children and his wife. His children are only 10 and 3 years old and they go along with their father to work every day. It is truly helpful because he gets to build a machine with everyday objects. Thanks to this, he can make sausage products.

This laborious man works 12 strenuous hours a day in order to meet their needs. He must work hard because of the low sales price of the products that a humble person like him cannot change.

Amilkar has two goals. One is to pay for the education of their children. Second is to be able to consolidate sausages production into a company in a future.

He requests a loan to purchase meat, which is the main ingredient for the products, and vegetables. This loan will help him improve sales, expand customers, sustain his business, and try to be more competitive in the market.

loans.use: to purchase meat to make sausages with a handmade machine.

loans.name: Johana Andrea

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 19 años de edad, llena de ambiciones para el futuro, quiere estudiar, ser muy exitosa para sacar a su madre de trabajar ya que se comprometió a mantenerla.

Esta maravillosa joven de tan buen corazón tiene como actividad productiva la confección, en la foto la podemos observar cortando tela, está empezando y requiere de un impulso que tú le puedes dar, de momento necesita de una maquina fileteadora y ella no tiene forma de cómo pagarla, por esta razón acude al crédito ya que pagarla por cuotas será mucho más cómodo y fácil.

Tu aporte puede ayudar a Johana a seguir con su linda labor de ayudar a su familia y a pagar sus estudios, quiere sor una profesional administradora de empresas y llevar su negocio hacia el éxito nacional.
texts.en:
Johana is a 19-year-old young woman, full of ambitions for the future. She wants to study and be very successful, so that she can let her mother stop working since she committed to supporting her.

This marvelous, good-hearted young woman makes her living in dressmaking. In the photo, we can see her cutting cloth. She is just starting out and needs a push that you can give her. Right now she needs a sewing machine and she has no way to pay for it. For this reason, she is turning to a loan because paying in installments will be much easier and more convenient.

Your support can help Johana continue with her admirable work of supporting her family and paying for school. She wants to be a professional business administrator and bring her business to national success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, so she can pay for school and support her home through the business

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel was born and brought up in Kisii County. He is married with ten children, two of whom are still under his care.

Samwel learned of Fresh Life toilets through a neighbour who has already installed the toilet.

Samwel seeks a loan to put up a Fresh Life Toilet on his plot. He anticipates that the toilet will improve sanitation and improve tenant retention. The toilet will also help the community around him. 

He will use the proceeds from the Fresh Life toilet to pay for the loan, improve his living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tiwale Group

texts.en:
Bitilesi thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her; she used the loan to purchase two bales of second-hand clothes. She used the profits obtained to pay school fees for her children, and she also started building a house for her family.

Bitilesi is requesting another loan in order to buy cement, iron sheets and window panes for her house. She plans to finish her house this year before the rainy season starts and hopes to still invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron sheets and window panes

loans.name: Tigwirizane Group

texts.en:
Having improved her family's living standards, Judith greatly thanks Kiva for the support that they gave her by granting her a loan. She used the loan to buy different commodities for her business that were running out of stock such as eggs and Irish potatoes. Judith used the profits gained to lift herself out of poverty by providing her family with the necessities.

She would like to obtain another loan in order to purchase more commodities such as onions, eggs and rice to increase her profits. Judith plans to build a permanent dwelling for her children.

loans.use: To purchase onions, eggs and rice

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esperanza” (Hope) is located in the Guatemalan Western Highlands town of Santa Clara La Laguna that overlooks the beautiful Lake Atitlan.  The members of Esperanza have just completed their first Kiva loan cycle.  The ladies report that the loans were of great benefit to their small businesses.  There are nine Trust Bank members whose average age is 30 years and each has an average of three children.  Marta is a member of the group’s board and serves as its president.  It is a very important role to lead and make certain the the group stays on course through the loan cycle.

Thirty-two year old Marta is a mother of six children. Despite not having an academic degree, she is a successful small-business owner.  Her business is producing very fine baskets made of pine needles and maguey fiber.  These baskets are in great demand by the tourists and people from neighboring communities.  Marta is asking for a new loan to purchase the large quantity of the fibers she needs so that she can increase her inventory of baskets.  She also would like to purchase a bull to raise and then sell for more income. 

The ladies of Esperanza send their heartfelt thanks to Kiva investors for believing in them and supporting their economic and intellectual development.

loans.use: To purchase the large quantity of the fibers she needs so that she can increase her inventory of baskets.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio es un hombre de 33 años de edad, soltero y propietario de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la vereda arenilla de sonson, tiene una gran responsabilidad dado que su tienda es una de las pocas de la zona por ello siempre debe tener un buen surtido de productos, su misión como empresario es tener siempre disponibilidad de productos y que sus clientes encuentren todo en su local y a eso le apunta diariamente.

Ya tiene un amplio recorrido y bagaje puesto que lleva operando desde el año 1998 y sabe manejar muy bien sus clientes y predecir que necesidades le pueden servir o que productos debe traer que sean del gusto para sus usuarios.

Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia, nació el mismo día que abrió el negocio y desde entonces apunta mucho a este objetivo.


Eusebio quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, la razón del monto es que debe realizar un largo desplazamiento y para reducir costos le sale más económica comprar todo, comprara abarrotes, víveres, granos, frutas, verduras y bebidas.

Apoya a este empresario que con su negocio busca alcanzar un sueño y facilitar la compra de insumos de la canasta familiar a las personas de la vereda.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a 33-year-old single man, the owner of a grocery store located in the Arenilla neighborhood of Sonson. He has a great responsibility because his store is one of the few in the area, so he needs to always have a good stock of products. His mission as a business owner is to always have products available and that his customers be able to find everything at his store. He works for this every day.

He already has a lot of know-how and experience because he has been operating since 1998, and he knows how to manage his customers very well and predict what needs they have or what products he should carry that will be to his customers' liking.

His dream is to be able to buy his own home. This dream was born the day he opened the business, and since then he has worked toward this goal.

Eusebio wants to request a loan to buy basic family needs, so that he can carry out a shift over the long term and reduce costs. It's more economical for him to buy all at once. He will buy groceries and other provisions, grains, fruit, vegetables, and drinks.

Support this businessman who is trying to fulfill his dream through his business and make it easier for people of his neighborhood to buy basic groceries for their family.

loans.use: to stock his business with groceries and other provisions, grains, fruit, vegetables, and drinks

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
Margeth es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de lácteos.
Ella es buena madre, amable, generosa, sincera, comprensiva, optimista, comprometida con su trabajo, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ de la ciudad, caracterizada por la colonización de migrantes; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del lugar e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Margeth es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (de pie, la segunda de la derecha viste solera negra con cartera marrón). Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de gafas de sol, venta de perfumes, venta de helado, elaboración de empanadas, venta de poleras de mujer, venta de material escolar y servicio de limpieza, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de lácteos como; leche, queso, yogurt, etc. Actividad que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta de lunes a domingo en horas del día. “deseo ampliar mi negocio y vender huevo para complementar mis ingresos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la constante demanda del público en general, desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para ofertar mayor variedad de productos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea comprar huevo por mayor para diversificar su negocio y ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Margeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de huevo por mayor para diversificar su negocio y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Margeth is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has two children, ages 6 and 15. She sells dairy products.

She is a good mother, friendly, generous, sincere, understanding, optimistic ,committed to her work, supportive, responsible and hard-working. She carries on her business in the "Plan 3000" area of the city, known for the migrants who have settled there: Ayorea indigenous tribes native to the area, miners relocated from the west who took over the area and started manufacturing and commercial businesses of all kinds. The climate is warm, tropical and very humid. The temperature varies during the day between 18 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Margeth is dark-skinned, with brown eyes and long brown hair worn in a ponytail. She is short in stature with an average build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in the home. She speaks Spanish for general culture and for purposes of the business she runs. In the photo she is seen standing, second on the right, wearing a black summer dress and carrying a brown purse. 

She enjoys her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and with her children who attend school. They live in their own home, constructed of bricks and cement, which has running water, electricity and sewer connection. 

The need to expand her business led her to form a communal bank of people with businesses, such as selling sunglasses, selling perfumes, selling ice cream, making empanadas, making women's T-shirts, selling school supplies, and a cleaning service. This was so she could request a loan and improve her business.  

Her business is selling dairy products such as milk cheese, yogurt, etc. She has a permanent stall where she sells from Monday to Sunday during the daytime. "I want to expand my business and sell eggs, in order to supplement my income" she says. The advantage of her business is the constant demand from the general public, and the disadvantage is her lack of capital for investment in order to offer a greater variety of products. 

Her dream is to open a store. She wishes to buy eggs at wholesale so that she can diversify her business and offer greater variety to her customers. This is her second loan from institution in the three years she has been running this business.

loans.use: To buy eggs at wholesale in order to diversify her business and open a store.

loans.name: Ana Stella

texts.es:
Para una Ama de casa como lo es Ana la venta de mercancía ha sido una verdadera salvación puesto que siempre fue muy dedicada a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos, no pudo realizar un estudio y por ende ahora que quiere buscar una actividad económica le cerraron muchas puertas dado que no cuenta con un título académico o una experiencia laboral.

Un poco desanimada por la situación, busco alternativas y un amigo el hablo acerca de la venta de mercancía y de lo bueno que sería que ella intentara realizar esta actividad.

Muy motivada y con muchas ganas Ana Inicio sus ventas en el año 2005 y le han dado buen resultado ya no solo es un Ama de casa, ya se convirtió en una comerciante de lociones, desodorantes, productos capilares, cremas de manos, espuma para afeitar, accesorios, pijamas entre otros.


Su sueño se basa en continuar pagando la educación de sus hijos que se le permita tener salud para ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad e ir remodelando su hogar poco a poco.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía  principalmente lociones, accesorios y pijamas.
texts.en: For a housewife like Ana, product sales have been a true salvation because she has always been dedicated to her husband and their 3 children, and wasn't able to complete her education and so when she wanted to look for work, many doors were closed since she doesn't have a degree or work experience.  A little discouraged by her situation, she searched for alternatives and a friend told her about product sales and how good it would be for her to try this job.  Very motivated and eager, Ana began her sales in 2005 and has had good results.  She is no longer only a housewife, but has changed into a saleswoman of lotions, deodorants, hair products, hand creams, shaving cream, accessories, and pajamas, among others.  Her dream is to continue paying for her children's education and if her health permits, to see her children graduate from university.  She would also like to remodel her house little by little.  She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise, specifically lotions, accessories, and pajamas.

loans.use: to stock lotions, women's accessories, and pajamas, which are the products she sells most.

loans.name: New Park Devt Group

texts.en: Paul is a 38-year-old married man with one child attending school. He is taxi driver at a taxi park in Nateete, and a member of New Park Devt Group allocated within the city. He is in charge of looking after the family including paying school fees. He has approached UGAFODE through the group for a loan of UGX 500,000 for the brother in boarding school. He can afford to pay it back in smaller installments. His dream is to expand the business of taxi and pay school fees for the child. He is a hardworking person who is only constrained by the stiff competition and the city regulatory policies that are at times harsh. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the financial support rendered to the group through UGAFODE.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his brother

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda is a Kubo Financiero client. This is the third loan that she is asking for to invest in her grocery store. She has always paid her loans back on time and hopes to keep investing in her business and making it grow.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store, specifically with canned goods and dairy products.

loans.name: Pablo Gerardo

texts.en: Pablo Gerardo is 25 years old, married and has one son. He studied up to high school, came to Mexico City four years ago and decided to start a business selling accessories for computers. Pablo Gerardo is asking for a loan to invest in inventory for his business. He hopes to make it grow and support his family.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories for his store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 69 years old and has a store where he sells different home products.  The store is located in his mother's home and has been there for many years. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for his store. He received solid references from his neighbors, who describe him as hard working and extremely responsible.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en: Ernanie, 40, is separated with three school-aged children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for five years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already requested loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en: Ronila is driven by the passion of selling. At the age of 51 and married from Larena, she engages in a retailing business, buying and selling assorted goods for retail. Every day she patiently tends her store, from which to provide for their needs. Ronila wants to expand her business; she recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she became a member in 2011 in order to access insurance and financial assistance. Now she has borrowed a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and live a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en: Liezl is 43 years old and married with five beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas, fruits and vegetables in their town for almost five years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has a lot of knowledge about dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Liezl still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. For now, Liezl is planning to try a new business, which is creating a small piggery for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase more bananas, fruits and vegetables for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, fruits and vegetables for wholesale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is from Cangbagsa, Larena, Philippines. He is 61 years old and married. Antonio is engaged in buying and selling green charcoal. He has been doing this for 20 years and it has greatly helped him meet his financial needs.  In addition to his charcoal business, he also cultivates a small rice paddy for his families' consumption. 

He requested a loan to purchase more inventory of charcoal for retail. Expanding his inventory would also mean an increase in his income. Antonio has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of charcoal for retail

loans.name: Eltrudes

texts.en:
Eltrudes is a farmer from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a mother who dreams big for her children. She helps her husband in tilling their farmland which primarily supports their family.

Eltrudes' membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has helped her with her financial needs. Recently, she cultivated another parcel of land and now needs to pay for seedlings and compost. She approached Paglaum MPC for this reason and accessed a loan.

In the future, Eltrudes wants to buy a rice field for the expansion of her farming activities.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of  products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education, and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Eva would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy larger quantities of diverse products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in her store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eva hopes to become more successful in her business. She desires also for a better life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 29 years old and has five children. Marissa is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Marissa has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 35 years old and two of her children are in school.

Edna has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Edna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 43 years old and has four children. Nena is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Nena is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nena has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 51 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Leonila has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Angelie

texts.en:
Mary Angelie is 28 years old and married with three children.

Mary Angelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Angelie has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 3 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Mary Angelie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 41 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as liquor, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as liquor, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a parent of 4 children, Paz works hard to support her family.

Paz has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running a general store. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a woman with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and all of her children are attending school.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора женщина 40 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей. В возрасте 18 лет Гулнора вышла замуж. Она работала на дому портнихой, вскоре начала помогать мужу в введении бизнеса животноводства. Сейчас у них на участке земли 2 коровы и 5 баранов. Гулнора доит коров и молоко продает на рынке. Также она изготавливает молочные продукты. У Гулноры большая семья, поэтому они с мужем работают не покладая рук, чтобы обеспечить своих детей достойной жизнью. Гулнора планирует увеличить поголовье своего стада, поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она ни раз слышала хорошие отзывы от своих знакомых, который также занимаются разведением скота и земледелием, о том, что с получением кредита в МДО Арванд они смогли расширить свой бизнес. Гулнора надеется на получение кредита. Благодарит за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a 40-year old woman who is married and a mother of four children.  At age 18, Gulnora married.  She worked out of home as a seamstress, and soon began to help her husband manage his livestock business.  They currently have a plot of land with two cows and five rams.  Gulnora milks the cows and sells their milk at a marketplace.  She also makes dairy products.  

Gulnora has a big family, so she and he husband work tirelessly to provide a decent life for their children.  Gulnora plans on adding some new animals to her herd, and has turned to MDO Arvand for financial support with that in mind.  More than once, she's heard good things about Arvand from people she knows who also earn their living as livestock and crop farmers; about how they've been able to expand their businesses after taking out loans with Arvand.  Gulnora is counting on receiving a loan, and thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: add more livestock to her herd

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 49 años de edad que inicio en el año 2014 su empresa como distribuidor de alimentos al por mayor, toda su fuerza de venta está enfocado en el plátano, que es el producto que se ve con el empresario junto a la foto.

Para Manuel ha sido toda una bendición esta profesión ya que le ha permitido crecer, pasar de ser un simple empleado en una plaza de mercado a convertirse en un distribuidor, todo porque tuvo la osadía de arriesgarse a emprender, a buscar algo diferente, mejorar sus condiciones, quería comprar una vivienda propia.

Manuel es un hombre separado de su esposa, tiene 3 hijos, una adolescente de 22 años y dos menores de edad de 17 y 15 años que depende en su totalidad de él.

Manuel busca un apoyo crediticio que le permita comprar surtido de plátanos, aunque inicio por buen camino, aún le falta mucho y como quiere crecer desea aumentar su inventario de productos, pues le permitirá pasar de comercializar 2000 plátanos a duplicar su oferta.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 years old who started a wholesale food distribution company in 2014. Sales effort is focused on bananas, which can be seen with the entrepreneur in the picture.

Manuel has been blessed with this profession because it allowed him to grow. He was able to move from being a marketplace employee to a distributor. This was all because he dared to undertake the risk to look for something different, to improve their conditions, and to buy a home of their own.

Manuel is separated from his wife. He has 3 children, a 22 year old and youngest two children at ages 17 and 15 depend entirely on him.

Manuel requests a loan that allows him to buy assortment of bananas. Although the business started on track, it still needs a lot and he wants to grow and increase product inventory. This will allow him to sell 2000 bananas to double his business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to double his business.
