loans.name: Mary Julfez

texts.en:
Mary Julfez is a hardworking mother who supports her four children through her retailing business. She has a sari-sari (variety) store in Tudela that sufficiently provides for her family.

Mary Julfez became a Paglaum MPC member when she accessed her initial loan for her retailing business. She is fortunate to turn the tide in her favor as her store is earning so well. Now she requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari (variety) store. She wants to serve her customers with enough sari-sari inventory.

Mary Julfez has big dreams for her children, especially for them to finish their studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is known in Tudela for his "sari-sari" (variety) store. He always ensures that he has enough inventory to satisfy his customers and never misses income opportunities. 

Orlando is thankful to Paglaum MPC for his financial needs. He has made the cooperative his financial partner in his business. Recently, he took another loan to purchase basic commodities such as rice, canned goods and noodles to sell.

Orlando has high hopes to maintain his membership with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities such as rice, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth cultivates a farm in Mahayag. She helps her husband in supporting their family through their farming activities. She joined Paglaum MPC for her capital needs. She is thankful that the Cooperative stood by her for her capitalization. Recently, she took another loan to purchase fertilizer. She hopes that she will have a good harvest so that she can save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farming

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 61 years old and married with five children. 

Alejandra is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Alejandra has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ronida

texts.en:
Ronida works hard to support her family. Ronida is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Ronida requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Ronida has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ronida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julinda is 53 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Julinda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Julinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Julinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Julinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and widowed with four children.  

Edna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Edna has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 41 years old and has four children. Adelina is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Adelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Adelina has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amada is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Amada has a sewing business in the Philippines. Amada requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business.

Amada has been in this business for 41 years. Amada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia works hard to support her family. Apolonia is married and has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Apolonia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Apolonia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Apolonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and single. 

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangeline has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old and has one child. Lorna is married and has one child who is in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Lorna has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Riglisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Riglisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Riglisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell firewood and charcoal business.

Ma. Riglisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, 28, is married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Joan has been in this business for 2 years, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Las Poderosas De Cotoca Group

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer de 51 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 16, 26, 28, 29 y 31 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ un área rural ubicada al este de la ciudad, conocida por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía de cerámicas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Karina es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la primera de la derecha, viste blusa floreada y pantalón corto negro). Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como plomero y con su hijo menor que estudia en la escuela (los demás hijos son independientes), viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como;
Comercio de artesanía, venta de cosméticos, venta de pollo, venta de accesorios de teléfono, venta de horneados, confección de sábanas y venta de embutidos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., su principal necesidad es abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otro puesto de venta en una feria cercana. “la necesidad de la gente hace que mi comercio sea constante y la mercadería rota continuamente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa tiene un precio accesible, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir en mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener varios puestos de venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un nuevo puesto de venta. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Karina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un nuevo puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Karina is 51 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children aged 16, 26, 28, 29 and 31. Her business is selling secondhand clothes.She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, patient, consistent, responsible and hardworking. Her business is in the town of Cotoca, a rural area located east of the city. It is known for its regional food and ceramics crafts. It has warm and humid tropical climate with the temperature ranging between 21-35 degrees Celsius during a day.

Karina has dark complexion, brown eyes and long brown hair tied in ponytail. She is short and medium built. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and speaks Spanish in general and for business development (the right-most wearing shirt with flowers and black shorts). She enjoys her life with her partner, who is a plumber, and her youngest son who studies in school (the other children are independent). They live in their own residence built of brick and cement with tin roof. It has water, electricity and sewerage. The need to improve her business led her to lead a personal banking with business such as craft stores, cosmetics, chicken, phone accessories, baked goods, preparation of sheets, and sausages, for a loan to improve their work.

Her business is selling secondhand clothes such as pants, sweatshirts, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc. Her main need is to stock greater variety and quantity of clothing to compete in the market. She also wants to open another shop at a nearby fair. "People’s needs make my sales constant and rotate merchandise continually..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the clothes are affordably priced. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in merchandise to grow her business. Her dream is to have several shops selling secondhand clothes. She wants to invest in her business by buying wholesale secondhand clothes to open a new shop. This is the 4th loan with the institution in three years making a living with this business.

Karina requests a loan to purchase wholesale secondhand clothing to open a new shop.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale secondhand clothing to open a new shop.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma continuously provides for her family through her farming activities. She has a farm in Mahayag and she borrows from Paglaum MPC for her capital needs. 

Recently, she availed another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Vilma made sure that she can prepare for the next planting season.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina has 7 children to feed. She labors a lot to sufficiently provide for her family. 

She is blessed with her farm which continuously produces a good harvest. Florina is thankful that Paglaum MPC has supported her for her capital needs. 

For the next cropping season, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. She prays for a good harvest so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer .

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 61 years old and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Diosdada has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is thankful that she accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help to cover their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure safe and efficient service. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Olivia hopes to maintain her transport business and have more source of income. She prays for a healthy and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Tertuliana

texts.en:
Tertuliana is 60 years old with four children. Tertuliana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like canned goods, beverages, home product care items, and other groceries.

Tertuliana has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Tertuliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en: Nicasia owns a farm in Mahayag. This is her primary source of income. She is thankful that her family's needs are provided for well, especially the education of her children. She has been able to expand her farming activities and employs workers for her farm. Recently, she has been preparing for the next cropping season. She availed herself of a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. In the future, she hopes to purchase a rice thresher to facilitate an easy harvest.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
This is Ernesto. He sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan entrenched his business. He was able to buy more groceries and also fish needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his family’s daily needs.

Ernesto is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will lend him an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional fish he needs to improve his business. His customers will likely buy more fish if he has more of them displayed in his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will make his business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Ernesto hopes to have other sources of income in addition to his variety store and fish business for he desires to become a successful businessman someday. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish he needs to increase his inventory and to improve his profit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labour for weeding, sowing and harvesting, and buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for weeding and buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: La Providence De Fort St. Michel 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Josue est le coordinateur de son groupe La Providence de Fort ST. Michel 1, 2, & 3. Il ´ est marié  à  3 enfants. Il  habite dans la région nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité n`est  pas rare  mais  de l’eau portable est très limite. 

Il dirige son groupe de  La Providence de Fort ST. Michel 1, 2, & 3 pendants  plusieurs années. Avant de ce commencer ce commerce il était  un marchand de vetements. Il espère que avec cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres  ont besoin d’emprunt pour le commerce tels que ventes  produits de  cosmétiques, vetement, chaussures, charbon, boissons gazeuses etc.  Il déclare que son défit principal est de devenir un  grande  commerçante  dans le département du nord  est. Son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Josue is the coordinator of the "La Providence de Fort St. Michel 1, 2, & 3" group. He is married with three children, and lives in the northern region of Haïti where electricity Is not uncommon but drinking water is very limited.

He has been leading his group "La Providence de Fort St. Michel 1, 2, & 3" for several years. In addition to this he is a clothes merchant. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Other members need the loan for their business such as the sales of cosmetics, clothing, footwear, coal, soft drinks, etc. He says his main challenge is to become a great merchant in the North-East district. His main objective is to have a great store that will enable him to build a large house with the help of Esperanza International.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jeany

texts.es:
Jeany es una viuda de 39 años de edad, quedo como madre cabeza de familia, sus dos hijas de 12 y 17 son su fuente de inspiración por ellas trabaja y quiere salir adelante junto con ellas darles estudio y una vivienda digna.

Jeany se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catálogo como ropa, accesorios, lociones, pijamas su negocio lo inicio en el año 2013, este trabajo le permitió soñar, salir de sus pensamientos negativos y ahora ve el futuro con ilusión de que le espera algo grande.

Jeany solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en la compra de productos  de catálogo, tiene un encargo importante que le significara buena ganancia.

La idea de Jeany es poder montar un almacén de productos similares a los que se ofertan en el catálogo, de momento trata de ganar clientes y experiencia.
texts.en:
Jeany is a 39-year-old widow who was left head-of-household.  Her two daughters, ages 12 and 17, are her source of inspiration.  She works for the family to get ahead, and to provide her daughters with an education and a decent home.

Jeany sells products by catalogue such as clothing, accessories, lotions and pijamas.  She started her business in 2013 and it has allowed her to set goals and do away with negative thinking.  Now she is excited about the future having something grand in store for her.

Jeany is requesting a loan to buy products by catalogue.  She has received a significant order that will earn her a good profit.

Jeany's goal is to open a shop with products similar to those shown in the catalogue.  For now she is trying to attract customers and gain experience.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing, lotions, and pijamas.  Her dream is to open a clothing and accessories shop.

loans.name: Bélokoma

texts.fr: Bélokoma vit à Avédji et est âgée de 24 ans. Bélokoma est une femme mariée avec deux personnes à charge. Bélokoma vend des beignets préparés à base de la farine de blé en parcourant son quartier et trouve son bénéfice grâce à son dynamisme. Bélokoma s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un sac de farine et un bidon d’huile, Bélokoma demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Belokoma lives in Avedji and is 24 years old. She is a married woman with two dependents.

Bélokoma sells fritters prepared with wheat flour throughout her neighborhood and generates profits thanks to her dynamism. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Belokoma is requesting this loan to buy a bag of flour and a can of oil, so she can generate the profit needed to help her husband deal with various family expenses.

loans.use: buy one bag of wheat flour and one container of [culinary] oil

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Enyonam est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement, Enyonam est une revendeuse d’épices qui parcoure tout son quartier afin de bénéficier d’un revenu pour aider son mari à pourvoir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.  Enyonam s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols d’ail et du poivre, Enyonam demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aged 35, Enyonam is a married woman living with her two children in Adidogome.

A very active entrepreneur focused on development, Enyonam retails spices throughout the neighborhood to generate income and help her husband meet the family's daily needs. She stocks up once a month at the market.

Enyonam is requesting this loan to order bowls of garlic and pepper, so she can achieve her objectives, have a good profit margin and promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy five bowls of garlic and four bowls of pepper

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre responsable, cariñoso, amoroso, trabajador, vive en un hogar junto con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, tiene una empresa de producción de marquillas, genera un empleo y aspira a que este año 2015 sea su año, ya que la confección está tomando mucha fuerza y eso es una gran noticia para él, dado que se avecinan buenos contratos.

Lo más curioso de este empresario fue que aprendió del negocio gracias a una hija quien tiene una empresa similar, trabajo con ella por un tiempo hasta que decidió tomar su propio camino y de momento él va muy bien y es feliz realizando su profesión.

Juan Carlos es muy hábil, crea él mismo los colores, estampa, y sublima las marquillas, de momento tiene unos pedidos especiales que requieren unas tintas y unos troqueles con los que no cuenta, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dichos troqueles y tintas.

Será muy importante debido a la magnitud del cliente quien lo tiene aprueba y se la pasa representara que Juan Carlos tenga trabajo para todo el año.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a responsible, affectionate, loving, hard-working man who lives with his wife and four children.  He has a label making company and one employee.  He hopes 2015 will be his year because clothing manufacture is going strong and that is good news for him, since good contracts are in sight.

What is most interesting about this entrepreneur is that he learned his business thanks to his daughter who has a similar company.  He worked for her for a while before deciding to branch out on his own.  For now things are going very well and he is happy with his trade.

Juan Carlos is very talented.  He creates his own colors and stamps and makes lovely labels.  He has special orders that require inks and dies that he does not have on hand.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy the dies and inks.  This is important because of the magnitude of the customer who must approve the final order.  It would mean Juan Carlos would have work all year long.

loans.use: Juan makes clothing labels and wants to buy inks and dies to develop more creative works.

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.fr: Mawuli est une femme mariée de 41 ans et très entreprenante. Mawuli vit à Adidogomé avec six enfants. Mawuli travaille activement pour favoriser une bonne éducation à ses enfants. Pour cela Mawuli vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique pour trouver le revenu nécessaire. Mawuli s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de riz et de sucre, Mawuli demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawuli is an enterprising 41-year-old married woman, who lives in Adidogome with six children. She is working actively to provide a good education for her children.

To make this happen Mawuli sells general food products in her shop to generate the necessary income. Mawuli resupplies three times a month at the market.

Mawuli is requesting this loan to order bags of rice and sugar, to finance her activities, achieve more profits, and promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy four bags of rice and two bags of sugar

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer carismática, se alegra de tener una familia con quien compartir, agradece poder ejercer una profesión que le representa el 100 por ciento de sus ingresos.

Tiene dos hijos adolescentes y una pequeña de 12 años de edad que parece su madre pues tiene las dotes de su madre de imponer autoridad y ser muy correcta.

Inicio con su profesión en el año 2012, ella se dedica a la confección a terceros, maquila principalmente uniformes, tal y como lo podemos observar en la foto y por ahora quiere expandirse, buscar más empresarios para crecer, quiere estar apretada en su negocio pero contando con mayor maquinaria y empleadas.

Su sueño es tener un taller de confección donde trabajen mínimo 30 personas, aún esta joven y puede lograrlo si se lo propone.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar una maquina cortadora, la que tiene en el momento fallo y no tiene arreglo y le toca comprar una nueva.

Ella se prometió algo que a toda costa y por medio de su negocio comprara una vivienda propia donde vivirá junto con sus hijos y esa será su gran herencia para ellos.
texts.en:
Sandra is charismatic and is happy to have a family with whom to share her life. She is grateful that she has a job that provides her with an income.

Sandra has two teenage children and a 12-year-old daughter. Sandra’s daughter is just like her mother, with the same talents and ability to lead and be ethical.

Sandra started her trade in 2012: she is a seamstress, making items for those who place orders with her. Sandra mainly makes uniforms, such as the one shown in the photo. Sandra wants to expand her business and look for more businesses to help her grow. Sandra wants to be busy at her business but also to have more equipment and staff.

Sandra’s dream is to have a dressmaking workshop with at least 30 staff. She is still young and can achieve this.

Sandra is applying for a cutting machine in order to buy a cutting machine as her current machine has a fault that cannot be fixed.

Through her business, Sandra wants to buy a home where she can live with her children and provide them with an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine as her current machine has a fault that cannot be fixed.

loans.name: Elis Yaneth

texts.es:
Elis es una mujer de 26 años de edad, una trabajadora nata, muy aplicada y responsable, sabe explotar muy bien sus habilidades comerciales y aunque es una mujer humilde, es creativa y sabe aprovechar muy bien las oportunidades que se le presentan.

Elis es madre de 3 hijos de 9, 6, 2 años de edad, los tiene estudiando, se preocupa por darles una buena educación, que asistan al colegio, genera recursos gracias a la venta de mercancía de productos de uso personal, como lo son desodorantes, cremas para afeitar, lociones, cremas de manos, productos por encargo de catálogo, cremas faciales entre otros, los promocionada en una vitrina ubicada en su hogar, pasa buen tiempo en este sitio puesto que sus hijos son muy pequeños y para ella siempre estarán fondos.

Su sueño y ambición en la vida es poder tener un negocio rentable, que le signifique poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y ahora trabaja para transformar su venta informal en un almacén de productos de uso personal.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos por catálogo:
•	Ropa para hombre y dama
•	Calzado para hombre y dama
•	Pijamas para hombre y dama
texts.en:
Elis is 26 years old and a born hard-worker. She is dedicated and responsible, and knows how to use her skills as a trader. Although a humble woman, she is creative and knows how to make the most of opportunities.

Elis is a mother to three children, ages nine, six and two years old. They are all in school. Elis worries about giving them a good education and that they attend school. 

Elis earns a living selling personal products, such as deodorants, shaving foam, lotions, hand creams, facial creams, and other items that can be bought via catalogue. Elis displays the products in a glass display case in her home. She spends a lot of time at home as her children are very young.

Elis’ dream and ambition in life is to have a profitable business. This would allow her to pay for her children’s education. Elis is currently working in order to transform her informal business into a large shop selling personal products.

Elis is applying for a loan in order to buy the following catalogue products:
•	Clothing for men and women;
•	Footwear for men and women; and
•	Pyjamas for men and women.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women, and footwear and pyjamas.

loans.name: Jeanett

texts.es: Jeanett is 33 years old and she sells milk and she is a seamstress too She attends her cows in the morning and she is a seamstress in the afternoon She wakes up at 5:00 am and she works until 22:00 Jeanett needs a loan to buy food for her cattle Jeanett works very hard being a seamstress affects her sight for example. Jeanett would like to have more cattle and to go to college. Jeanett is single and she doesnt have children but she has her troubles
texts.en:
Jeanett is 33 years old. She sells milk and she is a seamstress too. She attends to her cows in the morning and she is a seamstress in the afternoon She wakes up at 5:00 in the morning and she works until 22:00. 

Jeanett needs a loan to buy food for her cattle. Jeanett works very hard and being a seamstress affects her sight for example. Jeanett would like to have more cattle and to go to college. Jeanett is single, she doesn't have children and she has her troubles.

loans.use: to buy food for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive con su compañero de vida su hijo y su padre en casa propia, su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been selling secondhand clothes for two years. Her business is located near her place of residence. With the income she earns, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. The borrower lives with her life companion, her son, and her father in a home of their home. She has many customers.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order buy secondhand clothes in bulk so that she can continue her sales. As a result, she will have more income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Veronica Blanca

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 29 años de edad. Vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 4 y 13 años, y su negocio es la confección y venta de tejidos. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, activa, constante, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la feria ‘16 de julio’ y en la zona ‘Ceja’ del alto, caracterizada por el comercio informal y la manufactura, donde micro empresarios de todos los rubros salen a exponer sus productos al público. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados. 
Verónica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la ecuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propiedad de su suegro, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de gorros de lana para niños, ella se encarga de comprar lana de todo tipo como; hilo, lisas, de colores enteros, etc. para luego confeccionar gorros en todo modelo y de toda talla. Labor que realiza en una habitación habilitada como taller en su domicilio, la venta la realiza junto a su pareja de forma ambulante en diferentes mercados y zonas comerciales de la ciudad. “el constante frio hace que mi negocio sea demandado por todos aquellos que tiene niños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las prendas son populares y se venden fácilmente, la desventaja es que no cuenta con puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es realizar confecciones para la venta por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de material de confección como; lana, telas, botones, hilos, etc., para contar con material constante de trabajo y realizar ventas por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 13 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua. 
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección para confeccionar gorros de niños y realizar ventas por mayor.
texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and her two children, ages 4 and 13.  Her business is making and selling knitted goods.  She is a good mother and independent, active, consistent, enterprising, responsible and hard working.  She works at the "16 de julio" market and in the "Ceja" area known for its informal commerce and production where small business owners of all sectors display their products to the public.  It is a cold, dry climate with an average day-time temperature of between 2 and 14 degrees Celsius.

Veronica has a dark complexion, brown eyes, is short in stature, and wears her long black hair tied back.  Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks with the family but she speaks Spanish for general purposes and through her trade.  She lives with her partner who is a merchant and her children.  The edlest is in school and the youngest is too young to go to school.  They live in a house belonging to her father-in-law, built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof.  The home has running water, electricity and a sewage system.  

Her business is knitting wool hats for children.  She buys all kinds of yarn, in different colors, etc., to make different styles and sizes.  She has a workshop set up at home and then she and her partner go out to conduct sales at different markets in the commercial areas of the city.  "The constant cold weather makes the business popular among everyone with children..." she says.  The advantage of the business is that the products are in high demand and sell easily.  The disadvantage is that she does not have a fixed sales point.

Her goal is to sell wholesale, so she wants to buy a greater quantity of materials such as yarn, fabric, buttons, thread, etc. to have a supply on hand.  This is her first loan in the 13 years she has been in business.  Veronica is requesting the loan to buy materials to make children's hat and sell them wholesale.

loans.use: To buy materials to make children's hats to sell.

loans.name: Ablan

texts.fr: Madame Ablan âgée de 33ans est mère de famille. Elle est revendeuse des articles de mercerie depuis 2010 et achète ses marchandises au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son premier cycle lui servira d'acheter des fermetures, des rubans, des aiguilles bref les articles de mercerie pour répondre aux besoins des clients. A l'avenir,elle souhaite devenir grossiste et aider les enfants à s'épanouir.
texts.en:
Ablan is 33 years old and has children.  She has been selling dressmaking products since 2010 and buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé.

This is her first loan with the field partner and will buy zips, ribbons, needles and other haberdashery products for her customers.

In the future, Ablan would like to become a wholesaler and improve the standard of living of her children.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery products.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme divorcée et âgée de 43 ans. Ama habite à Adidogomé avec un enfant à sa charge. Ama s’active dynamiquement pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ama prépare et vend de la bouillie accompagnée des beignets dans le quartier. Ama  arrive à gagner son profit grâce à cette activité et achète ses provisions une fois par mois au marché. Ama sollicite ce prêt pour commander quelques bols de maïs et un sac de farine de blé d’où elle peut plus de profits et répondre aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ama is a 43-year-old, divorced woman who is responsible for one child.  She lives and works in the Adidogomé district.  Ama works hard to provide for her family and prepares and sells fritters and maize porridge. 

Once a month, Ama buys new supplies from the market.  This loan will be used to buy several bowls of maize and a sack of wheat flour.  Ama's earnings will go to providing for her child.

loans.use: to buy 28 bowls of maize and 1 sack of wheat flour for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, Akossiwa vit sa famille à Lomé. Elle exerce cette activité pour aider ses enfants à mieux s'épanouir. Démarré l'activité il y a un moment, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son cinquiéme crédit lui permettra d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale pour mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère agrandir son activité et aider ses enfants à mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives with her family in Lomé and sells general food products from her shop.  She began her business some time ago and uses her earnings to improve the living conditions of her children.  Akossiwa buys her supplies in Lomé.

This will be the fifth loan for Akossiwa and it will buy general food products to supply her customers.

In the future, Akossiwa would like to expand her business and help her children live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia owns a graphic design business, located in Vista, CA. Her main service offerings include printing, signage and the production of promotional items. 

“In 2002, I wanted to create a job for my husband, Alan, as he is very sick and had been laid off from his job,” stated Ofelia. “He is a graphic designer and we started this business very close to where we lived, so that Alan could get to-and-from work.”

A mother of three, Ofelia is very determined and hardworking. Their business has experienced difficulties because of Alan's health issues and the loss of their domain name. The business has been in the same location for almost 15 years and is very well-known in the community.  

They have recovered the domain name and have designed a new website. They are ready to launch, but they need to update the equipment in their shop, in order to keep up with their clients' demands. 

 “We will be successful if our clients are successful,” said Ofelia. “We need this loan, in order to stay in business, so we are very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping us get out of a tough spot.”

loans.use: to update the equipment in their shop.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée et âgée de 45ans. Mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est l’épouse d’un soudeur-auto et gagne sa vie quotidiennement en faisant du commerce. Elle achète et revend du riz, de l’huile, du maïs et divers. Afi demande un autre prêt pour acheter des produits alimentaires dont elle a besoin. Son activité se fait à domicile et elle a démarré en 2000. Elle veut dans l'avenir devenir grossiste et prendre soin de ses enfants sur le plan scolaire.
texts.en:
Afi is 45 years old, married and has four children who all attend school.  Her husband is a car welder and she is a retailer.

Afi has requested another loan to buy food products such as rice, oil, maize, etc.  She has been selling her products from her home since 2000.

In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Lorena Cecibel

texts.es:
Lorena, vive con su señor esposo  de 33 años de edad y su hija de 8 años de edad, dese hace más de dos años se dedica a vender tortillas, actividad que emprendió por la necesidad de cubrir necesidades básicas en su hogar, el oficio se lo enseñó una de sus tías, labora todos los días de 10:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m.
Comprará una plancha más grande para aumentar la producción de tortillas, así fácilmente atenderá a sus clientes de manera rápida, la inversión la realiza esperando tener una afluencia mayor de clientes para aumentar sus ventas y mejora la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
Lorena tiene proyectado utilizar el crédito solo para mejorar su negocio y mejorar las ganancias con las cuales resarcirá su deuda.
texts.en:
Lorena lives with her 33-year-old husband and 8-year-old daughter. She has been selling tortillas for more than two years. Lorena started this business out of necessity in order to cover basic household needs. She learned this trade from one of her aunts. Lorena works every day from 10:00 A.M. to 1:00 P.M.

She will buy a larger griddle so that she can increase her tortilla production. This will enable her to attend to more customers easily and quickly. She hopes this investment will result in more customers, which would increase her sales and improve the quality of life for her entire family.

Lorena has plans to use the loan only for the purpose of improving her business and earning more profit, which will allow her to repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy a larger griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce dans la vente des produits de beauté, des mèches....  Manquant de marchandises, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour acheter des mèches, des produits de beauté et divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Yawa espère agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa sells beauty products and hair extensions but cannot afford to buy much stock, so she has requested this second loan from the field partner, WAGES to buy more stock.

Yawa is married and has three children.  She would like to expand her business and ensure a better future for all her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy herbal teas for his natural medicines business.

loans.name: Massavi

texts.fr: Massavi est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et a des enfants en charges. Massavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des matériaux de construction pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés. Massavi a requis son 6ème crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de construction. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Massavi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Massavi is 49 years old, married to a retailer and responsible for several children.  She has been working in retail since 2008 and sells construction materials from her shop.  She buys her supplies from Lomé, works alone and at the moment has no difficulties with her business.

This will be her sixth loan with the field partner, WAGES and it will be used to buy construction materials.  Her earnings will be reinvested in her business.

In the coming years, Massavi would like to expand her shop, save some money and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for resale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: DENIS: Es un señor jovial de 40 años de edad, originario de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado, tiene 2 hijos que estudian su primaria. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna para su familia. Esta solicitando su primer préstamo para cambiar la madera de su vivienda de tambo, desde hace 33 años ha habitado en su vivienda de madera. Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener un bufete de abogados, ya que es especialista en derecho.
texts.en:
Denis is a cheerful man who is 40 years of age. He is originally from Bilwi, which is in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Denis is married and has two children who are in primary school. In order to improve the living conditions and provide a more decent home for his family, Denis is requesting his first loan so that he can replace the wood in his stilt house. For the past 33 years, he has lived in this wooden house.

Denis wants to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as wood and nails, and to cover the cost of labor. His dream is to open a law firm since he is a legal specialist.
.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Johan Alejandro

texts.es:
Johan es un hombre de 32 años de edad entrega cuerpo y alma al trabajo tiene un taller de muebles de madera, donde también se encarga de repararlos, cuenta con dos empleados fijos, no tiene hijos, vive con su madre y la mantiene, es un hombre muy responsable con gran sentido de pertenencia, que aprecia mucho lo que tiene porque le ha costado bastante consolidarlo.

Johan es muy práctico y aprovecha muy bien sus recursos su actividad la aprendió por internet demostrando su capacidad de aprendizaje. De momento se encuentra explorando maneras de inversión para su negocio, necesita una maquinaria que lo ayudara a mejorar sus tiempos de producción la cual es una cortadora de madera y requiere materia prima para la fabricación de muebles.

Por ello quiere apoyarse en un préstamo con el cual crecerá, desea comprar con el monto una maquina cortadora de madera y madera.
texts.en:
Johan is a 32-year-old man who dedicates himself body and soul to his work.  He has a wood furniture workshop, offers a furniture repair service and has two employees.  He has no children and lives with his mother who is dependent on him.  He is a very responsible man with a great sense of belonging who appreciates what he has because he has worked hard to achieve it.

Johan is very practical and takes very good advantage of his skills, which he learned through internet demonstrating his learning ability.  For now he is exploring investment possibilities for his business.  He needs equipment to improve production time such as a wood cutting machine.  He also needs raw materials to make the furniture.

Therefore he is requesting a loan so he can grow the business.  He wants to buy a wood cutting machine and wood.

loans.use: To buy a wood cutting machine to speed up the cutting process, and to buy wood.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Revendeur de portables de façon ambulante, Kossi, homme de 37ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter son bien - être à sa famille.  La demande devenant de plus en plus grande, il sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira de louer une boutique de vente de portables et assurer l'éducation et la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossi sells cell phones on foot.  He is 37 years old and works hard to earn a living and provide for his family.  Demand for cell phones is rising continuously so Kossi has requested a second loan from the field partner, WAGES to buy more stock.

His profits will enable him to rent a shop to sell his cell phones and pay for the education and healthcare of his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El Socio José pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio sigue dedicándose a trabajar como  técnico dental, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua elaborando prótesis que generalmente los vende a los odontólogos, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio José solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para elaborar prótesis entre otros.
texts.en:
José is a member of the Communal Bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple), which is in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues to work as a dental technician. José is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms. He continues to produce prosthetics that are generally sold to dentists. José wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy materials for making prosthetics and other devices.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dental prosthetics and other devices.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Abla est une femme qui a deux enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Abla est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes de sa famille. Abla est une commerçante de chaussures dans son quartier et réalise un revenu favorable. Abla s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois et sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des chaussures pour vendre et réaliser assez de profits.
texts.en:
30-year-old Abla is a woman with two children under her care and who lives in Adidogome. She is very dynamic and active in dealing with her family's daily expenses.

Abla is a merchant who trades shoes in her neighborhood, and from which she generates good income. She resupplies twice a month at the market and is requesting this microcredit loan to buy shoes for resale to generate sufficient profits.

loans.use: buy 33 pairs of shoes

loans.name: J. Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo, de 38 años de edad, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 4 hijos que viven con ellos y actualmente están estudiando en la escuela.

Alfredo, actualmente trabaja en una construcción como ayudante de albañil, tiene mucho tiempo de realizar esta actividad, que le genera buenos ingresos económicos; gracias a su dedicación he inteligencia, está aprendiendo mucho y la idea de él es ser albañil.- Además, de esta actividad se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra granos básicos y ya se acerca la época de invierno, junto a sus hijos están preparando la tierra, para sembrar sus cultivos. 

El financiamiento del préstamo lo necesita para comprar 10 pliegos de lámina y pagar mano de obra, gracias al financiamiento logrará reparar su casa, pues en la época de lluvia se moja su casa y se le mojan sus pertenencias.

Los sueños son seguir remodelando su casa, ya que pretende construirle un cuarto a cada hijo, también desea que sus hijos estudien y logren graduarse.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 38 years old, only went to school until the fifth grade. He is married and his wife makes a living in housework. They have 4 children that live with them and are currently studying at school. 

Alfredo is currently working in construction as an assistant bricklayer, which he has been doing for a long time and which generates good income for him. Thanks to his dedication and intelligence, he is learning a lot and his idea is to be a bricklayer. Along with this work, he works in agriculture in growing basic grains. Since winter is approaching, he is preparing the land to plant the crops along with his children. 

He needs the funding from the loan to buy 10 metal sheets and to pay labor. Thanks to the fundings he will be able to repair his house, because during the rainy season his house and his belongings get wet. His dreams are to continue remodeling his house, as he aims to build one room for each child. He also hopes that his children study and manage to graduate.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheets of metal and to pay labor.

loans.name: Salam 2 Group

texts.fr: Maymouna, responsable du groupe remercie kiva pour le prêt qu'elle vient de soldé. Maymouna a pu acheter des pagnes pour vendre et elle témoigne qu'elle a pu augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Son bénéfice aussi lui a permis d'aider son époux à faire les dépenses de la maison. Après avoir bien remboursé son premier prêt kiva, Maymouna et son groupe voudraient un nouveau crédit pour continuer leurs activités. Maymouna pourra acheter plus de pagne vendre et avoir un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Maymouna is the group representative and is very grateful to the field partner for this loan.  She buys and sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and uses her earnings to improve her working capital and help her husband provide for their household expenses.

Maymouna and the other members of the group repaid their previous loan correctly and would now like a further loan to continue their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que es el sostén para su familia. Presenta hipertensión arterial mal controlada por lo que desde hace 6 meses comenzó a notar manchas en su campo de visión motivo por el cual acude a consultar y le diagnosticaron  retinopatía hipertensiva mal controlada de no atenderse lo antes posible la señora podría perder por completo lo vista. Las actividades domesticas que realiza en su hogar las lleva a cabo con temor ya que vive con la incertidumbre de tener un accidente.
texts.en: This woman manages a small grocery store so that she can sustain her family.  Due to poorly-controlled hypertension, she began noticing spots in her vision six months ago.  She underwent a consultation and was diagnosed with hypertensive retinopathy.  If her condition is not brought under control as soon as possible, she could lose her vision completely.  She is fearful of engaging in her household activities due to the risk and uncertainty of having an accident.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmological treatment.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que están en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernardina, quien tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, y se esfuerza por hacerlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, frutas, verduras, y otros para poder surtir su negocio y seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por este préstamo para poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de Fatima” is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that nine of them are living below the poverty line. This means that they are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Bernardina. She manages a food pantry where she works every day, beginning in the early morning hours and ending very late at night. Bernardina is a hardworking and enterprising individual who wants to get ahead, so she is putting forth the effort to make this happen.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy greens, meats, fruits, vegetables, and other products so that she can restock her business and continue her sales. Bernardina appreciates the loan so that she can continue improving each day.

loans.use: to buy greens, meats, fruits, vegetables, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est une femme divorcée âgée de 43 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Thérèse a deux enfants à sa charge dans la famille. Thérèse vend des pagnes traditionnels pour avoir une rentabilité nécessaire pour son épanouissement. Thérèse s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des pagnes et générer plus de profits, Thérèse demande ce crédit pour favoriser son achat et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Therese is a 43-year-old divorcee living in Adidogome. She has two dependent children in her family.

Thérèse sells traditional pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) to generate enough income for her development. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Teresa is requesting this loan to order pagnes, so she can generate more profit and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy six lengths of pagne (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio es una persona emprendedora que por medio de este negocio qiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage his business in the transportation sector. He provides taxi services through the different streets within the city of Cusco. He is an enterprising person who wants to get ahead in his business.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for his vehicle. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. She approached Paglaum MPC for her need for capitalization. Remedios is known for her good produce as her rice is of good quality. She hopes to maintain a good repayment record with the Cooperative so that she can always run for all her capital needs.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan entrenched his business. He was able to purchase additional groceries and other products needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his daily needs.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will lend him 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional groceries and items needed in his variety store and repacking business. His customers will likely buy more items if he has more of his products displayed in his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will help his business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Jose wants his business to become more established in the future. He also hopes that his family is always happy and contented. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en: Judelyn earns well through her farming activities. She is married and lives in Mahayag. In 2012, Judelyn heard of Paglaum MPC and immediately signed up for membership. She has availed several loans already and never misses a single payment. Now, she availed another loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Judelyn is preparing for the coming enrollment of her children and she hopes to see all her children have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Adzo est âgée de 39 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Pour permettre à sa famille de bénéficier d’une situation favorable, Adzo vend des fournitures de bureau dans sa boutique pour avoir une bonne épargne. Adzo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour revendre dans son atelier. Dans le but de commander des cartouches d’encres, Adzo demande ce crédit pour favoriser ses achats et avoir la rentabilité nécessaire afin de permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Adzo is a 39-year-old married mother of four living in Adidogome.

Adzo sells office supplies in her shop to generate adequate savings and provide her family with good living conditions. She stocks up once a month at the market for retail sales in her shop.

Adzo is requesting this loan to order ink cartridges and generate the profitability needed to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy ink cartridges

loans.name: Laura

texts.fr: Laura est une femme divorcée âgée de 38 ans. Laura vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Pour trouver une épargne, Laura vend des habits confectionnés en circulant dans son quartier et ses environs afin de soutenir ses enfants dans les besoins quotidiennes. Laura s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Laura demande ce financement pour commander rouleaux de tissus à confectionner et faire plus de bénéfice afin d’être efficacement utile dans l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Laura is a 38-year-old divorcee, who lives with her two children in Adidogome.

Laura sells tailor-made clothes throughout the neighborhood and the surrounding area, to find a means of saving and to support her children with their daily needs. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Laura is requesting this loan to order rolls of fabric for tailoring, so she can generate more profit and be effective in her family's development.

loans.use: buy four rolls of fabric

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en: A 56-year-old mother from Mahayag is named Tranquilina. She tills land that produces various commodities. She is thankful that she is able to access her capital needs from the cooperative. Currently, she is in need of a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. She deeply wishes that she will have good produce so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy additional hogs and feed, which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of feed and hogs, which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Violeta wants to give her family a better life someday. She dreams of having more pigs for her business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie accessed a loan from Paglaum for her farming activities. She cultivates a farm land in Balamban where she gets her source of income. She is on her way preparing for the next cropping season. She availed another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Tessie hopes to maintain a good credit standing with Paglaum so that she can always avail herself with the coop benefits like insurance.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Violito

texts.en:
Violito sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan has entrenched his business. He was able to grow his fund used for his food stall business. The loan also helped him provide for daily needs and expenses.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will lend him an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to more raw ingredients and supplies he needs to make more viands and food he sells so he can increase his profit from business. An increase in profit will also result in his business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Violito only desires that their lives will be more improved and successful in the coming years. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients such as rice, meat, veggies, and condiments needed in his food business.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme mariée très entreprenante qui vit avec deux enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Agée de 35 ans, Akoua est une commerçante des produits d’alimentations et des céréales pour gagner son revenu. Akoua s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Son gain l’aide à satisfaire favorablement les besoins de son ménage mais désire augmenter son profit. C’est pour cela qu’Akoua demande ce crédit pour commander ses sacs de maïs et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice.
texts.en:
Akoua is a very enterprising married woman who lives with two children in the neighborhood of Adidogome.

35 year-old Akoua is a merchant who trades food products and cereals to generate her income. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Her profits help her satisfy the household needs but she wants to increase her income. This is why Akoua is requesting this loan to order bags of maize, so she can make use of the profits to facilitate her children's education.

loans.use: buy eight bags of maize

loans.name: Carla Alejandra

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, Soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección y venta de zapatos de cholita.
Ella es inteligente, innovadora, creativa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Kupini’ situado en la ladera este de la ciudad, área afectada por filtraciones de agua que ocasionan deslizamientos constantes de tierra ocasionando grandes destrozos. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Carla es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan en el mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección y venta de zapatos para cholita. La cholita es una mujer de vestir tradicional, usa sombrero, manta y pollera, parte de su vestimenta son sus zapatos, estos son planos y cambian constantemente de diseño. La confección consiste en unir los materiales como; plantillas, horma, suela, tacos, etc., para lograr confeccionar un zapato, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de una costurera que se encarga de unir la partes y darle forma al zapato. “heredé este negocio de mis padres que me colaboran en el negocio, tengo la meta de lograr constituir una empresa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que debido a la experiencia de sus familiares cuenta con una amplia agenda de clientes constantes, la desventaja es la competencia con precios menores. Su sueño es abrir una industria de zapatos, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina para coser cuero. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser cuero para confeccionar zapatos de cholita y crear una industria.
texts.en:
Carla is a young woman, 25 years old, single, without children and her business is making and selling "cholita" shoes. She is intelligent, innovative, creative, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. She develops her business in the "Kupini" area, located on the eastern slope of the city. It is an area affected by water leaks that cause constant landslides, causing major damage. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 4-16 degrees Celsius. 

Carla is dark-skinned, with brown eyes, fashionable long black hair, short stature, and thin physique. Her native language is Aymará that she speaks with family, and she speaks Spanish in public and in her business. She lives in her parent's home who work in the same business. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a tin roof, running water, electricity and sewage. 

Her business is making and selling "cholita" shoes. The "cholita" is a woman in traditional dress, wearing a hat, shawl and skirt. Part of her clothing are her shoes. These are flat and constantly change design. The preparation consists of bonding the materials such as: insoles, inside of the shoe, sole, heels, etc., to achieve making a shoe, a job that is done with the help of a seamstress that is responsible for bonding the parts and giving shape to the shoe. 

"I inherited this business from my parents who collaborated with me in the business. I have the goal of building a company..." she comments. The advantage of her business is that due to the experience of her family members, she relies on a broad directory of steady customers. The disadvantage is the competition with lower prices. 

Her dream is to open a shoe industry. She hopes to expand her business through buying a sewing machine for sewing leather. This is the 3rd loan sequence with the institution in 3 years dedicated independently to this business. It is for these reasons that Carla is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine for making traditional leather "cholita" shoes and to create an industry.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for making traditional leather "cholita" shoes and to create an industry.

loans.name: Afoua

texts.fr: A 44 ans, Afoua est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Afoua vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé pour exercer ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de la famille et soutenir son mari, Afoua vend des produits d’alimentations générales afin de générer son revenu. Afoua s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché. Afoua nécessite ce crédit pour commander des cartons de sardines et des piles afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afoua is a 44-year old, married woman with four dependent children.  She lives in the Adidogome neighborhood where she runs a business.  To meet her family's needs and to support her husband, Afoua earns income by selling products at her general store.  Afoua buys her stock once a week at the market.  She needs this loan to order boxes of sardines and batteries to earn more profit and to help pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 9 boxes of sardines and 7 boxes of batteries.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Germán de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, además a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños  y con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. todo por mayor para poder empezar a realizar sus cultivos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Germán, 34 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked growing corn and beans for a number of years, in addition to raising cattle. He sells his products in nearby villages and with the earnings that he gets, is how he manages to get ahead with his family. He is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc., all in bulk, to be able to begin to grow his crops and in this way be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Segundo Virgilio

texts.es: El sr. Segundo tiene 56 años y tiene 4 hijos es una persona amable y dentro de sus sueños y esperanzas para el futuro están sembrar nuevas plantas de tara y comprar vacas mejoradas. El préstamo ayudara en la compra de abono orgánico para tara y así de esta manera incrementar la economía familiar, con 15 años en el negocio le gusta por ser de poca inversión y se utiliza su madera en el uso de mangos para herramientas como picos, martillos, etc.
texts.en: Segundo is 56 years old and has 4 children. He is a friendly person and among his dreams and hopes for the future are planting new tara trees and purchasing better cows. The loan will help him to purchase organic fertilizer for tara trees and in this way increase the family economy. With 15 years in the business, he likes it for using little investment and he uses its wood for handles for tools such as picks, hammers, etc.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for tara trees.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y arroz con más de 20 años de experiencia en dicha actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, además también se dedica a la crianza de animales (ganado y pollos) comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Manuel, 57 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and child. He works growing corn, beans and rice with more than 20 years of experience in this field, which he began with his own capital. In addition, he works raising animals (cattle and chickens). He sells his products in the nearby towns and has many customers. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide, etc. to be able to have better income and a better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Serafina es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de cd’s.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área céntrica dónde se encuentran la mayoría de las oficinas y centros comerciales de la ciudad, de clima subtropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Serafina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada en la silla). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado.
