La necesidad por cubrir los gastos de su familia la llevaron a formar y liderar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de bisutería, librería, artículos de belleza, venta de frutas, servicio de transporte y venta de teléfonos celulares, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cd, dvd’s, cintas magnéticas, tapas de plástico y otros, materiales digitales para la reproducción de audio y video. Actividad que realiza en su puesto de venta fijo de lunes a sábado durante las horas del día. “trabajo de lunes a sábado porque los domingos los comercios de la zona se vacían y en las oficinas no existe nadie…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en una zona comercial, la desventaja es la competencia y la falta de capital de inversión. Su sueño es abrir una tienda distribuidora, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mercadería por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Serafina solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería por mayor para abrir una tienda distribuidora.
texts.en:
Serafina is a 45 year old woman. She has an 8 year old son and her business is selling cd’s. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, stable, active, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in ‘Mutualista’, a central area where most of the offices and stores in the city are concentrated. It has a subtropical climate with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees celsius.  
 
Serafina has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair, a short stature, and a robust frame. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business. She is sitting in the chair. She shares her life with her husband, who works, and her son, who is in school. They live in their own home built of brick and cement, with a metal sheeting roof. It has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. The need to cover the family expenses led to her forming and leading a business enterprise bank for businesses such as selling food, selling jewelry, a book store, selling beauty items, selling fruit, a transportation and selling cell phones, so that they can ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling cds, dvds, magnetic tapes, plastic covers, and digital materials for audio and video reproduction. She does this activity in her permanent sales stall Monday through Saturday, all day long. “I work Monday though Saturday, because on Sundays the area stores empty out and there is nobody in the offices.  …”, she remarks. The advantage of her business is that it is in a commercial area. The disadvantage is the competition and the lack of investing capital.  Her dream is to open a distribution store. She wants to expand her business by buying merchandise wholesale. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Serafina is asking for a loan to buy merchandise wholesale to open a distribution store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale to open a distribution store.

loans.name: Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario salud y vida está integrado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras, coordinado por Juana de 46 años, casada, madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes, ella es propietaria de una pulpería y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, la segunda socia es Mireya de 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y Marbelly de 40 años es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Salud y Vida [Health and Life] solidarity group is comprised of three enterprising micro-entrepreneurs. It is coordinated by 46-year-old Juana who is married with four children who are now independent adults. She owns a grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar and oil. 

The second member is 56-year-old Mireya, who sells clothing, and the third is 40-year-old Marbelly, who runs a grocery store from her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar and oil

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es: Marisol es una microempresaria emprendedora de 52 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos, mayores de edad e independientes, solicita por segunda vez el financiamiento en Adim, para aumentar la oferta de sus productos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y zapatos desde hace 4 años, sin embargo quiere diversificar su negocio solicitando el crédito para la compra de cosméticos como labiales, sombras, maquillaje, cremas para el cabello, shampoo y acondicionador para el cabello.
texts.en: Marisol is an enterprising micro-businesswoman. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children who are all grown and on their own. She is asking for a loan from Adim for the second time to increase her product inventory. She has sold clothing and shoes for 4 years. Nonetheless, she wants to diversify her business by selling cosmetics such as lipsticks, eyeshadow, other makeup. hair creams, shampoo and hair conditioner.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lipsticks, eyeshadows, other makeup, hair creams, shampoo and hair conditioner.

loans.name: Wilmara Del Rosario

texts.es: Wilmara es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 33 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de cuatro hijos quienes son su deseo de superación, con el crédito anterior logro cambiar el techo de su casa y solicita por cuarta vez el financiamiento de Adim, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y sandalias por encargo desde hace 10 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, chores, faldas, vestidos y sandalias.
texts.en: Wilmara is a successful and enterprising woman who is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four children who are the reason she wants to get ahead. With the previous loan, she was able to change the roof on her house and for the fourth time, she is asking for a loan from Adim. She has sold clothing and sandals by order for 10 years. She is asking for the loan to buy clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.name: Grupo Alfa Group

texts.es: Pilar de 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Grupo Alfa”  la cual lo conforman 05 socios con deseos de  trabajar honradamente. Pilar hace más de 06 años  que viene desempeñándose como guardián  de una casa. Gracias a su constante dedicación pilar puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor deseo es de poner un negocio de venta de ropa. Solicitó el crédito para pagar los estudios de su menor hijo. La Nueva Alcancía “Grupo Alfa” agradece a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Pilar es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo color fucsia y tiene en manos a su pequeña nieta.
texts.en: Pilar is 49 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She belongs to the “Grupo Alfa” communal bank. It is made up of 5 members who really want to work honorably. For more than 6 years, Pilar has been working as a guard at a house. Thanks to her constant dedication, Pilar can cover her household expenses. Her biggest wish is to open a business selling clothes. She asked for the loan to pay for her minor son's education. The new “Grupo Alfa” community bank thanks the Kiva investors for the support given. Pilar is second from the left and she is wearing a fuchsia t-shirt and she is holding her little granddaughter.

loans.use: to pay for her minor son's education.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 67 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children who are now adult age. Necitas was once a public school teacher. At present, she is engaged in a cosmetics dealing business. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a retiree and earning approximately PHP 7,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials, particularly boards and paints for house repairs and renovations. Necitas has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Necitas hopes to expand her cosmetics dealing business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, particularly boards and paints.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
In 2008, Marcelina joined Paglaum for financial needs. She accessed a loan to support her farming activities. Recently she availed a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. 

She hopes that the tide will turn in her favor and wishes to make good harvest. Marcelina would like to maintain her membership with Paglaum and keeps in mind that she should repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 43 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, island of Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with 2 dependent children now of school age. Matilde earns a living from sales commissions as Sales Manager in one of the country's land developers. She is also receiving a monthly allotment from her husband who is a seaman. She earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month from this type of business. 

Matilde has requested a loan to be used to pay her daughter's tuition fees who is presently studying in one of the universities in Cebu City. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. Matilde wants to save more in the cooperative for her children's educational needs in the near future.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Gemelita

texts.en:
Gemelita is from Oroquieta. She is earning a living in her small grocery store business, supporting her husband who provides income for their family. 

To generate more income, Gemelita decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. 

Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales. Gemelita smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is driven by passion for selling. She is a widow from Oroquieta City and runs a store that is her primary support for her needs. She never gets tired of tending to her store. 

Pablita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has already taken several loans. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now she took another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра женщина 50 лет, замужем, счастливая мать и бабушка. Вот уже на протяжение 25 лет Гулчехра занимается животноводством. На своем участке земли она ухаживает за тремя коровами и десятью баранами. Из молока, полученного от дойки коров, Гулчехра приготавливает кефир, курт и другие молочные продукты. Также Гулчехра выращивает овощи и фрукты на своем участке и продает их на рынке. Гулчехра сотрудничает с МДО Арвандом с 2013 года, у нее хорошая кредитная историю. Она хочет получить повторный кредит ,чтобы продолжить свое дело. Гулчехра надеется на положительный ответ от МДО Арванд. Благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Gulchehra is 50 years old, married, and a happy grandmother. For 25 years she has raised livestock. On her land she tends to three cows and ten sheep. From the milk she gets from her cows Gulchehra makes kefir, kurt (a type of fresh cheese), and other dairy products. Gulchehra also grows fruits and vegetables on her land and sells them at the market. Gulchehra has worked with MDO Arvand since 2013 and has a good credit history. She would like to take out a loan again in order to continue her business and hopes to receive an affirmative answer from MDO Arvand. She thanks them in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Жещину на фотографии зовут Бароат. Ей 30 лет. Она ответственный человек. Бароат замужем и имеет двоих детей. 
  Бароат на рынке занимается продажей фруктов. Она занимается торговлей около 5 лет. Бароат не имеет магазина или какой-нибудь площадки, помещения. Бароат приносит товар и ставит их на столе в коробках и занимается продажей. Бароату приходится каждое утро рано вставать и разложить товар, до прихода покупателей. 
Фотография была сделана в полдень, когда бывает очень много людей на рынках. Бароат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить фрукты и увеличить ассортимент товара. Она хочет продвинуть свой бизнес на новый уровень. Бароат хочет иметь собственный магазин, быть успешной женщиной и дать детям достойное образование, которое она не смогла получить. Поддержите Бароат.
texts.en: The woman in the photo is Baroat. She is 30 years old and a responsible person. Baroat is married and has two children. She sells fruits at the market and has been working in this job for 5 years. Baroat doesn't have a store or her own facilities. She brings her wares to the market and displays them in boxes on a table.She has to wake up early every morning and set out her merchandise before the customers come. The photo was taken midday, when many people are at the market. Baroat has applied for a loan to purchase fruits and expand her product offerings. She wants to move her business up to a new level. She wants to have her own store, to be successful and to give her children the good education she could not have.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Это Гулсара. Ей 47 лет. Она честная и очень трудолюбивая жительница района Вахш. Гулсара замужем и мать троих детей. 2 сыновей и одна дочка. Старший сын женат, и он находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Гулсара в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У нее есть коровник, где она ухаживает о домашних животных. Гулсара выращивает крупнорогатого скота уже 6 лет. Она покупает скота и откармливает их 30-35 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Гулсара  еще занимается земледелием. Она имеет 0.60 Га земельный участок. Гулсара  выращивает пшеницу и арбуз. Ей в работе помогает младший сын. Гулсара обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести крупнорогатого скота и расширить деятельность. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Гулсара заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: This is Gulsara. She is 47. She is an honest and very hard-working resident of the Bakhsh region. Gulsara is married and the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is married and is away working in the Russian Federation. Gulsara is engaged in agriculture in the local area. She has a cow shed where she looks after domesticated animals. Gulsara has been raising large-horned cattle for six years. She buys cattle and fattens them for 30-35 days, then sells them on at the cattle market. Gulsara also farms crops. She has 0.60 hectares of land. Gulsara grows wheat and watermelon. Her younger son helps her in her work. Gulsara has asked for a loan to acquire large-horned cattle and expand her business. She looks forward to your support and expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy large-horned cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Шамсия 43 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Шамсия вместе семьей живет на районе Шахристон. У нее 2 сыновей и 1 дочка. Сыновьям 20 и 15 лет. Дочке 17 лет. Старший сын учится в Государственном университете. Младший сын о дочка учатся в средней школе. Шамсия серьезная и шустрая женщина. Она в районе работает будущим специалистом в сфере по социальной развитии.  Шамсия 19 лет своей жизни занято этой деятельности. 
Шамсия хочет поменять холодильник. Она копила деньги для нового холодильник.  Шамсия была расстроена признав, что ее денег не хватит  для приобретения нового холодильника. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Ваша поддержка поможет ей улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en:
Shamsiya is 43. She is married and the mother of three children. Shamsiya lives with her family in the Shahriston region. She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons are 20 and 15 years old, and her daughter is 17. Her eldest son is studying at the State University. Her youngest son and daughter are in high school. Shamsiya is a serious and active woman. She works in the area as a budding specialist in the field of social development. Shamsiya has been engaged in this work for 19 years.

Shamsiya wants to change her refrigerator. She has been saving up for a new refrigerator. Shamsiya was upset to realize that she had insufficient money to acquire a new refrigerator. Due to her lack of money, she has turned to you for a loan. Your support will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.ru: Девушку на фотографии зовут Фарангиз. Она добрая и гостеприимная. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и имеет уже троих детей. Фарангиз вместе с семьей проживает на районе Спитамен. Фарангиз большую часть своей жизни проводит с детьми и занимаясь домашними делами. Но она находит время и для шитья. Она принимается заказы на шитье женской одежды. Сейчас чтобы продолжить швейную деятельность Фарангизу необходимо купить другую машинку. Она хочет купить профессиональную машинку. Новая машинка ускорит процесс работы и повлияет на качество шитья. Фарангис надеется на кредит и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Farangiz is 24 years old and married with three children. She is good-hearted and amiable. Farangiz and her family live in the Spitamen region. Farangiz spends most of her time caring for her children and doing housework. But she also finds time for sewing. She makes women's clothing to order. Now, in order to continue her sewing business, Farangiz needs a new sewing machine. She would like to purchase a professional machine. A new machine will allow her to work faster and also affects the quality of the work. Farangiz is counting on a loan and on your support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 62 years old, residing at Villaflor, Oroquieta City. Vergie is married and she joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services.

Recently, she has accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities and food products that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to resell.

loans.name: Danilo Enrique

texts.es: Es un microempresario emprendedor de 33 años de edad, acompañado, padre de 2 niños que son su mayor motivación, es propietario de una pulpería y tiene 4 años dirigiendo este negocio, solicita por quinta vez el financiamiento de Adim y con el crédito anterior logro comprar una moto, que le facilito movilizarse para realizar gestiones de su negocio, así mismo logro aumentar la oferta de productos en su pulpería,  el crédito lo solicita para la compara de aceite, arroz, azúcar, leche, pollo y embutidos.
texts.en:
Danilo Enrique is an enterprising 33 years old, he is married, and has 2 children who are his biggest motivation.

He is the owner of a food store, and has spent 4 years running this business. He is asking for a loan for the 5th time from ADIM, and with the pervious loan he managed to buy a motorcycle which enabled him to carry out his business activities. 

At the same time he managed to increase the range of products in his shop, he is asking for this loan to buy oil, rice, sugar, milk chicken and sausages.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, milk, chicken and sausages

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and her child's education. 

Sherly dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her child a college education to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fue

texts.en: Fue is a 31-year-old unmarried woman with four children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living and she has four years of experience with this business. Fue needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fue has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment to make ice cakes.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en:
Faleupolu is a 47-year-old mother with 10 children. She owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Faleupolu hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this she needs a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil to help her run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil for her food business.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 28 years old and married with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Freda has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use the profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter for her textiles business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Leonida is separated and has three children, who are now school age. 

Leonida earns a living from a coconut buying and trading business. She has been engaged in this business for almost 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this business activity. 

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 14,500 to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and retrading. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her copra retrading business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts for copra processing and retrading.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room for the kitchen.

loans.name: Liliana María

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 31  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  1  hijo que estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es cocinero en una empresa de pescado.
Doña Liliana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También ella es profesora en una escuela privada. Trabaja de Lunes a Viernes de dos a tres horas al día en la venta de cosméticos y de maestra de lunes a viernes de 7h00 a 14h00, su forma de venta es a  crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar maquillajes, perfumes y cremas ya que tiene pedidos.  Este es el tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en: The city of Manta is considered the most important and popular visited resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and friendly beaches; the first water port of deep waters of Ecuador and South America. Here is where Liliana lives. She is 31 years old, married and has a son, who attends school. Her husband is a cook at a fish company. Liliana is a housewife, who in order to earn her own money to help her husband with household expenses, works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women accessories). She is also a teacher at a private school. She works from Mondays to Fridays from two to three hours a day selling cosmetics, and Mondays to Fridays from 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. as a teacher. She sells by credit, and gets paid every week. She has worked for four years in this activity, and she is doing very well. What she sells the most are perfumes and cosmetics. She will use this loan to buy makeup, perfumes and creams, because she already has orders. This is her third loan cycle in the Credit Group, and she likes it because payments are easy to do. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy makeup, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 52 years old, married and lives at Tangub, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. 

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Egleseria

texts.en:
Egleseria is from Tangub, Philippines. She is 59 years old, married and has four children. 

In order to sustain their family, Egleseria sells bleaching liquid in front of their house. Her product is salable since most of the women in the area use bleaching liquid in their house, especially in their laundry. She has had this business for almost five years now and it's doing well. She earns a meager income to support her family in addition to the income of her husband. 

She requested a loan to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers. Egleseria is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria hoped for good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Maria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell. Maria wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is grateful that she was granted a 15,000 (PHP) to buy more quantities and varieties of ornamental plants to sell. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 loan that she will use to buy fertilizers, pots, wires and net she needs to grow more beautiful and healthy ornamental plants.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and for her good sales, for they will surely cover her family's daily personal and household needs.

Erlinda hopes to grow and be more successful in her ornamental farm. She aims to improve their quality of life and prays for a healthy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pots, wires and net she needs to grow more beautiful and healthy ornamental plants.

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es: Marisol esta separada de su esposo, ella tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 19, 21 y 22 años de edad, Marisol se dedica a la crianza de ganado y tambien se dedica a trabajar de empleada domestica, Marisol necesita el dinero del credito para comprar una vaca ya que mediante la comercializacion del ganado obtiene sus ingresos, Marisol tiene la aspiracio de mejorar sus ingresos y terminar de dar la educacion a sus 3 hijos que son muy aplicados en su estudios y a la vez ellos tambien se apoyan con algunos ingresos trabajando  a medio tiempo.
texts.en: Marisol is separated from her husband. She has three children, who are 19, 21 and 22 years old. Marisol works raising cattle and also as a domestic employee. Marisol needs the loan money to buy a cow, because through commercializing cattle she earns her income. Marisol wants to improve her income and finish giving her three children an education, because they are very responsible with their studies and they also support her with some income by working part time.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Xejuyupenses Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer muy agradecida por el crédito anterior, pues ella cuenta que su vida ha sido beneficiada de gran manera porque logro comprar sus diferentes tipos de hilos y compro más ropas típicas para surtir mejor su negocio, y con las ganancias que obtuvo  a cubierto los gastos de su familia, pero ahora ella solicita un nuevo crédito junto a su grupo para invertirlo en la compra y venta  de hilos de tipo seda, alemán, lustrina, mish para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
Catarina tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito, para poder realizar esta inversión y poder próximamente abrir otro negocio.
texts.en:
Catarina is a very grateful for the previous loan, she says that her life has benefited greatly because she managed to buy different types of thread and typical, traditional clothing to supply her business better. 

And the earnings that she obtained  covered the expenses of her family, but now she is asking for a new loan together with her group to invest in the purchase and sale of threads and cloths, to  sell them at a good price. 

Catarina hopes to obtain the loan, to be able to make the investment and soon open another business.

loans.use: to buy and sell silk wire, silk cloth and other materials

loans.name: Tanicia

texts.fr: Tanicia vit à Arcahaïe. 33 ans, célibataire et sans enfant, c’est une entrepreneuse infatigable. Elle vend des produits alimentaires : légumes, vivres, etc. Elle a déjà eu plusieurs petits crédits chez Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal pour développer son activité. Elle a toujours bien utilisé ses crédits et les a remboursés sans difficultés. Elle a besoin d’un nouveau prêt pour augmenter son stock
texts.en: 33-year-old Tanicia lives in Arcahaie. This single woman, who has no children to support, is a tireless entrepreneur. She sells food products: vegetables, foodstuffs, etc. She has already received several small loans from Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal in order to develop her business. She has always put these loans to good use and paid them back without incident. She needs this new loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en:
Falanika is 35 years old with 6 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Falanika needs a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a shovel, and a backpack-sprayer to help her with the business. Falanika hopes to use her profits in the future for home improvement and to satisfy her family's needs.

She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a shovel, and a backpack-sprayer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her barbequed food business

loans.name: Kaisarina

texts.en:
Kaisarina is a 28-year-old woman who is divorced with 2 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business.

Kaisarina has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Ее зовут Шахноза. Ей 25 лет. Шахноза занимается продажей одежды на местном рынке города Душанбе. Шахноза живет одна с мамой. Финансовое положение семьи не позволили ей продолжить учебу и Шахноза была вынуждена бросить школу после 5 того класса. Вот уже 6 лет Шахноза на рынке торгует женскую одежду. Шахноза хочет расширить деятельность, привести новый товар и увеличить ассортимент одежды. С такими намерениями она обратилась в Kiva за поддержку.
texts.en: Shahnoza is 25 years old. She sells clothing at the local market in Dushanbe. Shahnoza lives with her mother. The family's financial situation prevented her from continuing her education and Shahnoza had to leave school after 5th grade. For six years Shahnoza has sold women's clothing at the market. She wants to expand her business, provide new merchandise and increase the range of styles she offers. It is with these objectives that she turns to Kiva for support.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and expand her product offerings

loans.name: Faatuatua

texts.en:
Faatuatua is 28 years old and joined SPBD in 2013 in the island of Samoa. She has a small business selling taro and banana in her village and at the market. She has more than 2 years experience with this.

Faatuatua will borrow an amount of 2000 WST to buy banana root seedlings, chemicals, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a backpack-sprayer, a knife, and a rake to help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana root seedlings, chemicals, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a backpack-sprayer, a knife, and a rake.

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en:
Aotoa is a 24-year-old single woman with 1 child. She makes and sells small afternoon meals in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Aotoa needs a loan to buy chicken leg quarters, sausages, cooking oil, paper plates and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Aotoa has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, sausages, cooking oil, paper plates, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda started with a small piggery business and then became boss of her own small meat shop. She has managed to have enough meat supplies for her shop and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales because of her good selling skills. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene earns through retailing various food commodities. Her husband is a farmer and cultivates rice land to provide the needs of their family. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for her house. She is on her way to completing her house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for her house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old and married. She lives in Caniangan, Tangub. 

For the past 12 years, Editha and her husband have had been farmers. She earns a good return doing this activity to provide for their family. She is a new member of PMPC. 

Editha is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sooula

texts.en:
Sooula is a 49-year-old widow with 6 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Sooula needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Sooula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose.

loans.name: Filemu

texts.en:
Filemu is a 51-year-old divorced woman with 8 children. She makes and sells popcorn and ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Filemu needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, corn kernels, vegetable oil, and a large pot. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Filemu has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, corn kernels, vegetable oil, and a large pot.

loans.name: Tofamamao

texts.en:
Tofamamao is a Samoan citizen. She is a woman with one child. She is 27 years old and runs a business of selling bananas and taro at the market to earn a living. She has this experience for more than a year. 

Tofamamao hopes to expand her business. In doing this, she needs a loan of $1,000 to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer and chemicals to run the business. Tofamamao joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer and chemicals

loans.name: Yomaira Mercedes

texts.es:
Manta es conocida en el Ecuador por tener uno de los mejores puertos marítimos, posee ventajas comparativas (dada su posición geográfica, biodiversidad, climatología, etc.); en todos estos lugares hay variados restaurantes y diversos sitios esparcimiento.
En este lugar vive la señora Yomaira, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Yomaira  es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de pescado, este negocio lo tiene en su casa el cual lo puso con sus propios recursos , ella trabaja todos los días de 13h00 a 18h00, el negocio lo tiene 5 años y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado ya que en más cantidad le dan más descuentos.  Ella tiene en el grupo de crédito 2 ciclos y le gusta porque le ayudan a progresar en su negocio. Su sueño es tener una marisquería.
texts.en:
Manta is a place in Ecuador that is famous for having one of the best maritime ports, it has many advantages such as it's location, biodiversity and climate. There are a variety of restaurants there and a great range of recreational spaces. 

Manta is Yomaira's home city, Yomaira is a single Mom and she is 29 years old. She lives with her parents. Yomaira is an excellent mother, she makes a living selling fish. SHe runs this business from home, she started it herself, and works everyday from one until six in the afternoon. Yomaira has been running this business for five years and it is going well. She has been in her loans group for two cycles and she like it a lot as it helps her business to progress. Yomaira's dream is to have a seafood restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a citizen of Samoa. She is 18 years old and runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches in her village and at the market. She has more than a year of experience with this business. 

Angela was thinking of expanding her business, so she joined SPBD in 2015 to seek financial access. Angela has requested a loan to buy bread, butter, a box of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, mayonnaise, and containers to help her run the business.

loans.use: to buy bread, butter, a box of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, mayonnaise, and containers.

loans.name: Leafafulifao

texts.en:
Leafafulifao is 49 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Leafafulifao needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, seeds, and new gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015 and will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, seeds, and new gloves.

loans.name: Sapina

texts.en:
Sapina is 48 years old with 10 children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sapina has requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her business profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Taemoa

texts.en:
Taemoa is 55 years old and unmarried with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Taemoa needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Taemoa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Malala

texts.en:
Malala is 35 years old and single with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Malala needs a loan to buy new overalls, shovels, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Malala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new overalls, shovels, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and new boots

loans.name: Taatua

texts.en:
Taatua is a 24-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Taatua needs a loan to buy a new BBQ set, tongs, a barrel of soya sauce, tomato sauce, paper plates and foil. She plans to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her parent's home. Taatua has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new BBQ set, tongs, a barrel of soya sauce, tomato sauce, paper plates and foil

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a Samoan citizen. She joined SPBD in 2012 to seek financing for her business. Lina is 37 years old with three children. She operates a business of selling taro and bananas at the market with the assistance of her children. 

Lina hopes to expand her business. In order to do this, Lina needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a knife, safety boots, taro roots (seedlings) and banana roots (seedlings) to help run the business. She will use her profit for home improvement and to provide for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a knife, safety boots, taro roots (seedlings) and banana roots (seedlings)

loans.name: Katie

texts.en:
Katie is 30 years old with five children. She is a citizen of Samoa. She runs a business providing taxi transportation services to people.

Katie hopes to maintain good service. In order to do this, she needs to borrow $1,500 WST to buy a new seat cover, paint, new windows, and new wheels, and to renew her license. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi to assist her business in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy new a seat cover, paint, new windows, and new wheels, and to renew her license.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 49-year-old mother with four children. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living.

Malia has requested for a loan to buy rolls of material (assorted colors), needles, a sewing machine, a tape measure, paint colors and paint brushes to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. She will use her profit to expand her business. Malia became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material (assorted colors), needles, a sewing machine, a tape measure, paint colors, and paint brushes.

loans.name: Sinafea

texts.en: Sinafea is a 26-year-old unmarried woman with 2 children. She runs a soda delivery business in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Sinafea needs a loan to buy a large freezer, a new cooler, plastic bags, trays and cases of canned sodas. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sinafea has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a large freezer, a new cooler, plastic bags, trays and cases of canned sodas

loans.name: Malaeolema

texts.en: Malaeolema is a 38-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Malaeolema needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Malaeolema has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Violetsonnia

texts.en: Violetsonnia is a Samoan citizen, who is 28 years old with 4 children. She joined SPBD in 2012 to seek financing for her business. She runs a business selling pork cake and pancakes in a school compound. She has had this experience for more than a year. Violetsonnia hopes to expand her business in every school lunch time; to do this, she needs to borrow 2000 WST to buy a sack of flour, yeast, chicken, containers, plastic bags, a frying pan, a gas stove, and mushroom soy sauce to help her with the business. Violetsonnia will use her profit to build a bakery store in the near future and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, yeast, chicken, containers, plastic bags, a frying pan, a gas stove, and mushroom soy sauce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Sooga

texts.en:
Sooga is a 28-year-old divorced woman with two children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Sooga needs a loan to buy two new coolers, a new fishing canoe, fishing hooks, new rods, fishing line and flippers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Sooga has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy two new coolers, a new fishing canoe, fishing hooks, new rods, fishing line and flippers

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 24-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Akenese needs a loan to buy a new spear, flippers, a new canoe, fishing net and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Akenese has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new spear, flippers, a new canoe, fishing net and new goggles

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is a 48-year-old widow with 9 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 7 years of experience with this business. Emi has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, needles, thread, measuring tape, and 2 new sewing machines. She plans to use her profits to pay for the expansion of her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, needles, thread, measuring tape, and 2 new sewing machines.

loans.name: Katty Alexandra

texts.es:
Manta es conocida en el Ecuador por tener uno de los mejores puertos marítimos, posee ventajas comparativas (dada su posición geográfica, biodiversidad, climatología, etc.); en todos estos lugares encontramos variados restaurantes y diversos sitios esparcimiento.
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 6 y 3 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El cónyuge es comerciante de bocaditos.
Doña Katty es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y también a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00. La venta de ropa la puso con sus propios recursos y ya tiene 5 años a esta actividad y 2 años a la venta de bocaditos, vende todos los días pero los cobros los realiza cada semana,  quincenal o mensual.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar blusas, ropa interior, pantalonetas, sandalias y bisutería. Ella tiene en el grupo de crédito 5 años, le gusta la agilidad de los créditos. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Manta is known in Ecuador for having one of the best maritime ports. It has comparative benefits (owing to its geographic position, biodiversity, climate, etc.). In all of these places, there are many restaurants and different attractions.

In this place, lives Mrs. Katty. She is 28 years old and is in a relationship, from which she has three children, who are 9, 6, and 3 years old. Her children study in school. Her partner is seller of snacks. 

Katty is a good housewife, who is dedicate to preparing and selling snacks and also to selling all types of clothing. She works everday from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. She sells clothing with her own resources and already has 5 years of experience in this work. She has 2 years of experience selling snacks. She sells everday but  collects money weekly, biweekly, or monthly.

This loan will be used to buy shirts, undergarments, pants, sandals, and costume jewelry. She has been in a loan group for 5 years. She likes the flexibility of the loans. Her dream is to have her own location.

loans.use: to buy shirts, undergarments, pants, sandals, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Guineales 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuela (la primera del lado izquierdo dela fotografía de blusa blanca) es una señora muy amable y responsable que ha logrado sus objetivos porque gracias al crédito anterior  logro cultivar café y darle su  mantenimiento,  con el que logro una buena cosecha y obtuvo buenas ganancias;  pero ahora solicita un nuevo  crédito junto a su grupo para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café comprando fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra
Manuela tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
Manuela (the first from the left in the photograph in the white shirt) is a very kind and responsible woman, who has succeeded in her goals. Thanks to her previous loan, she succeeded in growing coffee and maintaining her crop. With this, she succeeded in having a good harvest and obtaining good earnings. 

Now, she requests a new loan with her group so that she can maintain her coffee crop by buying fertilizers and to pay workers. 

Manuela has hopes of getting a new loan to continue improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mwihangiri Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady in red is Nancy. She is a member of Mwihangiri Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially in group mobilization, savings, enterprise development and financial management. She is 54 years old, married and blessed with three children. 

She operates a green grocers where she sells potatoes, onions and cabbages, and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables and fruits, e.g., potatoes, onions, cabbages and assorted fruits, in order to add stock to her grocery store; hence, she will increase her sales and also meet her customers' demand.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits, e.g., potatoes, onions, cabbages and assorted fruits, in order to add stock to her grocery store

loans.name: Vaimutia

texts.en:
Vaimutia is a 35-year-old mother with five children. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She joined SPBD in 2009 to seek assistance for her business.

Vaimutia hopes to expand her business and provide for family needs. In order to do this, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, chemicals, hand gloves, a knife and containers to help her run the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, chemicals, hand gloves and a knife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, canned food and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a 21-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Sala needs a loan to buy rubber gloves, tongs, barbeque sauce, paper plates, plastic forks and paper towels. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sala has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy rubber gloves, tongs, barbeque sauce, paper plates, plastic forks and paper towels

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en:
Pisi is a 31-year-old woman with two children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Pisi has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs (for fabric), containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Pisi hopes to build a small elei (painted fabric designs) shop in her village in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs (for fabric), containers and a printing machine

loans.name: Vela

texts.en:
Vela is a 47-year-old divorced mother with four children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Vela needs a loan to buy new boots, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Vela will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and crops

loans.name: Peninaotiafau

texts.en:
Peninaotiafau is a Samoan citizen. She is 24 years old. She operates a business of selling vegetables at the market to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 and has had this experience for more than a year. 

Peninaotiafau has a good income from her business. She hopes to expand by exporting them overseas. In order to do this, she needs a loan of 1,500 WST to buy more vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and hand gloves to help her in operating the business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and hand gloves.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale is 55 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed material (fabric designs) to earn a living and has been doing this for 10 years. 

Fale has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, wooden carved designs, stencils, brushes, rollers and rolls of material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, wooden carved designs, stencils, brushes, rollers and rolls of material

loans.name: Mkongoni Group

texts.en:
Kheri, who is in his early 50s, is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been selling charcoal for seven years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kheri's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment and to cover household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell and to finish paying for his motorcycle. He dreams of finishing building his house by putting in floor tiles and electricity. 

Kheri will share this loan with his loan group, Mkongoni, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell and to finish paying for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en el colegio y 2 en la escuela y 1 bebé de (18 meses). El cónyuge es comerciante de mariscos. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Santa es una muy  buena esposa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza los créditos, él  utiliza el crédito para invertirlo en su trabajo, él es distribuidor mayorista de mariscos en toda la sierra, vende pescado, conchas, camarones, pulpo, calamar, etc. Ella le ayuda en las ventas y también vende desde hace tres años productos Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabajan todos los días de 5h00 a 17h00 con el esposo y de dos a tres horas en la venta de sus productos.
Este crédito lo va a compartir con su cónyuge, una parte en comprar cosméticos, pescado, camarones, conchas, etc. Lleva varios años en el grupo y le gusta  porque son muy unidas y la fundación apoya a las socias. Sus sueños son tener casa propia y un negocio estable.
texts.en:
The canton El Carmen stands out in agriculture. The area grows bananas, coffee, cocoa, corn, and a large variety of fruits (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc.) In livestock, the area stands out for raising cattle, horses, pigs, and birds on farms.

In this place, lives Mrs. Santa. She is 31 years old and is in a relationship from which she has 6 children, of whom 3 study in high school, 2 in primary school, and 1 is an 18-month-old baby. Her partner sells seafood. They live in their own house.

Santa is a very good wife because she helps her husband with loans. He uses the loan to invest in his work. He is a wholesale distributor of seafood throughout the mountains. He sells fish, shells, shrimp, octopi, squid, etc. She helps him in his sales and also for three years has sold Avon, Esika, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works everyday from 5 in the morning until 5 in the evening with her husband and for three hours on selling her products.

This loan will be shared with her husband. Part will be used to buy cosmetics, fish, shrimp, shells, etc. She has spent many years in the group. She likes it because they are very united and because the foundation supports the members. Her dreams are to have her own house and a stable business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fish, shrimp, shells, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Sector Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Antonio (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera azul)  es un hombre muy trabajador, que trabaja de sol a sol para darle lo mejor a su familia, esta hombre junto a su grupo se encuentran muy agradecidos por el crédito anterior, pues Antonio pudo comprar sus insumos y logro darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de banano. Pero ahora él y su grupo solicitan un nuevo crédito para poder comparar sus fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento de café.
Él tiene las esperanzas  de conseguir nuevamente el crédito, para poder producir una buena cosecha de café y obtener sus ingresos para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Antonio (the first from the left in the photograph in the blue t-shirt) is a very hard-working man. He work from dusk until daen to give the best to his family. This man, together with his group, is very thankful for their previous loan, since Antonio was able to buy his supplies and, thus, succeeded in maintaining his banana crop. 

Now, he and his group request a new loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pay workers to maintain his coffee crop.

He has hopes of getting a new loan so that he can produce a good coffee crop and obtain income to build his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.fr: Olivia est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Pour répondre à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, elle a créé une activité commerciale où elle vend de la viande congelée. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de poulets réfrigérés.
texts.en: Olivia is 39 years old. She is a widowed mother to three children who regularly attend school. In order to meet her and her family's needs, she started a commercial enterprise selling frozen meats. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock of frozen chicken.

loans.use: to purchase frozen chicken

loans.name: Toalua

texts.en:
Toalua is a 42-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business selling fish and chips at the market. She has had this experience for more than a year. Toalua is a Samoan citizen.

Toalua hopes to expand her business. In order to do this, she needs a loan of $1,500 WST to buy a sack of potatoes, vegetable oil, a fry pan, plastic bags, aluminum foil, fish and tomato sauce to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2014. She will use her profit in the near future to build a small restaurant and provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a sack of potatoes, vegetable oil, a fry pan, plastic bags, aluminum foil, fish and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his late 20s, is married with one small child. He has had a music and photo studio for seven years now. He works from from 9am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Charles's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the money to buy more advanced music systems for his music performances. He dreams of adding more and better instruments.

Charles will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy more advanced music systems for his music performances

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is 42 years old with one child. For more than a year, she has been selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development, Kiva's partner, in 2014. A loan amount of $1500 WST will help Akenese to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack a sprayer, and a knife to assist with the business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow taro and bananas.

loans.name: Edda Angélica

texts.es:
Edda es una joven de 19 años a su corta edad logró graduarse de secundaria obteniendo el titulo de perito mercantil y contador público, actualmente esta cursando la carrera de ingeniería en producción.
Vive en compañía de su abuela desde que era pequeña, ya que sus padres viajaron al extranjero y no retornaron.
Su tía Reyna decidió apoyarle económicamente para que ella lograra superarse y culminar sus estudios universitarios, optando al financiamiento educativo.
Edda se considera una joven sincera, paciente, positiva y sobre todo temerosa de Dios ya que desde niña su abuela la formó por el camino cristiano en donde reconoce que Dios es el centro de su vida.
Su motivación para culminar sus estudios siempre ha sido su abuela quien tomo el papel de madre para ella ya que podrá ayudarla económicamente y honrara a su tía por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
Desea ser parte esa masa de jóvenes luchadores y prósperos que cada día desean engrandecer al país mediante sus estudios profesionales.
Edda desea salir adelante con el financiamiento que personas de buen corazón realizan para superación profesional. En el futuro se ve convertida en una exitoso empresaria siendo capaz de generar oportunidades de empleo a otros jóvenes como ella.
texts.en:
Edda is a 19 year old young woman.  At her young age she managed to graduate high school with a degree in accounting and as a public accountant.  She is currently taking courses in production engineering.  She has lived with her grandmother ever since she was little because her parents traveled abroad and did not return.

Her aunt Reyna decided to support her financially so that she could improve herself and finish her university studies.  She is choosing educational financing.

Edda is considered to be a sincere, patient, positive, and God fearing young woman.  Ever since she was a girl her grandmother steered her down the Christian path where she recognizes God as the center of her life.

Her motivation for completing her studies has always been her grandmother, who took on the role of mother for her.  Edda will be able to help her financially, and she will honor her aunt for the support she has given her.

She wishes to be a part of the mass of struggling and prosperous young people who, each day, wish to enhance the country through their professional education.

Edda wishes to get ahead with this loan for her professional success, which is from good hearted people.  In the future she sees herself as an excellent businesswoman who is capable of generating employment opportunities to other young people like her.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses in the field of production engineering.

loans.name: Rosa Jacqueline

texts.es:
A el cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí” por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11y 9 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El cónyuge es recaudador en una empresa privada. Viven en casa arrendando.
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay más diseños y con estos aprende aún más, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 a 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y ser una diseñadora muy reconocida y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen is known as the “The Golden Door of Manabi” because of its production of bananas, which is unique in the country and exported all over the world.

In this place lives Mrs. Rosa. She is 30 years old and is in a relationship, from which she has 2 children who are 11 and 9 years old. Her children are studying in school. Her partner is a tax collector in a private business. They live in a rented house.

Rosa has the goal of having her own income. She takes advantage of her knowledge of cutting fabric and making clothing by putting a small tailoring workshop in her house. There, she is dedicated to making all types of clothing for women, men, and children. What she likes most is making clothing for women or girls, since they are the most stylish and with these, she learn even more. She works based on orders from particular people and by season. She also makes uniforms for institutions, schools, and high schools in the area. She works everday from 8 in the morning until noon and form 2 in the afternoon until 8 at night. At times, she works even later when she has orders to deliver.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials for tailoring. Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop and be a very well-known designer. She also wants to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Alba Pastora

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete. Aquí se reúnen las socias del grupo de crédito Las Invencibles.
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 56 años de edad y  es viuda,  tiene 10  hijos, 8 mayores de edad e independientes y dos que viven con ella de 21  y 17 de años, el ultimo estudia en el colegio. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Alba se dedica a la cría de pollos en una pequeña granja en su casa, ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras por su casa y en pie a comerciante, sus hijos son quienes le ayudan  y les ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos y alimento de pollos. Ella es fundadora del grupo de crédito hace 6 años y fue invitada a ser parte del grupo por las vecinas del sector. Su sueño es tener una casa nueva ya que la que tiene esta deteriorada.
texts.en:
The region of El Carmen is named in honor of the Virgin Carmen. It is a region with considerable richness in flora and fauna, and one of the main sources of income is the cultivation of the Barraganete banana. El Carmen is where the members of the credit group Las Invencibles meet. 

Alba lives in El Carmen, she is a widow and 56 years old. Alba has 10 children, eight of whom are grown up and independent, and two who live at home, they are 21 and 17 years old. Her youngest child studies at high school. Alba has her own home. Alba makes a living raising chickens in a small farm that is part of her home. Alba regularly buys a large number of chickens which she then raises for three months, at this stage they are ready to be sold. Alba sells the chickens to shops in the area and also sells them by the pound from her house and door to door. Her children help her with this work. The business is going well and it is a way to make money from her home. 

This new loan will be used to buy chickens and chicken feed. Alba founded her credit group six years ago and she was invited to join the group by her neighbours in the sector. Her dream is to have a new home, as her current home is in a state of disrepair.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mafa

texts.en:
Mafa is a 22-year-old mother with 2 children. 

She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Mafa needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, a frying pan, mushroom soy sauce and containers to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, a frying pan, mushroom soy sauce and containers

loans.name: Vaiono

texts.en:
Vaiono is 46 years old and divorced with 4 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Vaiono needs a loan to buy fertilizer, new boots, a machete, chemicals, new overalls, a new wheelbarrow and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, new boots, a machete, chemicals, new overalls, a new wheelbarrow and crops

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a married women with six children. She runs a small business preparing and selling rice and curry in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Litia has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, curry, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, potatoes, onions, plastics bags, and a container for her business. Litia will use her profit to build a small restaurant in the near future. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development, Kiva's partner, in 2015.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene ocho hijos, dos de 18 y 8 años que estudian en la escuela y en el colegio, los otros son mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es comerciante de frutas.
Doña Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de  en la que vende frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días desde las  06h00 hasta las 19h00, ella se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles el mejor producto a sus clientes, ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo  y tienen este negocio por 20  años. A pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas y verduras, (manzanas, peras, bananos, papayas, zanahorias, papas, choclos, cebollas entre otros). Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace muchos años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo. Su sueño es tener casa propia, ella ha reunido dinero con mucho esfuerzo para comprarse su casa tan soñada.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out in agriculture. They grow Barraganete bananas, coffee, cocoa, corn and a great variety of fruit (pineapples, oranges, passionfruit, etc.) As to livestock they raise cows, horses pigs and small animals.

Gloria lives here. She is 54 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has 8 children. The 18 year old and 8 year old study in Secondary and primary schools and the others are adults and independent. Her husband sells fruit.

Gloria has a stand in the city market where she sells fruit and vegetables. She works every day from 6 am until 7 pm. She goes to the wholesale market early in the morning to buy the best produce to be able to offer to her clients. She works in company with her husband and has had this business for 20 years. Despite the work being demanding she has to do it for the well-bring of her family.

She will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables (apples, pears, bananas, papayas, carrots, potatoes, corn and onions amongst others). She has been a member of the communal bank for many years and she likes it as her group is very united. Her dream is to have her own house. She has collected money with a lot of effort to buy the house she dreams of so.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Jotalina

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, es madre soltera de 2 hijos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella vive en una casa arrendada con su hermana.
Doña Santa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo (camisetas, jeans, blusas, etc.). Trabaja cinco días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo  y le va muy bien ya que lo que vende es de muy buena calidad.
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, jeans, blusas entre otros. Es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es tener casa propia para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en: The canton of El Carmen is known for its agriculture: they grow barraganete plantains, coffee, cocoa, corn and a large variety of fruits (pineapples, oranges, passion fruit, etc).
