In the area of livestock they especially raise cows, horses, pigs, and poultry. Santa lives here; she is a single mother to two children who are in elementary and secondary school. She lives with her sister in a rented house. Santa is a homemaker who, in order to obtain money for the household expenses, works selling clothing from a catalog (shirts, jeans, blouses, etc.) She works five days a week, two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days. She has been doing this work for a long time and it is going very well for her, as her products are of very good quality. This loan is to buy shirts, jeans, blouses, and other items. It is her first cycle with the loan group and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have her own house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Karla Yesenia

texts.es:
Karla tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y vive en compañía de sus padres, obtuvo su título de secundaria como perito mercantil y contador público con un indice de 85%, seguidamente obtuvo su título universitario como licenciada en administración de empresas y actualmente esta por finalizar sus estudios de postgrado en el área de Dirección Empresarial.
La joven comenta que desde pequeña tuvo que enfrentar situaciones económicas muy difíciles junto a su familia, razones que la obligaron a buscar un empleo para poder realizar sus estudios universitarios, se siente orgullosa de haber perseverado y continuar con su preparación profesional, ya que el estudio una de las inversión de vida mas grande que se puede realizar.
Sus cualidades desde pequeña han sido la perseverancia, confianza en si misma y un total espíritu de superación.
La motivación para continuar con sus estudios, gira entorno al desarrollo profesional, la cual es su principal meta.
Su contribución para fortalecer el desarrollo del país, será aquella que alcance mediante sus sueños logrados y espera tener mejores beneficios familiares.
En sus planes a corto plazo, Karla desea materializar y poner en practica su idea de negocio, ya que será fruto de su sacrificio y sera la principar fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is 37 years old, she is single and lives with her two parents. She earned her secondary education diploma as a certified accountant with an index of 85%, she followed that by obtaining her university degree as a licensed business administrator and is currently about to finish her post graduate studies in the area of business management. 
The young woman comments that from a young age she had to face tough economic situations alongside her family, reasons that obligated her to find employment to be able to realize her university studies. She feels proud to have persevered and to continue her professional preparation, knowing that studying is one of the biggest investments you can make in life. Her qualities from a young age have been perseverance, confidence in herself and a complete spirit of development and improvement. 
Her motivation for continuing her studies is centered around professional development which is her main goal. Her contribution to strengthen the development of the country will be that which she is able to reach through her fulfilled dreams and she hopes to have better benefits for her family. Karla's short term goals include materializing and starting up her business idea since it is the fruit of her labor and sacrifice and it will be the main source of income for her family.

loans.use: finalize her postgraduate studies

loans.name: Thanh An 5 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh, 35, is a Thai ethnic lady who lives with her husband, along with her two children, in a Thai ethnic traditional house. Her son is 13, her daughter is 10 years old, and they both attend school fully. Her family relies on agricultural production with plenty of activities such as growing rice, raising buffalo, pigs, and chickens for a living. To have enough capital for expanding production, Mrs. Hanh has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the third time she has received a loan from the Program and she will use it to buy piglets and feed for the pigs. 

Despite various difficulties ahead, Mrs. Hanh is still very determined to invest in pig raising as she believes that the support of the agricultural workers of Anh Chi Em will be available to help her overcome problems. She hopes the investment will go smoothly and dreams of a more abundant life for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo vive con sus padres y un hermano, trabaja y a la vez estudia, y de esta forma tiene los medios para poder solventar sus estudios.
Él está poniendo su mejor empeño para poder salir adelante, estudia la carrera de informática,  y con su carrera quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Reinaldo lives with his parents and brother. He works and goes to school; in this way he has the means to pay for his studies. He is putting forth his best efforts to succeed. He is studying information technology, and wants to use this degree to get ahead. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university fees, so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en:
Tapuni is a 40-year-old single woman with three children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has nine years of experience with this business. 

Tapuni needs a loan to buy taro, bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a strainer, plastic bags, seasoning salt and a large pot. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tapuni has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy taro, bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a strainer, plastic bags, seasoning salt and a large pot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Matias

texts.es:
Matias vive con sus padres, trabaja en la colocación de artefactos eléctricos,  y con su trabajo ayuda a sus padres económicamente, él está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería eléctrica, y con sus estudios quiere ir creciendo y mejorando.
Él es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora. Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Matias lives with his parents, he works installing electronic devices and helps his parents economically through is work. He is pursuing a career in electronic engineering and through his studies he hopes to continue growing and improving. He is a driven person willing to make sacrifices. He requests this loan to pay for his career payments and to be able to continue his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: pay for university payments

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesús está en su sexto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 18 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir está en una pobreza extrema. Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus metas.
texts.en:
The "Baby Jesus" group is in its sixth cycle of the women's committee program where all promise to work and to help each other to get ahead. They are doing a poverty elimination survey whereby two of the 18 women are below the poverty line, i.e. in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Liliana who in her survey indicated she is at the level one poverty level or she is in extreme poverty. She has a store where she works every day from very early in the morning.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy stock for her store like meat, drinks, dairy products, bakery items, and other things so she can keep up with sales. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue with her goals.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, dairy products, bakery items, among other things.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es de la ciudad de Itá, estudia por las noches y trabaja por las tardes. De aquí a un año se ve convertida en una gran profesional.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud, es por ello que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, para poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Andrea is from the city of Ita. She studies at night and works in the afternoons. In a year from now she sees herself transformed into a great professional. 

She is studying a nursing degree, and wants to be able to help other people with something as important as their health. It's for this reason that she is putting forth her best effort. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her certification fees, in order to be able to pay this expense that she has.

loans.use: to pay certification fees for her degree

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña guapa  esta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elodia quien esta trabajando y luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Ella tiene una despensa, con la cual genera los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Ya tiene muy Buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos, y es con ello que esta pudiendo salir adelante.
La Sra. Elodia Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos, para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, bebidas, panificados y demás, de manera a poder tener todo tipo de productos variados para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group known as 'Kuña Guapa" is part of the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Elodia, who is working and fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She has a grocery store, from which she makes an income so she can help her family. She has very good customers who always buy her products, and with this she is able to succeed. 

Elodia is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, fruts, drinks, baked goods, and other items, to be able to stock her grocery and to have all kinds of varied products so she can fulfill her clients' orders.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, baked goods, and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una estudiante de la carrera de tecnología en producción, es madre, y quiere poder salir adelante por medio de su carrera, y es por eso que está poniendo todo de sí.
Ella aspira ser una profesional y poder trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is a student on a technological production course. She is a mother and she wants to be able to get ahead through her education and thus is giving it her all.

She hopes to be a professional and be able to work to help her family. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her bills and thus be able to continue her studies as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay for university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition for her specialization.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuñá Aty  viene trabajando hace 6 ciclos, son mujeres muy unidas, que a través de sus esfuerzos en conjunto quieren ir superando su situación de pobreza, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, implementado por la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, ella  es cliente de la Fundación y tiene un kiosko en su casa,  tiene varias operaciones canceladas con la institución. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que todos los días empieza desde muy temprano, que es cuando compra los productos variados para poder tener bien surtido siempre su trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con golosinas bebidas, comestibles y otros productos, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo y tener contento a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Kuñá Aty has been working for six cycles. They are very united women who, through their efforts together, desire to overcome their poor economic situation. They are part of a poverty elimination program implemented by the Fundacion Paraguaya.

One of the members is Maria. She is a customer of the Fundacion and has a kiosk in her house. She has various canceled operations with the institution. She is a very hard working person who starts every day very early which is when she buys varied products in order to be able to be well stocked always.

She is requesting this loan to be able to stock her business with candies, drinks, consumables and other products since with that she will be able to keep working and have happy customers. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy candies, drinks, consumables and other products.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement, additional hollow blocks and marine plywood for the house ceiling. 

She is on her way to completing her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, additional hollow blocks and marine plywood for the house ceiling

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
For a living, Wilfredo operates a motor transport business.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For him to continue his business, he availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. 

He dreams of owning motor units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is known in their neighborhood area as being a hard-working father. He is engaged in farming activities as his primary source of income to provide for his family. 

He became a member of PMPC, and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for a safe and comfortable living. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for a safe and comfortable living

loans.name: Isolina Paola

texts.es:
Isolina es una joven de 22 años de edad, soltera y vive en compañía de su padre y sus hermanos, se graduó de perito mercantil y contador publico en la secundaria, actualmente se encuentra por finalizar sus estudios universitarios en Psicología empresarial, con mucho sacrificio ya que asumió la responsabilidad de su hogar a muy temprana edad cuando su madre decidió dejar el país, buscando mejores condiciones de vida.
Es por eso que desea culminar sus estudios, y poder encontrar una mejor oportunidad de empleo para poder seguir estudiando su maestría en recursos humanos.
Es una joven inteligente, extrovertida, alegre, responsable, puntual y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones.
Su motivación principal es poder salir adelante y ser alguien productiva en la vida, con ello enorgullecerse a ella misma y a su familia para lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
Desea convertirse en un ejemplo para su familia, que sirva de motivación a muchos jóvenes que aún no se esmeran por ser profesionales y preparados en la vida.
Recuerda haber tenido que sacrificar su vida de adolescente para poder trabajar y costear sus propios estudios, debido a que sus padres no cuentan con los ingresos económicos para brindarle el apoyo educativo a ella y a sus hermanos, es por eso que a los 18 años tuvo que trabajar y así ha logrado salir adelante en base a su trabajo. Da gracias a Dios por estar al pie de su vida y motivandola a no rendirse.
Desea en un futuro, alcanzar sus estudios de doctorado, aprender 4 idiomas y sobre todo servir de ejemplo a su familia para que estos también se prepares academicamente.
texts.en:
Isolina is a young, 22 year old woman, she is single and lives with her parents and her brothers. She graduated from secondary school as a certified public accountant and is currently about to finish her university studies in business psychology through a lot of sacrifice having assumed the responsibility of her home from an early age when her mother decided to leave the country looking for better living conditions. This is why she wishes to finish her studies and be able to find a better employment opportunity allowing her to continue studying her master's in human resources.
She is an intelligent, extroverted, happy, responsible, punctual young woman able to make her own decisions. Her main motivation is to be able to progress in live and be a productive person which will make herself proud and achieve for her family a better quality of life.
She wishes to become an example for her family, to serve as motivation to many young people who are not yet keen on becoming professional and prepared in life. She remembers having to sacrifice her adolescent life to be able to work and pay for her own studies, due to the fact that her parents do not have the income to give economic support to her and her brothers for education. This is why at 18 she had to start working and has been able to succeed due to that job. She gives thanks to god for being close to her life and motivating her to not give up. She wishes to reach a doctorate degree in the future, learn 4 languages and above all serve as an example to her family so they also prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: finalize her university studies in psychology

loans.name: Thanh Yen 4 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is 42 years old and lives in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small village where agriculture is the main production generating income for the residents. She's married and has two grown-up sons: one studies at college, the other one is a worker. 

Like other households in the village, Mrs. Van and her husband work very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry, including growing rice, breeding buffalo, cows, pigs, chickens, ducks and musk ducks. 

She has recently taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy fertilizer for the rice field. She hopes to reap a good harvest so that she could gain good income and provide better for the family. 

Mrs. Van dreams a more abundant life for her children. In the picture, she wears a red shirt and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice field

loans.name: Elvie

texts.fr: Elvie a 43 ans. Elle est mariée et a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.  Elle vit avec  son mari et les enfants à la maison.  Comme activité, Elvie vend des vêtements usagés. Ce commerce marche très bien dans la zone. Elle voudrait trouver du financement pour augmenter son stock afin de profiter au maximum de cette opportunité. Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des jeans
texts.en: Elvie is 43 years old. She is married and has three children who are all enrolled in school.  She lives with her husband and children at home. As a business, Elvie sells used clothing. This business does very well in her area. She would like to find financing so as to grow her stock and get the most out of this opportunity. With this loan, she is going to buy used jeans.

loans.use: to buy some used blue jeans for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. 

Anita needs a loan to buy a new spade, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, new gloves, boots and crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Anita will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new spade, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, new gloves, boots and crops

loans.name: Faafeai

texts.en:
Faafeai is 75 years old and married with six children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

Faafeai needs a loan to buy two new wheelbarrow, sprayers, crops, machetes, chemicals, crowbars, new overalls and a chainsaw. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Faafeai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy two new wheelbarrows, sprayers, crops, machetes, chemicals, crowbars, new overalls and a chainsaw

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely, age 34, is single and lives with her parents in Oroquieta, Philippines. She has a farm on which she grows bananas. 

Emely joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her barbeque-selling business, aside from her farming activities, helping the family to survive. Fortunately, her barbeque station is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising sales every day. Emely keeps on running the business well, even though there is increased competition from another eatery. She believes that with the support of her family, they will keep going and beat the competition. 

Emely wishes to expand her resources and plans to make a space extension for her business. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy construction materials for her business space extension project. 

Emely wants nothing more than to make her parents happy and gain adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her business space extension project

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and married. The family lives in Oroquieta, Philippines.  

Jane has a retailing business; she sells cell phone load. She has had this business for five years. She finds it interesting because she can earn income easily. 

She requested a loan to pay for an additional amount of load for retail. 

Expanding her inventory will mean an increase to her income.  Jane wants to take advantage, as she is the only load retailer in their rural neighborhood. 

Jane has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for an additional amount of load for retail

loans.name: Loma Clavel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Loma Clavel  está en su ciclo número 1 es un grupo nuevo formado en la ciudad de villa Ygatimí,  la cual es una zona muy alejada de la capital, rural y en crecimiento.
La Sra. Victoria es una de las integrantes, ella cría animales de corral, muchas veces los vende, o ella misma los faena, y con este humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, algún día quiere tener una granja donde pueda tener muchos animales y seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, como también compra de animales para la cría.
texts.en: The group called "Loma Clavel" is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group formed in the city of Villa Ygatimi, an area which is far away from the capital, rural and growing. Victoria is one of its members. She raises corral animals. She often sells them or slaughters them, and with this modest job she has the means to be able to help her loved ones. Some day, she wants to have a farm where she can have many animals and keep on growing and helping her family. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed for her animals, as well as to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and animals to raise.

loans.name: Democrito

texts.en:
Democrito is a farmer and engaged in "palay" trading and a ice retailing business. He is now supervising the renovation of their home. 

Democrito hopes to live comfortably with a concrete house with good roofing, supported by his loan of Php 50,000. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record.  This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs on his retailing business and housing project were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is married; she is from Dipolog, Philippines. Carolina has a snack vending business and has earned approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of activity for two years, while her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops for their family. This is how she helped her husband in sustaining their needs. 

Carolina wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. 

Carolina has recently became an active member of PMPC. Now she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora tiene 44 años de edad vive en unión libre, se desempeña como secretaria en una empresa. Ella fue diagnosticada con miopía magna desde los 14 años.
Actualmente el uso de la computadora en su jornada laboral, le ocasiona intensos dolores de cabeza junto con irritación  y resequedad en sus ojos. En estos momentos una cirugía para corregir su problema ocular, que le permitiera trabajar mas eficientemente le resulta muy  costosa para sus posibilidades económicas.
texts.en:
This woman is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship. She works at a company as a secretary. At the age of 14, she was diagnosed with severe myopia.

The borrower currently uses a computer at her job. She occasionally suffers from severe headaches, as well as irritation and dryness of the eyes. Surgery would be able to correct her vision problem and allow her to work more efficiently. However, the procedure is very costly and would have a severe impact on her finances.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 52 года, замужем, есть сын. Образование у Гулнары среднее. Она очень ответственная, аккуратная и трудолюбивая. Работает санитаром в лабораторном отделении поликлиники. В поиске дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Гулнара в 1995 году начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеется 2 лошади. На 1,60 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет Гулнаре разводить скот и заготавливать для него корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulnara is 52 years old. She is married and has a son. Gulnara has a secondary education. She is very responsible, neat and hard-working. She works as an orderly in the laboratory department of a clinic. In search of additional income for her family, in 1995 Gulnara began engaging in agriculture. Today her farmstead has two horses. She grows beans for sale on her 1.60 hectares of land. The profit from the business allows Gulnara to raise livestock and prepare feed for them for the winter. In order to further develop her farmstead, she has turned to the Bai Tushum Bank for a loan in the sum of 60,000 Som (KGS) to purchase one heifer to increase her head of livestock. Gulnara plans to invest the income from the loan in the expansion of her farmstead.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
From Dipolog, Zamboanga del Sur, Eliza is 31 years old, married to a farmer and has four school-aged children. From her desire to help her husband support their family, she has been running a grocery store for five years, earning a good income each month. 

In 2014, Eliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She repaid her previous loan that was used for personal purposes and is now requesting another loan of 14,000 PHP to expand her business through the purchase of more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother of five who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is 30 years old and divorced with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for six years. 

Sieni needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, frozen goods, new canned items, shoes, drinks, snacks and cigarettes. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, frozen goods, new canned items, shoes, drinks, snacks and cigarettes

loans.name: Brittany

texts.en:
Brittany is a Samoan citizen; she is 24 years old and single. She operates a business of selling elei printing at the stores and the market. Brittany has been doing this for more than a year, and also gain good income from her business. 

She hopes to expand her business to overseas, but in order to do this, Brittany needs a loan to buy rolling materials, a printing machine, paint color, paint brush, container, to help her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, a printing machine, paint color, paint brush, container,

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en:
Tuli is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a florist business, and also a large plantation to earn a living to support her family. Tuli has been doing this for more than 15 years. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, insect poison, machetes, overalls, pots, seeds, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw and a mini-tractor. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. She plans to use her profits to secure the future of her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, insect poison, machetes, overalls, pots, seeds, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw and a mini-tractor

loans.name: Tusipepa

texts.en:
Tusipepa is 58 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. 

Tusipepa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, spayers, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a pitch fork, a spade, gloves, a machete and a new shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Tusipepa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, spayers, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a pitch fork, a spade, gloves, a machete and a new shovel

loans.name: Anasitasia

texts.en: A loan for $2,000ST will help Anasitasia buy a freezer, chicken, sausage, ice, rice, flour, sugar, salt, onion, and plastic bags to use in her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her children's education. She is 46 years old and the mother of five.

loans.use: to buy various items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo mujeres emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas han podido mejorar poco a poco.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nimia quien tiene una despensa con todo tipo de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y hoy ya tiene muchos clientes y ha mejorado mucho sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Emprendedoras” is in its 7th loan cycle of the Women’s Committee program where all of them work and help each other get ahead.  They are participating in the eliminate poverty survey where little by little, they all have improved.  One of the members is Nimia who has a store with all kinds of products to offer to her customers. She is a hard working woman who little by little has found ways and now has a lot of customers and much better living conditions.

She requests this loan to purchase vegetables, fruits, beverages, dairy products and others to be able to continue selling. She appreciates the opportunity she receives to continue to improve the living conditions to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, beverages, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  se  encuentra en el 1er ciclo., es un grupo nuevo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza.
Rufina vende comidas variadas, ella es muy buena en su trabajo, y es por ello que tiene ya muchos clientes. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que quiere salir adelante, empieza a trabajar todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso y otros, y con ello poder deleitar a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) is a new group in it's first cycle. They are starting with many expectations of what they want to invest in to be able to earn more income for the house and be able to escape poverty.

Rufina sells varied meals, she is very good at her job which is why she already has a lot of customers. She is a very hard working woman, that wants to continue moving forward. She starts working every day in the very early hours of the morning.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients to be able to make meals, such as vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and others; with these she will be able to please her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other ingredients to make meals

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is 60 years old and married with eight children. She owns and operates a small store where she sells a variety of items. She has been doing this for the last seven years, and has requested a loan to buy onions, potatoes, snacks, drinks, candy, shoes and canned items to sell. Aiga hopes to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with five children and the family lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, and she has always been known to provide the best for them. 

Lorna is earning a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. 

Consequently, she has requested a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional raw ingredients to increase production. 

Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her husband, Lorna smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and to be able to provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, age 38, is from Burgos, Aloran, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Tessie joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store. Helping the family survive, she never get tired tending her little store. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Tessie keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with the support of her family, they will sustain and beat the competition. 

Tessie is now trying to expand her resources; she decided to engage in chicken and pork barbeque vending for added income. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project, and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy merchandise for her store and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat to start her barbeque business to continue putting bread and butter on the table in their home. 

With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat to start her barbeque business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for four years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. 

Rosana is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Rosana is from Oroquieta; she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skills in business engagements. Rosana has successfully repaid a previous loans from PMPC. 

Now, she is requesting her fourth loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to sell.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store to sell

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is preparing for the post-harvest operations on her land in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another growing season. She has requested a loan from the Paglaum MPC to complete these preparations. Rosalita hopes to see all her children finish their schooling and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Wardy

texts.en: Wardy has always been an enthusiastic farmer who has grown rice on his land in Molave. He consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from his work, but would like to be even more productive. That is why he has applied for a loan to prepare his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting. Wardy knows that he has to get things right to earn a higher income in the upcoming season. In the future, he hopes to buy a truck to haul his produce to market.

loans.use: to prepare the land and seedbed for planting.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire has always had enthusiasm for farming. She and her husband are both farmers, cultivating rice in Bonifacio. Farming has provided them with good earnings. Recently, Claire applied a loan to pay for land and seed bed preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Claire knows that she has to properly prepare her land to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Claire hopes to buy a parcel of riceland to cultivate to continuously benefit her family and secure a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparation.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie, 43 years old, lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Elsie and her husband earn a living through farming. In need of additional working capital, Elsie decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested a PHP 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating her land. Elsie has been able to manage her income and provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating her land

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a businesswoman who is married and lives in the town of Dapitan. She is a member of PMPC and runs a retail store where she sells thatched nipa, which is used to build the walls of homes. Running this business allows her to meet her family's needs, and she has applied for a loan to buy more nipa so she has more items to sell. Cristita believes that having additional inventory will allow her to meet her customers' needs, and is grateful to have signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her construction business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Teresita came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to pay for land and seedbed preparation and buying of farm inputs.  

Teresita perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land, seedbed preparation and buying of farm inputs

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El cantón es gran productor y exportador de plátano y cacao; sus habitantes además se dedican a la ganadería. El clima es cálido húmedo y está ubicada la ciudad a 1 hora y media de la playa de Pedernales.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 43  años de edad y  está divorciada,  tiene tres hijos, dos son mayores de edad e independientes y la menor estudia en el colegio. Viven en casa arrendada.
Doña Sonia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para los gastos del hogar se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos (pescado, conchas, camarones, calamares, etc.), también trabaja en una confitería en el mercador central del Carmen, trabaja desde las 9h00 hasta las 17h00 cuatro días a la semana, y una vez a la semana va a comprar los mariscos para distribuirlos, sale desde las 5h00 a comprar  y regresa a las 16h00 a vender, ella cobra en efectivo. Tiene algún tiempo a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, concha camarones, calamares y otros frutos del mar. Está en el grupo de crédito hace dos años, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque son unidas y porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es tener una Quinta y un carro para el negocio.
texts.en:
The canton is a big producer and exporter of bananas and cocoa. Its residents are also dedicated to livestock. The climate is hot and humid, and the city is located an hour and a half from the Pedernales beach.

In this place, lives Mrs. Sonia. She is 43 years old and is divorced. She has three children; two are older and are independent, and the youngest studies in high school. They live in a rented house.

Sonia is a housewife who earns her own income for the household expenses. She is dedicated to buying and selling seafood (fish, shells, shrimp, squids, etc.). She also works in a candy store in the central market of Carmen. She works from 9 in the morning until 5 in the evening four days per week. Once a week, she goes to buy the seafood to distribute it. She goes from 5 in the morning to buy, and she returns at 4 in the afternoon to sell. She collects payments in cash. She has been doing this activity for some time, and it has been going well.

This loan is to buy fish, shells, shrimp, squids, and other seafood. She has been in the loan group for two years. She is the treasurer of the group, and she likes it because they are united and because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a Quinta and a car for the business.

loans.use: to buy fish, shells, shrimp, squid, and other seafood.

loans.name: Isayana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Muy ordenada y surtida, se ve la pulpería de Isayana, una mujer de cuarenta y cinco años de edad, con un carácter decidido que inicia su jornada muy temprano cada día. Ella empezó hace siete años, vendiendo carne. Con un primer préstamo que se le otorgó, puso una agencia de gas, además invirtió en productos como jabón, detergente, aceite, azúcar, entre otros, es así como formado su pulpería. Con ayuda de su esposo y su hijo y el gran apoyo de Kiva junto MiCrédito su negocio ha superado todas sus metas propuestas, por lo que lea agradece a todos ellos. 
En estos momentos Isayana, desea crecer más, es por eso que ha solicitado a Kiva y MiCrédito, un préstamo que le permita comprar más carne y sacos de granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y maíz. En un futuro ella se visualiza teniendo una distribuidora. Mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus seres queridos es lo que la impulsa día a día para trabajar por su negocio.
texts.en:
Very organized and well-stocked is how one sees Isayana's general store. She is a woman of 45 years and decisive character, who begins work very early each day. She began seven years ago, selling meat. With the first loan she was given, she set up a gas agency, and she invested in products like soap, detergent, oil, sugar, and other items, and so formed her general store. 

With the help of her spouse, her son, and the great support of Kiva together with [partner] MiCrédito, her business has exceeded all the goals she set, for which she thanks all of them. At this time Isayana wants to expand more, and this is why she has requested a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito which will allow her to buy more meat and staple items such as rice, beans, sugar, and corn. In the future, Isayana sees herself having a bulk goods store in the future. Improving her quality of life and that of her loved ones is what spurs her on day by day to work for her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat, rice, beans, sugar, and corn

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora es un grupo nuevo, formado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras que quieren poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Melissa es la Presidenta del grupo ella se desempeña como vendedora de Ropas y se describe como una mujer luchadora que quiere poder salir adelante y  necesita el préstamo para poder tener más variedad de ropa, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones, remeras y otros, y  así poder sustentarse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Pora is a new group, formed in the city of Villa Elisa. It is made up of 20 women, all of whom are friends and who live in this city. They are very selfless, tenacious women who want to be able to help their families.

Melissa is the president of the group. She works selling clothing, and describes herself as a determined woman, who wants to be able to succeed and who needs the loan to be able to supply a larger variety of clothing, such as jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts and other items, so she can sustain herself and fulfill her clients' orders.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shorts, pants, t-shirts and other items to sell

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Dios con Nosotras  está en su ciclo número 2º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo nuevo donde todas las integrantes están poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar cada día.
Lucia, es una de las integrantes, ella es vendedora de ropa, tiene ya una clientela formada que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos y con ello está mejorando para poder salir adelante. Es una persona muy buena vendedora, y poco a poco está mejorando cada día. 
Lucia quiere crecer cada día, es por ello que pone su mejor esfuerzo cada día, para poder salir adelante, capacitarse. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser: jeans, camisas, pantalones, remeras y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando cada día e ir mejorando. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de acceder a esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The group called "Dios con Nosotras" is in their 2nd loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program where they all work and try to help each other to get ahead. This is a new group that is trying their best to improve day by day.

Lucia is one of the members. She sells clothing and has a set clientele that always has a lot of requests and with this she is able to improve and move ahead. She is a very good vendor and is improving little by little each day. Lucia wants to grow each day so she is applying her best effort each day to get ahead and learn.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing like jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts and others and in this way she can continue to struggle each day to improve. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, pants, shirts and others.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia vive en pareja hace 35 años con el Sr. Antolín, ella tiene 1 sola hija que es mayor casada y cuenta con 3 nietos varones, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Dionisia se dedicó siempre al comercio, al principio tenía un criadero de pollitos que luego salía a vender casa por casa, todo eso por un periodo de 15 años, luego fabricó  cuadros de madera con paisajes, imágenes religiosas, imágenes de famosos, y clubes, estos   son vendidos en forma ambulante.
Dionisia pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer cuadros para la venta, como maderas, pinceles, y pinturas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionisia has lived with her partner Sr. Antolín for 35 years. She has an adult daughter who is married and three grandchildren. Dionisia is a hardworking and enterprising woman.

She has always been involved in commerce. At first she raised chickens and then sold them by going from house to house. She did that for 15 years. Then she began making wooden pictures with scenes of the countryside, religious images, images of famous people or of clubs. She sells these in the streets.

Now Dionisia is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as wood, paintbrushes, and paints to make the pictures. Then she will be able to continue with her work and sales.

loans.use: buy supplies such as wood, paintbrushes, and paints

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 22 años y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, comprensiva, paciente, solidaria, fuerte, optimista, feliz, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por su producción y manufactura donde micro empresarios de áreas como; la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan productos extranjeros para comercializarlos en los principales mercados locales, es la zona más poblada de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Elsa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro, viste blusa blanca y pantalón amarillo). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con su hijo que trabaja y estudia, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pollos a la broaster (pollo condimentado frito en aceite). Actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto habilitado como cocina, dónde sus clientes se acomodan en la calle sentados en sillas al aire libre a disfrutar de su comida. “Inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de alimentar a mi familia, actualmente cuento con una ayudante que se encarga de pelar las papas, realizar las compras y otras actividades...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la proximidad a oficinas y comercios donde trabajan sus clientes constantes. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante amplio para vender comida a más clientes, ella desea techar las afueras de su casa para utilizarlo como restaurante y vender comida a más clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elsa solicita un préstamo para techar las afueras de su casa para abrir un restaurante y vender pollo a la broaster a más clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 41 year old woman who lives with her husband and has a 22 year old son.  She sells broasted chicken.

She is a good, sincere, understanding, patient, solidary, strong, optimistic, happy, generous, friendly, responsible, and hardworking mother.  She has her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ zone, a place known for its production and manufacture, where small entrepreneurs of sewing, design and arts copy foreign products and sell them in the main local markets.  It’s the most populated part of the city, with a warm tropical climate and an average temperature of 18-35 degrees centigrade.

Elsa has olive skin, long black hair that she ties back, brown eyes, is of short stature, and has a medium complexion.  Guaraní is her native language and she speaks Spanish culturally and in her business. (She is in the center of the image, wearing a white blouse and yellow pants.)

She shares her life with her husband who works and with her son who also works and attends school. They live in a single room made of brick and cement and a metal room.  They have running water, electricity, and sewage.

She sells broasted chicken (seasoned chicken fried in oil), from Monday through Sunday from a room set up as a kitchen, and her customers sit outside and enjoy the food.  “I started my business out of necessity for feeding my family, now I have a helper who peals the potatoes, makes purchases, and other things…” she says.

Elsa is asking for this loan so she can cover the outside of her home, so that she can open a restaurant and sell broasted chicken to more customers.

loans.use: to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuot
texts.en: Andrea continues working at her business selling vegetables. She is a hardworking woman who, by means of this business, wants to succeed and give her family the best she can. She is requesting the loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash. She is glad of the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash

loans.name: Harland Emmanuel

texts.es:
Harland es un hombre entregado a su trabajo como técnico en refrigeración. El inicio en este negocio de reparación de refrigeradoras, mantenedoras y aires acondicionados hace diecinueve años con la idea de ser independiente y estar más cerca en el crecimiento de sus tres hijos. Con el apoyo de su esposa ha ido poco a poco mejorando su calidad y ha adquirido artefactos que le optimizan el trabajo. 
Este esforzado hombre ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito, solicitando un préstamo que le permita comprar repuestos para las maquinas que utiliza día a día en su trabajo. También planea adquirir diferentes tipos de marcas de líquidos para refrigeración y así ofrecer a sus clientes distintas opciones. Su principal objetivo es hacer un trabajo ágil y bien hecho.  En el futuro desea que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad, tener su propio techo digno y sobre todo que estén orgullosos de su padre.
texts.en:
Harland is a man devoted to his work as a technician in refrigeration. He began his business repairing refrigerators and air conditioners some 19 years ago with the idea of becoming independent and being closer to his three growing children. With the help of his wife, he has been, little by little, improving the quality of his work and he has acquired equipment that helps optimize his work.

This energetic man is approaching Kiva and MiCredito, soliciting a loan that will permit him to buy replacements for the equipment he utilizes day by day in his work. Also, Harlan plans to acquire different types and brands of liquids for refrigeration and, thus, offer his customers distinct options. Harlan's principal objective is to make his work easier and well done. 

In the future Harlan wishes his children to attend the university, to have a dignified roof of their own, and, above all, he wants them to be proud of their father.

loans.use: purchase refrigeration and air conditioner liquids for performing his maintenance services.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2009. He appreciates the programs, services and continuing .leducation provided by the  cooperative. He is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that Paglaum offers. His primary source of income is through rice farming. He cultivates rice land in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. Recently, he requested a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs for land and seed bed preparation. Eduardo dreams of having a happy, healthy life and an adequate income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs for land and seed bed preparation

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El señor Lino tiene 58 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace más de 20 años, por lo que es muy reconocida en la zona. 
Es una persona que está luchando cada día para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lácteos, azúcar, panificados, embutidos y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Lino is 58, single, and lives in the city of Villarrica. He has owned a well-stocked local shop for over 20 years, which is why he is very well-known in the area. He is a person who works hard every day to improve his and his family's living conditions.

Lino is asking for this loan to be able to buy dairy produce, sugar, pastries, cold meat and other items, with which he can carry on his work and be able to offer his customers a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to buy dairy produce, sugar, pastries, cold meat and other items.

loans.name: Amu

texts.en:
Amu is a 42-year-old, divorced woman with five children. To earn a living, she runs a small bakery in her community. She has seven years of experience with this business. 

Amu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Amu has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Faustina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Faustina continues with her work selling food. She is an enterprising woman who through this business wants to have her children finish their schooling. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her loan installments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia Yovana se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia lleva los productos de belleza a diferentes lugares y amigos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yovana works in the business of selling beauty products.  She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.  This borrower is a hardworking woman who through this job is able to help her children get ahead.  She carries the beauty products to different places and friends.  This borrower is requesting a loan to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.  She is happy about this loan and she promises to make the monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, el socio es una persona emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere abrir una tienda de abarrotes y tener un negocio más grande. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan continues to sell vegetables and is a very enterprising person.  He wants to open a grocery store and have a larger business.  He is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar y tambien la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Pamela continues to run her restaurant.  She is a very enterprising woman who wants to make sure her children finish school and also get her family ahead.  Her dream is to have a large restaurant.  She is asking for this loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia Nilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nilda continues selling clothing.  She is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her clothing sales business.  She is asking for this loan to buy coats, blouses, and pants.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Alberto pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
El socio sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta pollos, el socio Alberto agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica, el socio continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable ,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
texts.en:
Alberto is a member of the community bank Manos Juntas.

He continues to work selling chickens. He is grateful to Kiva for giving him the opportunity to carry on with his work and develop his business. He continues to raise small animals and then sell them to customers who are asking for them. Alberto is a responsible person and is helping his family get ahead.

He is seeking a loan to buy chickens etc.

loans.use: buy chickens etc.

loans.name: Nilda Araceli

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
La socia Nilda sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
texts.en: Nilda belongs to the "MANOS JUNTAS" communal bank. She continues to raise and sell small animals. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the loan. She is s responsible and diligent person. She continues to raise her animals to later sell them to clients who request them, this being the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the MANOS JUNTAS communal bank, located in the province of Cusco.

She continues to raise and sell small animals and is very grateful for the loan.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She continues to raise and sell her animals to customers who request them.  She is a responsible person who gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy Guinea pigs and feed.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 54 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still attending senior high school.

He wishes to secure a microloan in order to expand his oil palm field. The additional income from selling more Fair Trade & organic palm fruits will be used to improve his family’s standard of living and pay for his children’s education. 

Edward believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his oil palm field

loans.name: Mark K.

texts.en:
Mark is an organic oil palm farmer and a teacher who lives in Bomso, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 45 years old and married with three children, all of them currently in primary school. Mark's farm is organic and Fair Trade certified, which he believes is good for his community and the environment.

He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. The additional income from selling Fair Trade & organic palm fruits will allow him to continue funding his children’s education and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: expand his oil palm field

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Abaam, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 71 years old and married with 10 children. One of his children is still in senior high school and the others have completed school.

Emmanuel believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his Fair Trade palm farm. The additional income will allow him to make needed improvements on his home and continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to epxand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Christian Obeng

texts.en:
Christian is an Internal Control Systems Manager at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 37 years old, the single parent of one child. Christian believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation.

He wishes to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. The extra income created from harvesting and selling organic palm fruits will help him improve his and his son’s standard of living. At the same time, the additional pressing of fair trade & organic palm oil at Serendipalm will create more opportunities for community infrastructural projects through Serendipalm’s Fair Trade Fund.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Celeste Santiaga

texts.es:
Celeste es una joven de veintitrés años de edad que tiene pasión por el derecho, ella decidió estudiar leyes, porque siempre ha deseado defender a las personas que se lo merecen. Sus padres los cuales han sido su principal apoyo, le han enseñado que la justicia es un valor invaluable que tenemos los seres humanos. 
Ella se encuentra a un paso de egresar de la carrera, es por eso que ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para poder pagar los gastos de su título, con este lograra encontrar un buen trabajo que le permitira mejorar su calidad de vida. En futuro desea ser asesora legal de alguna firma de abogados importante además de sacar su especialidad en derecho penal.
texts.en:
Celeste is a young woman of 23. She has a passion for law so decided to study to become a lawyer because she has always stood up for people who deserved her support. Her parents have been her main support, and it was they who taught her that justice is an important part of being a human being.

Celeste is now about to graduate so she has approached Kiva and MiCrédito to ask for a loan so she can pay for her professional qualifications. Then she will be able to get a good job and improve her standard of living. In the future she wishes to be a legal consultant in an important law firm and also specialise in criminal law.

loans.use: pay for her professional law qualification

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins has a certified organic and fair trade oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 79 years old and married with twelve children. Some of his children have completed senior high school, while others are still attending high school or primary school. 

He wishes to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. With the additional income from selling Fair Trade & organic palm fruits to Serendipalm he hopes to continue funding his children’s education while supporting community infrastructure projects through Serendipalm’s Fair Trade Fund.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Joe

He wants to secure a loan to expand his Fair Trade & organic oil palm field, creating more development in his community and allowing him to make necessary improvements to his family’s home.

Joe believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

With the money he makes from organic oil palm farming Stephen hopes to finish funding his children’s education and make necessary improvements to his home.

Doris is interested in organic palm oil farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic palm oil field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic palm oil field
