loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
La socia Elizabeth continua dedicándose al turismo, la socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad comercial, la socia continua vendiendo paquetes turísticos a los turistas que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos, entradas  entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the MANOS JUNTAS communal bank.

Elizabeth continues to work in tourism and is grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business.  She continues to sell tourist packages to tourists who request them.  She has been doing this for some time and it’s going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day.  She gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy tickets, passes, and other things.

loans.use: to buy tickets and passes.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA CATALINA DE SILLACANCHA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Evangelina tiene 39 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como pollos y cuyes , la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día ,la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a member of the communal bank Santa Catalina de Sillacancha, which is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca, within the departament of Cusco.

Evangelina is 39 and is married. She alternates her daily tasks, looking after small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She is a responsible person who has run her business for quite a while. It it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She would like to continue working in this way so that she can carry on supporting her family.

Evangelina is asking for a loan to buy chickens. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business, selling lumber in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more lumber to sell through her lumber business.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from fish-vending.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rosa Matil

texts.es: A sus 63 años de edad Rosa es una señora trabajadora, Rosa tiene 12 hijos en total pero no todos viven con ella, Rosa vive en una casita muy humilde juntamente con su esposo, 3 hijos y 4 nietos, los niños estan estudiando, Rosa vive en el campo y alli se dedica a la ganaderia y al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Rosa necesita el dinero del credito en la compra de terneros, Rosa tiene la aspiracion de seguir  cuidando a sus nietos para que sigan asistiendo a la escuela.
texts.en:
At age 63, Rosa is a hardworking lady.  She has 12 children, but not all live with her.  Rosa lives in a small, humble home with her husband, three of her children, and four grandchildren.  The children attend school.

Rosa lives in the country, raises livestock, and works in farming.  She needs this loan to buy land.  Rosa wants to continue caring for her grandchildren so that they can continue to attend school.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 49 years old and married with four children, two of which are in senior high school and the other two in primary school.

Charles believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. Selling more organic palm fruit to the Serendipalm mill will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and purchase materials to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a field officer with Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and lives in Kade, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 55 years old and married with five children. Two of his children are in Senior High School while his three other children are receiving primary school education.

Charles believes organic oil palm farming helps develop his community through job creation while maintaining the health and fertility of the soil on which they depend. He wishes to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field – the extra income from selling organic oil palm fruits will contribute to his children’s educational fund and allow him to his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria  esta pasando por sus 36 ños de edad, Maria esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, los 2 niños son de 13 y 10 años y la niña tiene 9 años de edad, Maria se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores,ella tiene un problema en la vista ya que uno de sus ojos no le funciona bien, Maria necesita el dinero del credito para hacer la compra de chachos, Maria tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y sobre todo que que sigan en los estudios.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  Her two boys are 13 and 10 and her daughter is 9.  Maria raises small animals.  She has a problem with her vision now that her eyes are not as good as they used to be.  She needs the money from this loan to buy pigs.  She wants to continue to work and improve her business so she can improve her children’s quality of life.  Above all she wants them to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Liba Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia esta pasando por sus 55 años de edad, ella esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de 26 y 30 años de edad, Eulalia vive con su esposo que se dedica a trabajr al jornal y con sus 2 hijos que ya son independientes en sus gastos porque ya trabajan, Eulalia se dedica a la venta de comidas rapidas, Eulalia necesita el credito para comprar papas y mas implementos para preparar lo que mas vende que son la salchipapas. Lo que Eulaia aspira de su negocio es mejorar sus ventas mediante sus ingresos apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Eulalia is 55 years old. She is married and has two children, who are 26 and 30 years old. Eulalia lives with her husband, who works as a daily laborer, and with her two children, who are already independent with their expenses because they are already working. Eulalia works selling fast food. She needs the loan to buy potatoes and more implements to prepare what she sells the most, which are "salchipapas" (french fries with sausages). Eulalia's biggest dream with her business is to improve her sales, and through her income to support with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy products for food preparation.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 60 years old and married with six children. Her children are all receiving an education, and range from primary school to senior high school.

Comfort believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment. She wants to secure a microloan to expand her organic oil palm field. This will allow her to earn extra income that will support her children’s education and allow her family to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lidia es una señoa casada, tiene 22 años de edad, su esposo se dedica al jornal, Lidia tiene un hijo de 2 años y esta esperando el nacimiento de su bebe, Lidia necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos ya que son  3 años que se dedica  a esta actividad,  Lidia esta esperando con mucho amor la llegada de su nuevo hijo y esta guardando algun capital para que sus hijos no tengan que pasar por muchas necesidades.
texts.en: Lidia is 22 years old, married, and her husband is a laborer.  Lidia has a 2 year old son and is expecting another baby.  Lidia needs this loan to buy chickens since she has been doing this for three years.  Lidia is lovingly awaiting the arrival of her new child and is saving some money so that her children will not miss out on their needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

texts.en:
Patrick grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 51 years old and married with three children. All of his children are still in school.
 
Patrick wants to secure a loan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. With the additional income he plans to fund his children’s education and make necessary home improvements.

Patrick believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Ntronang near Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 51 years old and married with eight children. Three of his children are in high school, while the others are in primary and middle school. 

Francis believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment. For this reason, he wants to secure a microloan to expand his organic oil palm field. The additional income from selling organic & Fair Trade palm fruits will allow him to make needed improvements on his home and to continue funding his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Estela has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Estela has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. Gertrudes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, spices, for her food production business.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is 35 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Miraflor has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Miraflor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Reishel

texts.en:
Reishel is single and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Reishel has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old, married and has four children, all in school.

Rosa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosa has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат, 36 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулзат на сегодняшний день имеет 10 коров, 35 овец. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulzat is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. She rears livestock in order to get additional income for her family, having started in 2000. Thanks to hard work, Gulzat currently has 10 cows and 35 sheep. In the interests of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 20 sheep for fattening and resale. Gulzat plans to invest the income from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio tiene 49 años de edad, y vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Junto con su esposa, trabaja día a día en la producción de café, actividad en la que ha logrado buenos rendimientos en los últimos años, y con ello mejores ingresos para su familia.

Cada año, este pequeño emprendedor se esfuerza por darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café, ya que esta es la principal actividad económica de la familia, por ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita asegurar la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que requiere su plantación y poder tener una buena cosecha. 

Su meta es continuar incrementando la productividad de la finca, en particular del café. Su sueño, es incrementar el área de producción, porque confía que este rubro si se maneja adecuadamente es bastante rentable y ello le permitirá dar mejores condiciones económicas a su familia.
texts.en: Julio is 49 years old and he lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. Together with his wife, he works day after day in coffee  production, work that has brought him good results in recent years, and with it, better income for his family.  Each year, this small entrepreneur works hard to properly maintain his coffee plants, since that is the primary source of income for his family.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to ensure the purchase of fertilizers and compost that his coffee plants need to be able to have a good harvest.  His goal is to continue to increase the productivity of his farm, especially his coffee.  His dream is to increase the area of production because he is confident that this business, if properly managed, is very profitable and it will allow him to give better economic conditions to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost to apply to his coffee farm, and ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is a 40-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. 

Iemaima  has requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice to help her run the business. 

Iemaima hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock, in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Rosalie has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. 

Rosalinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: A loan amount of 1,500 WST will help Temukisa buy a fishing canoe, ice bag, fishing net, fishing gear, container, and torch to assist her with the business. She has more than a year of experience in the fishing business. Temukisa is 32 years old and has eight children. She became a member of SPBD in 2008. Temukisa hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profit.

loans.use: to buy a fishing canoe, ice bag, fishing net, fishing gear, container, and torch.

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en:
Fuatai is a 25-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Fuatai needs a loan to buy tongs, plastic basins, a new barbecue grill, frozen meat, soya sauce, and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits to support her family.

Fuatai has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy tongs, plastic basins, a new barbecue grill, frozen meat, soya sauce, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 45-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling barbecue in her community to earn a living.

Salome has requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run the business.

Salome hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en:
Nofo is a 50-year-old widow with four children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Nofo needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, and a new boiler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Nofo has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, and a new boiler.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: A loan amount of 1,500 WST will help Elsie buy new seat covers, new wheels, new windows, air conditioning and to pay for license renewal to maintain her taxi business. Elsie is a 35-year-old mother of seven children. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Elsie will use her business profits to buy another taxi to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers, new wheels, new windows, air conditioning and pay for license renewal.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After 6 months of raising pigs, Ni Luh is now selling her piglets and making a profit. She sells piglets in her village, and her earnings have been deducted from her loans from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK). 

Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Ni Luh has been able to develop her pig raising business and contribute to the family income. These results are certainly very useful for families and can help with their children's school fees. Although piglets and pig feed are currently expensive, Ni Luh still maintains her passion for business development with the group she leads.

Ni Luh and the Sumber Rahayu Group decided to take another loan, and each will receive 2,000,000 IDR. Ni Luh plans to use her loan portion to renovate her pens and use her own money to buy pig feed over the next 6 months. 

Ni Luh now has 6 sows. She hopes to earn more profit than with the previous loan, which she will use as business capital.

loans.use: to renovate the cages for her pigs.

loans.name: Tinousi

texts.en:
Tinousi is 23 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tinousi needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, crops, a crowbar, a machete and a shovel. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

Tinousi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, crops, a crowbar, a machete and a shovel

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña del Estado de México se conformó un grupo de préstamo con el nombre de “Artesanas” ya que tres de ellas se dedican a elaborar joyería en filigrana de plata. La comunidad, además, es de origen mazahua y la mayoría de las personas también son artesanos, aunque afortunadamente las integrantes del grupo han podido dar a conocer sus piezas en otros estados del país. 
Alma Rosy tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con el señor Gabino y son padres de dos niñas que aún no asisten a la escuela. Alma es una mujer alegre y amable, el contacto con las personas y su participación en ferias de otras ciudades le han ayudado a ser aún más desenvuelta. Desde pequeña, ella ha estado inmersa en el mundo de la artesanía de plata, gracias a su madre fue que aprendió a elaborar aretes, collares, anillos, llaveros, gargantillas y muchas otras piezas. 
Actualmente, el esposo de Alma también se dedica a la misma actividad y sus piezas se exponen en distintas galerías. Para ellos, no sólo es una manera de tener un ingreso sino la oportunidad de difundir su cultura en otros lugares, creando piezas donde plasman figuras y dibujos de tradición mazahua.
El trabajo de la familia es muy reconocido y cuenta con el apoyo de fomentos de instituciones privadas y los servicios de comercialización de VisionFund México para asistir a galerías, exposiciones y ferias. Sin Embargo, su reto sigue siendo la falta de capital para comprar herramientas y placas de plata en grandes cantidades que es en lo que invertirá su nuevo préstamo. 
Los sueños de Alma, además de seguir incrementando sus ventas, son abrir otro taller, enseñar a más personas la actividad que le llena de orgullo y abrir su propia galería para mostrar sus diseños exclusivos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el taller de la familia, Alma es quien viste una capa, muy tradicional en la región mazahua*
texts.en:
In a very small community in the State of Mexico, a loan group was formed with the name "Artesanas". Three of the members make silver filigree jewelry. The community is of Mazahua origin and the majority of people are also artisans, although luckily the members of the group have managed to make their work known in other states in the country.

Alma Rosy, 30, is married to Gabino. They are the parents of two daughters, who are still not in school. Alma is a happy, friendly mother. Contact with people and her participation in fairs in other cities have helped her to develop even more. From a young age, she was immersed in the world of artisan silver, thanks to her mother who taught her to make earrings, necklaces, rings, keychains, chokers and many other pieces.

Currently, Alma's husband is also working in the same activity. His pieces are displayed in various galleries. For them, it is not only a way to earn an income, but also an opportunity to spread their culture to other places by creating pieces which embody traditional Mazahuan figures and patterns.

The work of the family is very well-known and has the support of private institutions as well as the commercialization services of VisionFund Mexico to go to galleries, expositions and fairs. However, her challenge continues to be a lack of capital to buy tools and large quantities of silver plates, which is how she will invest this loan.

Alma's dreams, apart from increasing her sales, are to open another workshop, teach more people this activity which fills her with pride, and open her own gallery to display her exclusive designs.

*The photo was taken in the family workshop. Alma is wearing a cape, which is very traditional in the Mazahua region.*

loans.use: to buy tools and silver.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe who is 40 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Larry, a welder they have two children of which the eldest is in High School and the youngest is not yet of school age. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her child to school. 

Fe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the small store, she also sells "ukay ukay" clothes (slightly used clothes) for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business Fe is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy additional stocks of toiletries, beverages and grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and many others. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Fe hopes to maintain and grow her business to uplift their quality of life. She aims to send her child to college and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado,  vive solo. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa para la venta, la cual es para hombre y mujer al igual de diferentes tallas y estilos al igual de diferentes colores y estilos y que la calidad de las telas sea de un alto nivel para que los clientes queden satisfechos con la compra y asi ir abriendo mercado y a la vez  de este manera poderle ofrecer a toda la familia prendas de vestir y que sean de buena calidad. Ademas con un mejor surtido de mercadería piesa recorrer mas pueblos vecinos para realisar la venta Con esta inverción pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 65. He is married, but lives alone. He wants to use this loan to buy the clothing he sells, which is for both men and women. He carries different sizes, colors, and styles, and he is always looking for good quality fabrics so that his customers are satisfied with their purchases. This allows him to gradually further enter the market by offering high quality clothing for the whole family. A wider variety of clothing items will also allow him to travel to more of the nearby towns to make his sales. 

He wants to invest more in his business and achieve his goals in order to have a better quality of life in the future. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has never borrowed from any of the state banks, but FUDECOSUR offers him a loan at a much lower interest rate and easier payment terms.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 37 years old and has two children. Agustina is married and her two children are in school.

Agustina is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dionesia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years now.

Dionesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Thom province, Ren is 41 year old and a mother of three children. For her living, she earns an income via cassava growing and she does rice cropping to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 12,100 KHR per day. This is the first time for Ren with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle so it is better than it was before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, with his own car, has been providing taxi services in Gyumri town. He lives with his parents. 

Davit drives day and night to gather income for his family's living. He now needs some financial resources to invest in his car and bring it to working condition. He has applied for this loan to purchase four tires, and for partial renovation of the car. 

Davit has now applied for this loan to be able to enlarge her clothing sales business. He plans to purchase  four tires and partial renovation of the car. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for four tires and partial renovation of the car to continue providing taxi service and earn more income for the family

loans.name: Cledys Yasmin

texts.es:
Cledys, de 39 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene una hija y estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia, no pudo seguir estudiando, pero ella quiere continuar.

Cledys, trabaja en una tienda (tipo farmacia), de donde obtiene los ingresos para los gastos de la familia, su niña  está pequeña y tiene que pagarle a una cuñada para que se la cuide, mientras ella sale a trabajar.- Ella depende de una familia trabajadora, de bajos recursos económicos, pero con iniciativa propia, ella desea mejorar su casa, pero los ingresos que recibe de su trabajo, no puede mejorar su casa, porque solo le ajusta para los gastos del hogar.

Ahora Cledys, solicita el crédito para poder terminar de construir su casa, pues solo ha podido hacer las paredes y no tiene dinero para colocar el techo y está preocupada porque se acerca el invierno y teme no poder terminar.

El dinero lo invertirá para comprar teja y madera para ponerle el techo a la vivienda, considera que para ella el crédito será una gran ayuda, pues podrá mejorar las condiciones de su casa.

Sueña con tener una casa grande y que su hijia estudie y tengan un mejor trabajo que el que ella tiene.
texts.en:
Cledys, age 39, is in a relationship.  She has a daughter, and she went to school through high school. Due to her family’s financial situation, she was not able to continue her education.  However, she wants to continue it.

Cledys works in a store (pharmacy type) where she gets income for the family expenses.  Her daughter is little, and she needs to pay a sister-in-law to take care of her when she goes to work.

She is from a hard-working family with scarce financial resources.  However, she wishes to improve her house through her own initiative.  However, she is not able to improve her house with the earnings she gets from her work.  This is because her earnings only cover the household expenses.

Cledys is now requesting the loan to be able to finish building her house.  She has only been able to build the walls.  She does not have money for the roof.  She is worried because winter is coming, and she is afraid she will not be able to finish.

She will use the money to buy tile and wood to put on the roof of her house.  She believes that the loan will be a big help to her.  She will be able to improve the condition of her house.

She dreams of having a big house and of her daughter going to school and having better work than she and her life partner have.

loans.use: to be able to finish building her house.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Hector has been in the Fashion industry both as an employee and an employer. In the summer of 2014 he started his business from home and accumulated a loyal customer base. 

“The fashion industry is one of the greatest industries to be in and I love what I do,” said Hector. 

Hector owns Novedades H YJ, which operates out of Laredo, Texas. His store offers handbags and other accessories. His wife, Juanita, assists with the financial management of the business, while Hector handles the merchandising and daily operations of the business.
 
Occupying a large commercial space with easy access to the public and plenty of parking, Novedades H Y J is in a good location for attracting both new and old customers.
 
Hector needed to update the look of his new location, restoring paint and tile, but he wasn’t able to obtain a loan through a conventional bank. He came to LiftFund seeking working capital and additional funds to support the repairs of his business. “This business means everything to my family,” Hector said.
 
While Hector only employs himself and his wife, he eventually would like to hire additional part time workers to support his growing retail shop.

loans.use: to provide working capital and structural business upgrades.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some construction materials to make a necessary expansion for her house.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in hand-loomed rugs. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and dyes. Fermin has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "My two brothers and I learned to weave on a traditional loom. I was ten when I began to weave with my father and, when I was 14, I became independent. We had little looms made to our size, where we wove narrow textiles. Today, I weave rugs of wool and cotton, colored with natural and chemical dyes. I have my own workshop at home and we all weave on hand looms powered by foot pedals. I enjoy designing and weaving new rug styles, a tradition in my town handed down for generations. "Dear friends, this microcredit is truly a huge help. My wife has fallen seriously ill and I've been left with insufficient funds to weave and sell my rugs. God bless." Use the link below to view Fermin's hand-loomed rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7472

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and dyes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John owns an advisory firm which provides consulting and negotiation assistance for those making investments in pacific and northwest U.S. vineyards, wineries, and wine industry suppliers. The main focus of his business is to promote sustainable agricultural decisions. 

As the owner, John's aim is to identify agricultural properties that were once profitable, and reposition them through sustainable methods so that they become profitable business. Through this, he is able to show value in properties to potential investors particularly in the wine sector. 

John plans to use his Kiva loan for marketing, website development, and overhead expenses. John is planning to hold seminars for property owners to educate them about repositioning their business sustainability. The development of a website will allow John to recruit more leads and advertise his services. 

John is very involved in his community and loves to mentor young people to help them identify their goals and passions. 

As growth continues to happen in the wine industry, it is important for strong sources of consulting to ensure and foster sustainable growth. John will be able to provide financial consulting as well as sustainable agricultural advice to support other small business owners like him.

loans.use: with marketing, website development, and overhead expenses

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Mrs Sri, has a family of five and resides in a settlement in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most important island. In Indonesia, one cannot water from the tap, and most do not even have a tap, for that reason many Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs Sri heard of a new alternative for sterilizing water when the marketing crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water instruction session in her locality. Nazava Water Filters purify well, rain and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs Sri who is also a head of her neighborhood took the chance and became the reseller of Nazava in her quarter. This credit will allow mrs Sri to buy about 20 filters from Nazava so she sell about 20 filters on consignment to her neighbors. Making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to make safe drinking water available in her vicinity

loans.name: Rina Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower for Rina group. She joined with her other group members to take out a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They live in Mokala City, Yemen.

Fatima's house is very old and needs a lot of renovation. Unfortunately, the income of her husband, who is the sole provider for the family, is not enough. Fatima applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials to renovate the house. This loan will provide a safe living space for Fatima's family. Living in an old house is a bothersome thing for Fatima and her family. In truth, she couldn't afford this renovation without the Kiva loan. Having her friends and relatives come to her house makes her feels ashamed, but this loan will make her feel very happy and the living conditions inside the house will improve.

After finishing this loan, Fatima hopes to take another one from Kiva lenders to use to open a small business to earn money for her children.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate the house

loans.name: Mesilianne

texts.fr: Mesilianne est âgée de 46 ans. Elle vit en union libre et est mère de quatre enfants dont l’aîné fait des études universitaires et les autres sont encore au lycée. Elle vend des produits alimentaires. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle a recours au microcrédit qui lui permet à chaque fois d’augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Mesilianne, age 46, lives with a common-law partner. She has four children; the eldest is a university student, and the others are still in college. 

Mesilianne sells grocery items. She is seeking a loan to avoid a shortage of stock. Microcredits allow her to replenish her stock of merchandise whenever necessary.

loans.use: to buy bags of macaroni pasta.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water filters to help more people to get cheap and safe drinking water

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
SAYDA: Es una joven sonriente y cordial de 32 años de edad, madre soltera de 1 hija de 9 que estudia su tercer gardo de primaria. Trabaja como docente de una escuela primaria en Waspam. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como instalación del techo.  Con el préstamo va comprar madera, clavos, zinc y pagar la mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió reducir el hacinamiento y comprar materiales para iniciar a construir su vivienda de tambo y madera, ya no habita en casa de familiares
texts.en:
Sayda is a cordial and smiling young woman. She is a 32-year-old single mother with one 9 years old daughter that is in primary level education. Sayda works as a teacher at a primary school in Waspam. With great effort, she gradually started the construction of her wooden house. However, her salary was not enough to cover a few improvements, such as the installation of a roof.

With this loan, Sayda will buy wood, nails, zinc, and also pay for labor. Her dream is to have a beautiful house with safer conditions and a better environment for her children.

With her first Pana Pana loan that was financed through Kiva, Sayda was able to reduce the overcrowded conditions by purchasing the materials needed to start the construction of her wooden stilt house. As a result, she no longer lives at her relative’s house.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to install a roof on her house.

loans.name: Badawi

texts.en:
Badawi is a 26 year old owner of a barbershop located in a Palestinian refugee camp in North Lebanon. He was born and raised inside the camp and is now newly married to a young Palestinian woman from the same camp. His wife being unemployed, Badawi's revenue from the shop is the household's only source of income. 
Badawi opened his salon in early 2005 in a strategic street of the camp where he has little competition and today has more than 10 years of experience in hair dressing. Since establishing his business, he has slowly been expanding and now also sells perfumes and beauty products. He is liked by his loyal customers for his good taste and honesty in dealing with them. He is also known in the area for being active and ambitious since his young age. 
Badawi is asking for a 1,799,994 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is planning on using the loan to increase his stocks in perfumes and improve his shop's decor which is expected to attract more clients and boost his monthly revenue. 
The loan will therefore improve his household's livelihoods and allow him and his wife to start planning for their family's future.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and sell them in his salon

loans.name: Frantz

texts.fr: Frantz est âgé de 35  ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il est propriétaire d’une petite épicerie où il vend un peu de tout : produit alimentaires, produits cosmétiques, etc. Grâce aux revenus de cette activité, il arrive à prendre soin de sa famille et à faire un peu d’épargne. Il a besoin d’un microcrédit pour éviter une rupture de stock.
texts.en:
Frantz, age 35, is married with two children. He owns a small grocery store where he sells a little bit of everything: food, cosmetic products, etc. 

The income that he earns through this activity allows him to look after his family and to save a bit of money. 

He is seeking this loan to avoid a shortage of stock.

loans.use: to buy cases of cooking butter and some olive oil.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A 41 ans, Afi est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants. Afi vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Afi est une marchande de charbons de bois la devanture de sa maison. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local du quartier. Afi réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Afi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois pour gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi, age 41, is the married mother of four children. She lives in the district of Adidogomé. 

Afi sells charcoal in front of her house. She stocks up twice a month at a local market, and her activity is very profitable. 

Afi is seeking this loan to buy sacks of charcoal. This will help to bolster her profits and to support her children’s  education.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique vit en union livre. Elle a 38  ans et est mère de deux  enfants.  Elle vend des produits alimentaires depuis bientôt 6 ans. Les revenus de cette activité apportent une grande contribution aux dépenses familiales. Elle souhaite développer son commerce et est à la recherche de financement.
texts.en:
Monique, age 38, is in a common-law relationship. She has two children. She has been selling food items for almost 6 years. The income that she earns through this activity helps considerably to cover family expenses.  

She would like to expand her commercial activity, which is why she is seeking this loan.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Малика. Малике 48 лет. Она проживает вместе семьей в районе Чиликул. Старший сын Малики находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Младшие учатся в средней школе. 
Малика трудолюбивая и активная женщина. Она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Свободное время Малика занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Она много трудится, чтобы обеспечить семью и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она хочет купить минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать землю для посева урожая. Минеральные удобрения помогает получить качественный урожай, по этой причине Малика обратилась за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей зарабатывать больше и обеспечить семью. Малике очень важен это кредит.
texts.en:
The name of this woman is Malika. She is 48 years old. She lives with her family in the Jilikul district. Malika's oldest son currently works in the Russian Federation. Her younger children attend a secondary school.

Malika is a hardworking and active woman. She is involved in animal husbandry and farming. In her free time, Malika is involved in sewing women's clothing at home. She works a lot to provide for her family and improve the family's living conditions. She wants to purchase mineral fertilizers to treat the land before planting a new crop. Mineral fertilizers help with obtaining a quality harvest, and this is why Malika requested this loan. The requested loan will help her to earn more and provide for her family. This loan is very important for Malika.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lepopea

texts.en:
Lepopea is a 37-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small lawn-mowing business to earn a living. She has two years with this business.

Lepopea needs a loan to buy a new lawnmower, spark plugs, new boots, overalls, earmuffs, and safety glasses. She will use her profits to support her family financially.

Lepopea joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawnmower, spark plugs, new boots, overalls, earmuffs, and safety glasses.

loans.name: Toatele

texts.en: Toatele is 41 years old and divorced with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for eight years. Toatele has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, stencils, wooden carved designs, material and brushes. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, stencils, wooden carved designs, material and brushes

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 57-year-old married mother of seven children who has been working since twenty-one years ago in preparing "Mouneh" to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Jamal is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy raw materials, which will help her increase her production and satisfy her customers' needs.

Jamal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials which will increase her production

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Файзигулу 64 лет. Она проживает в районе Чиликул вместе мужем, сыном, невесткой и внуками. У нее не очень большая семья. Файзигул, как и многие жители района занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности она занята  более 33 лет. Файзигул хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она готовится к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее цель вспашки земли. Для вспашки она должна нанять трактор, купить топливо и оплатить услуги тракториста. На оставшиеся часть денег, она купить семена арбуза и помидора. Файзигул надеется на Вашу помощь и считает, что с Вашей помощью она сможет закончить посев и на следующий сезон собрать богатый урожай.
texts.en:
Fayzigul is 64 and lives in the Jilikul region with her husband, her son and his wife and their children. She doesn't have a very big family. Like many residents of the region, she works in agriculture, an occupation she has had for more than 33 years. She does well in her work. 

Fayzigul is preparing for spring planting and for this reason is requesting a loan. Her primary goal is to plough the land, for which she needs to rent a tractor, pay a tractor driver and purchase fuel. She will use the remaining amount of money to buy watermelon and tomato seeds. 

Fayzigul hopes for your help and believes that with your help she will be able to finish the sowing and bring in a rich harvest.

loans.use: to pay a tractor driver and to purchase watermelon and tomato seeds

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Âgée de 43 ans, madame Améyo revend des produits d'alimentation générale au marché. Avec son sixième crédit à WAGES, elle souhaite s'approvisionner en marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire les clients. Elle espère réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité, ouvrir une boutique et mieux se prendre en charge. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Aged 43, Madame Améyo sells various foodstuffs in the market. On her sixth loan from WAGES, she would like to stock up on merchandise so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers. She hopes to reinvest the supplementary profit in her business, to open up a shop, and support herself better. She is married and raising three children.

loans.use: to buy spices, onions, and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Roció Alejandra pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO, la socia continua dedicándose  a  trabajar en un jardín para niños, la socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rocio Alejandra belongs to the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. This member still works at a kindergarten. She is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments. She has been working for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business daily. This member wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy teaching materials and other items.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry, 54 years old, is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children in Garang, Tangub City. He is a farmer, focusing on rice and vegetable farming. He wants to increase his crop yield on his rice farm.  Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase a water pump for his farming operation so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase water pump for his far

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a mother of three children, married to a farmer.  

Erlinda has been engaged in banana selling for almost 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP monthly.  Erlinda plans to expand her business at the same time to make use of the vacant land that they have through planting bananas so they can increase their income and help support their basic needs.

She applied for a loan through Paglaum to pay for labor on the land preparation of banana farm. 

Erlinda hopes and prays that God blesses their banana plantation and that they can harvest more so that they can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for labor on the land preparation of banana farm

loans.name: Angeling

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Angeling is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Angeling works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company's or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as hand-stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Angeling without access to savings or credit, is meeting family expenses. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Angeling is asking for your assistance to help her avoid using loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheque. She is seeking a 8,000 PHP loan to pay for the tuition fees of her children of which two are already in college and one is in high school.

Angeling hopes to give her family a good life in the future. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equip them with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating saving consciousness, and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Angeling before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a buy and sell feeds and rice business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and rice to sell to her customers.

Delia has been in this business for six years now.

Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 47 years old and married with three children. With two children are presently in school, Marieta works very hard to provide for them.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Marieta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maribel has been in this business for 7 years now.

Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 57 years old with three children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Rubina has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks
